Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard or price”
Reviews.Author: irvingubundi
Reviews.Content: We have been timeshare owners at the Kauai Marriott Beach club for several years. Having recently purchased some points in the new Vacation Club program, we decided to stop by Maui on the way to our Kauai week to see what this resort (which is rated higher and costs more than our Kauai location) was like. Sad to say, we were disappointed. Starting with the "good" news. the accommodations (like those in the Kauai Beach Club) consist of two adjacent former hotel rooms, one fitted out as a bedroom and the other containing a limited kitchen facility with a sink, fridge and microwave but no range. The rooms were nice enough and in generally good shape. Not much difference here. The people on the reception desk and in the drive-up areas were friendly and helpful. We had a very nice chat with, and got some useful information from, the young lady who signed us up for the obligatory sales tour. The common areas, however, were depressing. Most of the shop spaces were empty and those that were occupied were unappealing both visually and in terms of content. They are located in a long atrium area that extends back from the reception desk and looks (and largely is) abandoned. If you disregard the actual reception area and the lavish spaces devoted to selling you participations in the Marriott Vacation Club, the common areas were basically a ghost town. Since we had to walk through this area to get to our rooms, we could not avoid it. The pool area is crowded and overgrown with small areas of pool snaking around through the underbrush more or less at random. There is nowhere in the area itself where the view opens out or where it is possible to swim for more than 10 feet in a straight line. In one corner of this jungle is a hokey looking pirate ship, which may be just the thing for 10-year-olds but is not up to the aesthetic standard of a first class resort. Finally, the amenities were pathetic. There is one actual restaurant (Longboards) which is open only for lunch and dinner. We did not eat there but walking by it and looking at the menu did not suggest that there was any good reason to do so. Breakfast facilities consisted of a kind of "7-11" type arrangement that you could walk into and buy prepackaged offerings, none of which looked very appetizing. There were two or three really small tables but the ambiance strongly suggested that the best alternative was to take the swill back to the room. Needless to say, we did not eat at the Marriott at all, hiking next door in both directions to the Hyatt Regency and the Westin, both of which were clearly several notches in quality above where we were staying. All in all, we had the feeling of staying at a C- or D-tier property in Las Vegas rather than a four star facility in Hawaii. The notion that this facility is rated more highly than the Kauai Beach Club (which we absolutely love) leads us to conclude that either we or the folks at Marriott are missing several screws. If we thought that this was what we had bought into in investing in the Vacation Club, we would be looking to sell our points for whatever we could get for them. So far, this facility seems aberrational in the Vacation Club portfolio but it makes us nervous for the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paula H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our friends and it's just beautiful, lots of amenities, very nice hotel. a piece of heaven. views were breathe taking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Bubba3040
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect with walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. The facility was great as well as the grounds and pool. The one problem is the bath towels are very thin and rough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDiverMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Maui on Monday March 5th. We stayed at the Marriott and had a wonderful time. The location is just great -- far enough away from all the action but close enough to go the Whalers Village many times. We were in a 2 bedroom/2bath unit -- full kitchen, lots of space. The grounds at the Marriott are very spacious so you have plenty of room to spread out. Everything is very clean and the staff was helpful. Since we were in the timeshare we had our own beverages, there are not many wait staff around the pool and were slow do to the distance to the bar so we just took care of ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: annkr
Reviews.Content: We exchanged into Maui Ocean Club to a 2 bedroom, 3 bath unit on the 5th floor or the Lanai building. While quite spacious, it did not have a full kitchen, and was rather worn and in need of upgrading. (which had been scheduled) The three balconies were very narrow, but we did have an ocean view from the balcony, although the unit was listed as "Mountain View" since the ocean could not be seen from inside. The rest of the resort was very nice. We especially enjoyed the lounges on the grass facing the ocean near Lanai, as they were not close together and more relaxing than around the main pool. We watched gorgeous sunsets every night from there, or from one of the restaurants a five minute walk away. After driving to Hana, my husband especially enjoyed being able to walk to many nearby oceanfront restaurants. Although our first love is Kauai, we had a great time in Maui and would return to Maui Ocean Club.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Sunset”
Reviews.Author: sunvssnow
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort four times. Our son (14yrs old) has been here twice. My son describes the sunset as WOW! Can you hear the sun sizzle into the water. After a 9.5 hour flight you want relaxation. You will not be disappointed. The check-in is quick. The rooms have recently been remodeled. Your are only a few steps away from the ocean and a view of a life time. The pool bar is well staffed and drinks are flowing really smooth. My wife will only drink a Lava Flow in Maui. Just remember one thing while in Maui "Slow Down and Enjoy."

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ........ But Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: Tarlok M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location in 2011, I looked at the Pictures everything looked new and the View was amazing, so I went ahead and booked a I bedroom Ocean View room, I was disappointed when I got to the Hotel, It was nothing like they show it in the pictures, It was old dated and I have a better Ocea view from my house then that place, Beds were real old, It was a major Wow factor..... especially when you brag to your wife that it was brand new great location Ocean view but none of that was in that dingy Tower, So I went down and spoke to the front desk and asked for there help, they were not helpful so I had to call the General Manager and left her a long message on her Voice mail and after 2 hours of disappointment we decided to move to the Westin Next door as we called the front desk to ask them for the Bell hop as we were disappointed by the false advertising and state of the I bedroom with no kitchen which was an important part because of my child, Now we were waiting for the bell hop but a surprice call came from the Manager and she appologized for the mix up and moved us to Napili tower, a brand new tower with amazingly excellent rooms and Kitchen verything was what you expect from an upscale resort and she offerd us an Ocean front Villa, It was excellent and I could see the smile on my wifes face, we stayed there for a week my son loved all the pools especially one with the ship, Beach was great, Lots of Hemicks to rest and enjoy the cool breeze, Nice resturants and very trendy market place with upscale shops and activities, We enjoyed it very much and I will STRESS make sure you book your reservation in new towers or you will be disappointed. GREAT MANGER...... great location excellent resort...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: l33anna
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Maui was from 2/9-2/19. My husband and I didn't start our vacation @ the Marriot, but when we got there on our 2nd day, we were so excited because the place was just AWESOME! We stayed in a 1-bedroom suite with an attached living space. It was great because there was a pull out bed for our dad. They provided everything we needed including a dishwasher as well as the dishes and silverware. Since we were there for our Grandma's 80th Birthday and the family spent alot of time together, the Marriott was the perfect place because they had BBQ's set up throughout so we could cook, a kiddie pool area for the two young ones, a separate adult pool area and several spa tubs. PLUS the ocean is right there! Although it was pretty crowded at times, I never felt like I was squeezed in somewhere. I love the open air feel of the resort. The restaraunts were a little pricey, but we just went grocery shopping instead for meals. I loved that Whaler's Village was just a short walk away. Black rock beach was a great place to snorkel also. Back to the resort, the bed was comfy, they had free wi-fi, and we could watch T.V. after a long day of exploring. It was the perfect vacation. Wish I could be back sooner rather than later!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family”
Reviews.Author: roanth
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 3-year old stayed one week here. It's perfect for a family, one room family space where my daughter slept and the one room is a traditional king sized bed. The pirate ship is beyond awesome for this age. Perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: CDub78
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a three bedroom ocean front on the quiet side of the hotel. Everything was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Good for family”
Reviews.Author: tom d
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there twice. It has nice amenities for the kids. Great pool. Cons are the beds are very uncomfortable, the restaurant Longboards is very over priced for mediocre food. The staff is helpful and friendly. It is pricey for the stay. We will not be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous location, great service”
Reviews.Author: ALubov
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located on a great strip of beach, this Marriott does not disappoint. The main decor and rooms are a bit dated, but a lot of updates have been made recently, keeping the hotel on par with any others around it. Lahaina is a wonderful place to stay in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Great place & amenities”
Reviews.Author: 84125Kathy
Reviews.Content: We rented a time share condo; 2 bedrooms, 3 baths for our family of 5. We were on the 9th floor, ocean front; which is best for whale watching. Great beds and the sleeper sofa had a memory foam top. The amenities, (swimming pools, hot tubs, bar, etc..) were awesome. we especially enjoyed and utilized the beach scuba activities. My son was PADI certified through Mike there and we are very pleased with his experience. Wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place wonderful pool”
Reviews.Author: EdBear55
Reviews.Content: I don't think you can do better than a stay at this property. Great ambience, large rooms -- some with full kitchen, some with microwave, dishwasher only. Lots of BBQs and outdoor eating tables. Wonderful staff that constantly displays the aloha attitude. Book a room now in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing 2 weeks”
Reviews.Author: CTSantiago
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 weeks relaxing by the ocean. Clean and well kept timeshare. Staff is very thoughtful, from checkin to checkout. Cleaning staff very courteous and go extra mile. Concierge staff very helpful and informative. Right on the ocean, and easy to use public transportation. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but turn down the offer to buy”
Reviews.Author: Kane K
Reviews.Content: High pitch sales job to purchase into the "Club" was the only downside of this lovely resort. Poolside lunch dining is great. Location is great. Very nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Ka'anaplai Beach walking path!”
Reviews.Author: divearnd
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Maui Ocean Club, formally a Marriott Hotel, now converted to a timeshare property. The property has four towers. The towers on each end of the property are newer and contain suites with full kitchens while the older towers in the center of the property contain suites with mini kitchens (microwave, mini-refrigerator, coffee maker, toaster and blender, there is no stove or stove top). We stayed in a one bedroom in one of the older towers. Bedroom was large with a comfortable king bed, bathroom and large screen flat TV. We overlooked one of the pools and had a partial view of the ocean. Living room/kitchen area had a comfortable sleeper sofa, bathroom and a smaller flat screen TV. The units were quite. Not once did we hear any noise from adjoining units or units above us. There is a large gym facility open 24 hours. Use room key for access. There is a free laundry facility on site. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. We had two maintenance issues and those issues were addressed within minutes of our call. This resort only has one restaurant, Longboards, which is only open for supper, however, there is a full service Starbucks on site and restaurant facilities at surrounding resorts and the Whalers Village are an easy walk away. We did attend the timeshare sales presentation and found the sales rep to be very friendly and not pushy. Just south of Ka'anapli Beach is Lahaini with it's shopping, restaurants and boat harbour. We ate a some great places - The Plantation House, Merriman's, Hula grill, Leliani's, Kimos, Dukes.

Reviews.Title: “We love Marriott Maui Ocean club!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle393
Reviews.Content: We love Maui and love the Marriott! Its always clean and the people are very friendly. We've been coming here almost 5 yrs now and can hardly wait to come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: KristiePlus3
Reviews.Content: For the price, you don't get much - there are better deals on the island. Thought the staff was very snooty and rude, especially the security people - I called to report my daughter's cut foot from sliding down the kiddie-pool slide (she landed in the pebbles at the bottom and something down there sliced the bottom of her foot open!) They must have thought I was out for something, because they got very defensive and tried to put the blame on me. Really! I simply reported it so they could check for sharp objects so it didn't happen to anyone else, despite me telling them that over and over they kept telling me it was her fault. Sad what this world is coming to, but I expected much better facilities and service based on the price of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: balajivk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in Nov '11. This is a great hotel for families with young kids. The Pirate ship, the beach and the pool can keep you and your kids occupied for a long time. Do note that the beach in this area of town is quite small although the beach in front of Marriott is shorter than that in front of other properties. The view & the experience can be quite spectacular if you can get one of the ocean front rooms. There are a variety of different rooms here and some only offer partial kitchens. So, please check in advance and plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: wgt_esg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Ocean club in May 2009 and can honestly say it has been our best vacation to date. The grounds are beautiful and our room was large, with plenty of amenities and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Not all the property is up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: strawberryroan
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott timeshare owners and have been for over 10 years. In that time, we've traded to many different locations and have always had excellent accommodations. We expected the same in Maui; however, we were given a suite in a portion of the property which used to be a hotel. We were told it was a one-bedroom, which we agreed to, but we had requested ocean side and what we got was "propane tank view". We were extremely unhappy and after several conversations with the management, we were given some satisfaction, We spent very little time in the unit, partially because we could not use the "balcony" due to the noise from the air handling units. We were also not advised that the suites do not have cooking facilities. My recommendation when going to this property is to be sure you know what type of unit you'll be assigned. As for the property, pools are nice, beach is great, it's right on the beach walk, and they have a Starbucks on the property!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: kma837
Reviews.Content: I own a timeshare at this property and I truely enjoy my visits there. The staff is great, the units are lovely, stylish, and always up to date. I love the Marketplace Beachwalk which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner and has received an "Ono" from the travel guide "Maui Revealed". If you decide to attend a timeshare presentation you will not find any pushy sales representatives.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: DallasMom1
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here two times so far - and loved it! The first time we took our then 18 month old -- the second time our family had expanded and the kids were 4 and almost 2 years old .... the kids play area (at the pool) is perfect. We were able to relax by the kids pool, order cocktails and supervise the children without a lot of extra effort. The poolside service is great, the endless refill cups you can buy at the poolside shop are perfect for coffee, ice tea and soda. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with a kitchen which was key - we were able to prepare breakfasts and lunches in our room. We took advantage of the BBQs down by the pool area to grill dinner some nights. The location on Kaanapali Beach is ideal. This is the perfect family resort. We love it and can't wait to go back with our (now) 3 children.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: joeGov
Reviews.Content: Typical for a Marriott propertyâ€”they are just top of the line with fantastic rooms and grounds. Ice machines on odd number floors. Pool food good. No free coffee in lobby as other hotels have. I hear Starbucks is opening up a shack near the pool however. Nice grills on property to cook your own dinners, but people start getting to those outdoor grills by 5 pm. You need to stand by an area out of site and wait till one opens up. By 6:45 usually they are all freed up. Fitness center is all you would wantâ€”trust me. Apples in the lobby. If you are from the East Coast (US mainland) way too long of a trip. Maui and other Islands are for those folks west of the Mississippi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual”
Reviews.Author: kborn2shop1
Reviews.Content: We have owned our timeshare here since 2002. The best investment we have ever made. We are never disappointed and have a fantastic time each and every time we go. Kannappali beach is a great location and the perfect setting in paradise. We just returned from another wonderful family vacation. Many life long memories. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Not what we bought!! Feels like a bait and switch.”
Reviews.Author: Dr D
Reviews.Content: When we were in Maui 1/2010 we purchased additional points from this resort. We have been Marriott Time share owners for almost 30 years. The unit we were shown was beautiful! Full kitchen, laundry and beautiful view. When we booked or trip and reserved our room, we needed 2, 2 bedroom units because we were taking out staff to a conference there. The view was not as important so we choose to save a few thousand points and take the mountain view. When we reserved we were told the full units were the same, the only difference was the view. No problem. When we checked in we again verified full kitchen and were told yes. The rooms were not quite ready so we ran to the Safeway close by and stocked up on breakfast and lunch items. When we got into our room, we found it to me much less than expected! NO full kitchen - A small under the counter college dorm refrigerator, none of which worked; and nothing to cook on. So we had 3 dozen eggs and breakfast meats and no way to cook them. We attempted to resolve the problem and our salesman totally threw us under the bus. We had booked with him, but he was off and so on the second day, they called him. He told the management that we said this and that and got exactly what we asked for!! Needless to say, we have ben very dissappointed. NO full Kitchen, 3 college dorm refrigerators are now in our room, a view of the parking garage and garbage area off the lving dining area. If it was possible to get our money back, we would. VERY VERY VERY dissappointed! We love Marriott, but buyer beware. This resort will tell you what you want to hear and then you are STUCK with what you get upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to be top-notch”
Reviews.Author: toastytravels
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here and I have to say, it is one of the best properties in the Marriott Vacation Club collection that I've stayed at. Great, genuinely friendly staff and good accommodations. My only surprise is that the rooms (at least in the Molokai Tower) still do not have WiFi. There are wired internet cables but if you brought your ipad, you're out of luck unless you head out to the lobby. Honestly, though, I barely consider that to be a big issue when you compare it to the service and quality of views from the ocean front rooms. Sometimes resorts play games with view categories and "ocean front" is not exactly "ocean front." Well, in the Molokai tower (one of the older towers, so less of the kitchenette amenities), the ocean front room is right up against the ocean. I've really never been so close to the actual ocean in an ocean front room anywhere and it's amazing, in my opinion. I stayed here under my timeshare privileges so I can't speak to the price. Lots of plumeria trees on the property which gives it that wonderful "Hawaiian scent" that wafts all around you. Special kudos to Wayne and Mary Grace in the Marketplace for being exceptional with their service and Emiko, a masseuse at the beach cabanas and in the spa, remains one of the most gifted healers I have ever met. Katherine, Gene and Kyle in the sales department were stand-outs as well! I wish I could live at this property; truly.

Reviews.Title: “Super location,average hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldhoundusvn
Reviews.Content: On the beach,love the beach sidewalk,good bbq area,easy parking access,close to a lot Of shopping areas.Pool area always busy.My room was old but functional.Kind of overprice but this is Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the family”
Reviews.Author: Archi-Traveler72
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for a weekend and had more fun than i thought we'd have at a time-share type resort. I know Maui very well so I picked the Marriott for price and location. There are two faces to this resort, one for timeshare members and one for guests like a hotel. There are also different room types. The two older towers serve as the main entrance and surround the super pool. These rooms are typically 1 bedroos and are converted old hotel rooms with kitchenettes. No stove or formal dining area in these but the bedrooms are very spacious and you get two or more bathrooms! The other towers are custom built for timeshares and are 2-3 bedroom with full modern kitchens. Still more The grounds are beautiful along with the pools. Ample number of chairs around the pool or on the lawn. It was especially nice to have some large lawn areas for the kids to run or just play a game. Not many resorts have this much open space. Biggest complaint might be about the dining selections. Forget the marketplace unless you're desperate and don't have anything in the room to eat. Too much money for the food you get. Longboards looked decent and not that expensive for ocean-front dining. My favorite is still Hula's at the Whaler's Shopping Village just a 5 minute walk away. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. Rooms were comfortable with large lanais. As of December 2011, the rooms had undergone a full interior renovation. We stayed in one of the older rooms but they should all be fully renovated by now! Overall a good bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very family friendly!!!”
Reviews.Author: ConstanTraveler77
Reviews.Content: You can bring the kids here and know that there will be plenty of things to do, and lots of stuff to explorer. The pool is very cool, and the place was recently renovated, so everything is fresh and bright. You have to try their Straw-lada non-alcoholic drink. It is to die for! The beach is nice and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: amc10
Reviews.Content: Close to Lahaina and very pretty but very crowded with freezing pools and an obsession with towels! I hate a place that counts my towels...PERIOD! Large complex that I could not return my towels because Marriott personell had taken all the towel cards from the station so I had to walk to the other end to return them to get my get out of towel jail cards! And no Leis???? Definitely no Aloha here.....just sayin....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family resort”
Reviews.Author: Marzullo
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place was great. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The service was excellent. The resteraunts had good food. Three pools for the kids. We rented a cabana on the beach and were treated to cool towels and water with food delivered right to the beach. There were shops at the resort that carried just about anything you could ask for. The property was right on the beach. Great place for a honeymoon or family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, again”
Reviews.Author: frugalguy
Reviews.Content: This is our second time here and once again this place delivers. Everything you need in a large scale resort (although these are all timeshares now). Right on the beach and plenty of activities or just lounge by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel on a great beach!”
Reviews.Author: mina m
Reviews.Content: Marriott's Maui Ocean Club is a great place for a family with older or younger kids. I wouldn't recommend it for couples who are looking for a remote, romantic, "no-kids" get away. We stayed in an ocean view suite in the Malokai Towers which I highly recommend. We had a great view of the beautiful pool and grounds as well as the ocean! The suite, which had just been renovated is designed perfectly for a family with 1 King in the bedroom, 1 pull out sofa in the living room, 2 bathrooms, a 4-person dining table, and a kitchen , which has everything except a stove and stovetop. The multiple BBQ grills conveniently spread around the property are perfect for when you want to take a break from eating out and all the hammocks make you really feel like you're on vacation. The beach is great, but there are some rocks in the water. It's much better if you walk a little ways towards the Sheraton and Black Rock where there is excellent snorkeling and rock jumping! For shopping and dinner, you can walk just couple minutes to Whaler's Village. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Maui Ocean Front Property”
Reviews.Author: DLittman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Marriott's Maui Ocean Club at least seven or eight times. Marriott keeps this hotel and time share in top shape, replacing and updating every 4-5 years. The grounds are lush and well kept. The Club is located on Kaanapali Beach, a beautiful stretch on ocean on West Maui. The typical Marriott friendliness and attentiveness is present. When you stay in an ocean front suite, you are on the ocean. There are kids' programs. The Wellness program is the best, with water exercises, low back, shoulder and strength and conditioning being offered by very skilled and caring personnel every week day. We have done this program at the Marriott Ko'Olina resort as well as this one and both are top flight.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss...”
Reviews.Author: sindhuja_raman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here this October on our (verrry late) honeymoon and this place rocks! Hawaii is known for its beaches and blue waters and this place has numerous pools and the beach sand is just a few feet away.. We stayed in an ocean front room. Unlike other hotels that promise an Ocean front room and have you ending up watching the beach from a mile away, this one got it bang on.. it was a magical experience to sleep listening to the sound of the waves in the night.. You wake up in the morning to a cabana filled beach front.. The front desk is really helpful. The hotel property itself is picture perfect. Chances are you might never want to step out of the hotel here...

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort with Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: SoCali
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip and even with my high-hopes and jaded view of the resort due to the endless research on the internet, I was pleasantly surprised. We stayed in the Molokini tower in a newly refurbished 2-bedroom with oceanfront view for 6 days. I will try to break this review down in parts for easy reading. Location: It cannot be beat if you are staying in West Maui. We went to three different beaches to snorkel and the best snorkel spot was smack in front of our hotel. Just walk out from the pool on the path past the food/area and bam - best snorkel spot for turtles. My husband and friends encountered HUGE turtles (3 to be exact) about 20 ft from the beach. It was amazing. Watch out for early morning surfers! There are not many restaurants at the hotel but we ate at the pool a few times and thought it was good. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance from the hotel (Whaler's Village) or a short car ride away (Front St.). Room: Yes - the new couches and pillows are hard and uncomfortable but were not in Maui to sit on couches but when we used the couches for the pull out beds...oh my, these pull out bed mattresses are far better than what I slept on growing up and are similar to the expensive memory foam type beds. Our room view was amazing. The living room and one of the bedrooms had full ocean view and the 2nd bedroom had a view of the pool and ocean. We spent a lot of time out on the lanai enjoying the view then in the actual room during sunrise and sunset. We did have 3 bathrooms which we utilized to the fullest extent since the water pressure to one of the shower heads in one of the rooms was weak. The bathrooms had plenty of towels and extra towels can be found in the cabinets underneath the sink. The mini-kitchen was okay - wish there was a stove but we got by okay considering we had 4 kids with us. Pool: Plenty of space, variety, hardly packed, fast fun water-slide, lots of hot tubs, and fun for the kids. My small complaint is that they use gravel in the pirate area which wasn't fun to walk on especially for small tender kiddo feet. I suggest that they replace the gravel with sand or take it out all together. Construction/Parking: I saw construction people but did not see the actual construction or hear or was bothered by any of it. I guess we were very lucky. As for parking, I am just happy I wasn't the one driving. The parking spaces were tight...you've been warned. Overall: Huge thumbs up for this resort for families with kids. Way to go Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable location”
Reviews.Author: SebastianDallas
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite in the two-story older part of the property. We (4 adults) were very comfortable. Lovely views of the mountains. Small kitchenette suitable for doing breakfast and coffee. Easy access to the great pool and the beach. Parking was free adjacent to our building. This was a great affordable choice for the Kaanapali hotel region. Some of our party stayed in the newer villas and liked them very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, but too many sales solicitations!”
Reviews.Author: dfan44
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love this resort and just recently returned for a second vacation here. In my opinion, they have the best location along Kaanapali Beach. The pool areas and beach views are great, especially on the Napili Tower side. They have a huge oceanfront lawn with plenty of chairs and hammocks and the sunset views are always stunning. My only complaint is that they are way over the top on the "vacation ownership" solicitations. They have people stationed at the elevator entrances and towel stands, and every 50 or so yards along the beach walk. We were solicited at least five times each day (plus three different calls to our room) with the same question - "Have you scheduled your vacation ownership viewing yet?" I guess we could have said yes the first time and faked interest for a discounted snorkel trip, but that's not our style. We want to come back, but do not want to face the constant pressure to become vacation owners, so will consider other options for our next Hawaii trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families or first time visitors.”
Reviews.Author: beachboy
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare for a week in Ka'anapali. Marriott is predictable. You know what level of quality to expect and can sometimes be pleasantly surprised by over-delivery. The rooms are spacious and clean. They were going thru a refurb and we got a newly finished room-quite pleasant. In fact, wife and I agreed that we could have easily gotten by with less space. Having said that, the Maui Ocean Club is an almast perfect place for a multi-generational vacation. A Hawaiin vacation is all about the pools and the beaches. Maui Ocean Club has that down. There are what seem to be acres of pools, waterfalls, bridges and ponds to explore. There is a large pirate ship for the little kids. The beach is right there and there are a variety of places to enjoy the sun. Kaanapali Beach is populated by the big resort chains and is secure and clean. No problem in my mind to cut the teens loose for a few hours. There are plenty of activities for all ages. There are several excellent restaurants within a 10 minute beach walk. Night life-albiet-slightly tame can be found nearby. Highly recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: rettbergj
Reviews.Content: The best place I've ever stayed. This is a ten. I spent a week at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club and would recommend it to everyone looking for a great resort experience. The staff, the room the view, (I even had the Island View) was spectacular. Great Beach, great pools, great dinning. This is what I want when I go to Hawaii. The only only complaint was the parking for the Napaili Building was very limited, but a parking garage was available at the other end of the property.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best vacations”
Reviews.Author: Suntaug
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 16 month old baby spent the 1st week of October here. We stayed in a two-bedroom first floor oceanfront unit (it was a 3 bedroom but the 3rd bedroom was locked off) in the Napilli Villas. It was way beyond our wildest expectations - gorgeous unit and lanai and a beautiful property. All the staff we interacted with were five star friendly. We typically travel to small islands and rent homes so we were nervous about how we'd feel in a "timeshare" resort. Needless to say, we were very impressed. We are going to try our next vacation at another Marriott Resort if we can snag a great unit on Interval. Bravo Ocean Club - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Okay but won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Joburg_Export
Reviews.Content: We checked in here for the last couple nights of our holiday on Maui, and were disappointed overall with our experience. We prefer personal service, and this hotel does not offer it or does not offer it well. The hotel itself is nice, and rooms were comfortable, but we were put off by the staff interactions and lack of food options at the resort. When we were checking in, the staff would not allow us to use the luggage carts at the reception (for "insurance reasons"). Instead, we had to valet our luggage and then park at the far end of the resort and wait on our luggage to be delivered. This service took a long time, and cost us as well. The 2nd day of our stay, while we were out, a whole slew of items were delivered to our room (cot, blankets, pillows) that were not requested and were likely intended for another guest due to arrive in another room. When I called the front desk to have someone come and remove these items, we waited about 15 minutes for a staff member to arrive. When he did, he asked me if I was sure if I had not asked for these (are you kdding me - do you see a baby in the room?), and then told me it was housekeeping's fault and then proceeded to call housekeeping from our room and tell them to come and get these items. I was ready to put everything out on the floor in the hallway myself at that point. Staying in a 4 star hotel, we expected that while there can be mistakes, that service would have been polished and professional. The other disappointment here was the food quality and options at the cafe. My comment is that they consider adding more healthy and fresh items, and gluten free options to cater to the growing amount of celiac travellers. Beach was okay, but we drove to other ones that were less crowded.

Reviews.Title: “True paradise inside and out!”
Reviews.Author: starrinc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club from early November, which is the best time of year for Maui. Our vacation started in the Lahaina tower which is one of the two newer towers. The second week was in the Molakai tower which is simply the best! It is the original structure from when the villas were hotel rooms, but that is a distant memory. The villas have again been renovated and remodeled. New carpet, paint, appliances and furniture. They did a beautiful remodel. The villa is comfortable and the bed is incredible. Our villa is oceanfront and you can hear the ocean waves even with the door closed! The views are unreal, you are really close and the two balconies are huge. We had a big cushy chaise out there, two chairs and a table - the second and third floor have the largest balconies. You could have a party out there - that large. The sun is blazing on the balcony from noon on. Amazing! The villa was spotless, as was the balcony and the resort as a whole. From the pools to the common areas to the laundry area - it is the cleanest, neatest resort. The staff is so friendly and welcoming. You truly feel at home from the moment you check in. I would recommend this resort to anyone that needs a written guarantee for perfection. Perfect paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Ocean/Sunset View”
Reviews.Author: Wiseeagle
Reviews.Content: We stayed two weeks (Oct - Nov 2010) in a one bedroom, two bath suit with an excellent ocean view. We could her the waves crashing below us. It was heavenly. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. They had been trained well. The concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful. The suite was very roomy. The room had a microwave, dishwasher, small refrigerator and utensils. The bed was outstandingly comfortable. Two flat screen TV's with DVDs. The rooms were just remodeled and updated. We had two balconies which were divine. The gym was outstanding. The free parking wasn't so great; you had to walk a few minutes to get there. We loved the place so much we purchased six weeks of timeshare units. We purchased those weeks on the resale market, not from Marriott. We paid about 30% of what the Marriott is selling them for. We are going back for six weeks every year.

Reviews.Title: “Two weeks of paradise”
Reviews.Author: blgarry
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Maui Ocean Club for two weeks. The first week was in the Lahaina Tower with a mountain view. The room was very nice, with two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a full kitchen. The view was nice as well, we were towards the top floor so we weren't able to see the parking structure below us. The second week we stayed in the main hotel building (can't remember the name). It was a two bedroom three bath with a partial kitchen. This room was an ocean view that overlooked the pool. It was very nice to sit out on the lanai every morning and have breakfast. This room was a little dated and was scheduled for a remodel the week we left. Everything was in great shape and well taken care of though. The staff was very friendly and courteous the whole time we were there. The hotel is in a great spot with plenty of shopping and restaurants nearby. The pool area is amazing, especially if you have kids. You do have to get down there pretty early though if you want a good lounge chair, they seem to get "saved" pretty quickly. The only downside was the beach had moved to the condo's next door. I was told this happens and wasn't really a big deal. They were doing some room renovations while we were there but it was mostly on the inside and didn't affect our trip. Overall was a great trip at a great hotel. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to take a family”
Reviews.Author: toothnet
Reviews.Content: We stay in a 2 bedroom in the Napili tower. The location is great, right on the beach. Has wonderful pools. My only complaint would be an earlier check in time.

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home”
Reviews.Author: NorCal-traveler08
Reviews.Content: We are owners at MOC and loved our recent visit. We stayed in the newly re-decorated Moloka'i tower. We brought friends and since we only have a one bedroom they slept on the new pull-out sofa bed. What a huge improvement the new beds are. They have a flat base(without springs jamming into your back) and a regular memory foam mattress. The new decor is "island style" with warm colors. We loved the new table with 4 chairs instead of the bench seat. The new headboard in the master suite is beautiful and the chaise is great. The kitchen and bathrooms were updated with new paint and shower curtains but the cabinets, tile and marble are the same. The property is fabulous--so clean and well cared for. It is right on Kaanapali Beach(best beach in Maui) The staff was great-very helpful. There is construction going on in the Lanai tower for the next month but we didn't hear any noise during our stay. The 4 pools are great with plenty of chairs to sit on. We love to sit in front of the Lahaina building close to the beach walk and watch the paddle boarders. We had dinner at Longboards one night(Marriott gives a $20 coupon) and I had the best Maui onion soup ever. We also BBQ'd one night and sat in one of the outdoor tables and chairs for a fun evening dinner in. Some of our favorite things from this trip: We love to walk down to Whalers Village(just take the beach walk) and eat at our favorite places-Hula Grill or Leilani's. It you haven't had Hula Pie you need to order some. We also discovered the Plantation House in Kapalua. The views are spectacular and the food was wonderful. We rented snorkel gear at Maui Dive Shop. Spend the extra money and get the deluxe equipment with the two way valve it makes a huge difference($24.95 for a week). We didn't have good luck with snorkeling this trip. The water was too murky. We tried several places(Honolua Bay, Airport Beach, Po'olenalena Beach in Makena) but the best was Black Rock right down the beach walk from our hotel in front of the Sheraton. We even swam with a turtle for about 15 minutes. The other really cool thing we did was go to the Nakalele blowhole and the Olivine Pools. These are a "don't miss"and the best thing is they are free. The the other really cool thing to do is Warren and Annabelle's. Warren is the best slight of hand magician I have ever seen and he is so funny. I know what you are thinking "not another cheesy magic show". You will not be disappointed and you will be talking about how did he do things for days. We have been 4 times now and it is by far the best and most entertaining show on the island. We love to take people who have never been and watch their faces. Can you tell we love Maui we can't wait to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Ocean Club= Relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: carribeanprincess66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just recently, in a 2 bedroom/2 bath condo. Very nice complex, our room was large and well laid out, granite counters, stainless steel appliances, and washer and dryer. It was very quiet when we were there, lots of beach chairs by the pool and cabanas by the ocean available. The staff here is wonderful, special kudos to Maureen, she works at the cabanas on the beach. Very nice lady. There is a great kids area, pools and play grounds. The beach right in front of the resort is narrow, and rocky, but farther down towards the sheraton is deeper and sandier. For swimmers and people who snorkel, this is a nicer area. Kaanapali is a quiet place, not much nightlife, so more suited for those who want to relax and families that are staying there for the beach and pools. Not a lot of restaurants on the strip and can be pricey, but with a condo, u can cook for yourself and save money. This was my 3rd trip to this resort and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location + Good Hotel = Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: dt12201
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is a timeshare hotel, but that does not distract from the experience. The hotel has 2 different room types Villas and Tower Rooms. The Villas are newer and have a full kitchen and updated deco. The Tower rooms are converted hotel room, but only have a small fridge, microwave, sink and dishwasher. This time we stayed in a 2 bedroom tower room and enjoyed the place with a second couple. The 3 pools on the property are large and have plenty of room to spread out. Since this was our second stay on the property we decide to bypass the timeshare presentation, since we had done the dog and pony show in the past. The location on Kaanapali beach is great and is within walking distance to the Whaler's Village (Shops/Restuarants) and down the beach to Black Rock for snorkeling. The beach in front of the resort is small, but as you head north it get alot bigger. We had spent a few days at the beach and by the pool, other days were spent off the resort. Overall the resort is good and the facilities are wonderful. Happy hour at Longeboards in the hotel was wonderful and we always had great service and enjoyed the sunsets.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Kevnzworld
Reviews.Content: I spent two weeks at the Marriott Maui ocean club in September. I stayed in the Lahaina tower . The room was clean and in excellent shape given that its 5 years old. The kitchen is big, modern and complete. The BBQ area is small, crowded and stuck in the back adjacent to the parking garage. The pool for the Lahaina tower is small, and has limited shaded lounges so reserve your spot early! The bigger pool is at the old original timeshare. It too is packed. Lunch is limited to the little takeout spot, no ambiance and just basic eats. There isn't a real nighttime bar long either. This place is huge given the two newer 12 story towers, and the food is limited. Longboards is only open for dinner, and is ok. It seems like all of the good hotel area is taken up by the sales roaches. Trust me....they are trying to sell you timeshare deals, points anything, and constantly. They call you before you arrive, they email you, they welcome packet and call your room. They greet you when you walk down the path. It feels like one big sales effort 24/7. It's a shame because the property is nice. They could use more services like a lunch restaurant, another dinner option, a nice place for a drink etc. But they would have to give up the sales pavillions so I guess that won't happen Lastly, the gym is good...modern bright and clean. Walk down to Tropica or Hula grill for a good dinner. Keep your towel cards, no card no towel. On checkout day beware, your key card won't open your door after 10 am.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property - but where's the beach?!”
Reviews.Author: moxie990
Reviews.Content: The Ocean Club is truly a gorgeous property with friendly staff and pretty much every amenity you could ask for, but I found the lack of a beach to be a bit disappointing. The rooms are very nicely appointed with a full kitchen, 6 top dining room table, couch, two chairs, etc. There was four of us in a 1 bedroom suite, so we utilized the pull out bed from the couch. As far as pull-outs go, it was pretty good. No huge bars or anything, but it's noisy and not nearly as comfortable as the actual bed - but that is definitely to be expected - so no knocks there!! As nice as the room is, the real luxury is just the ground itself. There are hammocks strewn about all over the property, which seem to get the most use early in the morning. Plenty of lounge chairs to go around too. Didn't have any problems finding places to sit, but we also were off property most of the day exploring Maui. Food at Longboards was fantastic and the live music gave a really great ambiance. Food at the marketplace was ok. Only had one breakfast there and the food came out just warm, not hot. Very simply prepared, but what can you really expect from eggs and bacon?? My only complaint is the beach. It's probably due to the way the breaks hit the beach, but there is virtually no beach to speak of. At most, it was about 5 to 10 feet wide, and the real issue is that to try to get into the water you have to fight massive amounts of rocks. Down where the surf lessons take place they've cleared those rocks away, but why not the rest of the property? Some of the other hotels / timeshares along the same stretch of beach essentially created their own beach areas by putting sand where the Ocean Club has grass & some hammocks. It's a trade off as you are equally close to the water, but at Ocean Club you feel decidedly separate from it despite how close you are. Of course, this is Maui and just a short drive away we were snorkeling and swimming in some of the most spectacular water I've ever seen - but it was disappointing to have such a lack of summable beach at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ocean front experience”
Reviews.Author: PetalumaTraveler
Reviews.Content: We are owners in the older building and traded through Interval International for one of the newer buildings. We had a very early flight out of Oakland and arrived at the hotel around 11 am. We had requested early check-in, but didn't expect the room to be ready. This is the fifth year in a row we have come here and this is the first time I really have any kind of complaint. The front desk people were a tad unfriendly. When I asked for a "ball park" time our room might be ready, we were told it was guaranted for 4:00 pm and they could not give us an earlier estimate. I asked if they could just tell us if housekeeping had started to clean the room and they refused. We went down to Lahaina for breakfast (Lulus) and came back. We got our bathing suits out of our luggage and went to the pool area. I finally called back at 2:30 and got the same robot response of no room guarateed before 4:00 pm. I was getting a bit frustrated and probably exhausted by this time, but they called us back at 3:00 to say the room was ready. And what a room! It was an ocean front on the 4th floor of the Lahaina building. Just spectacular. It was a 2 bedroom that could be a 3 bedroom if you included the lock off. The view was amazing and the room was so worth the wait. We feel like we are coming home when we come here, so it is totally relaxing. We had drinks and fish tacos at the Hyatt and watched the sunset. Drinks at dinner at Leilani's at Whaler's Village. Dinner at Pacifico in Lahaina. (First time there; it was very good). A very pricey lunch at Mama's (what can I say? It was delicious, but too much money). Brunch at the Plantation. Lunch at Cheesburger in Paradise. We love the location of this resort. We hardly use the car. Totally relaxing. The vallets are great. The bartenders at the pool bar have been there forever and remember your drinks. Just a week in paradise. We'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a bit of a hassle....”
Reviews.Author: XboxMeister
Reviews.Content: Booked here for an extra few days in paradise after staying at the Hyatt for a week. Booked 3 nights thru expedia in the villas (1 bedroom). When I arrived I was told I would have to move from the Lahaina tower room to the Napili tower rooms after one night because of the "late booking". No discount or any other compensation for the hassle of having to check in/out like this and be stuck without a room half the day. Otherwise the resort is nice. No room service though. Went to the timeshare presentation and was pretty poorly treated by the saleswoman (Pepper) until she realized i had the money to buy. I highly recommend buying on the resale market though. Cheaper and you can avoid the marriott points system that really is good only for Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lifelongtravelr
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the hotel, clean rooms great pool. Enjoyed the luau. Staff was helpful. If you have the chance explore the neighboring pool and hotel scene- i think this is the most affordable of the strip of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay!!”
Reviews.Author: LoriD555
Reviews.Content: my inlaws gave us the week for our honeymoon, and we were treated very well from the time we checked in to the time we left. my husband has a gluten allergy, and once we had the server at the pool side pantry check some ingredients for us, she made a note of it in our file so that when we went to Longbords for dinner a few nights later, our waitress already knew what my husband could or could not have. the front desk called and checked that we had been served well, and after a massage, they called to see if I was happy with it. special touches like that made our stay, just a little more wonderful. grounds and beach were gorgeous! ready to go back!! will return with our kids...

Reviews.Title: “Standard time-share resort, but overall well-done.”
Reviews.Author: anters_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was next door to a conference we were attending. Great if you are looking for an all-in-one type approach to your vacation. The pirate ship is a HUGE hit with the 2-5 year old set.

Reviews.Title: “"Loved it"”
Reviews.Author: TravelsLI
Reviews.Content: We were able to trade in for the week of September 30th- We were in the new Napili Towers i m a one bedroom villa- this is our 3rd time to Maui as well as our 3td time staying at the Marriott but our last visit was just before they converted to timeshares- the unit was beautiful- nice bathroom, full updated kichen and it was so convenient having laundry facilities in the unit- The grounds of the resort are great- the main pool was crowded most of the time but there are a few smaller ones that are lovely and peaceful- lots of places to just hang out on a lawn chair or better yet- in a hammock- We ate dinner twice at Longboards - food was fine but it's the location that makes it special-steps from the beach- Can't comment on any of the rooms in the other (older) towers but ourrs was great- Can't wait to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location one of the better Marriott Properties”
Reviews.Author: john-hana
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon and it was great. Perfect location and great for sunsets.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: chris1ann
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband have just returned from a weeks stay here. We had a 2 bedroom unit in Lahnai Tower. The staff where great and very friendly, however the place itself is odd, because it used to be a hotel so the rooms do not have any main kitchen facilities such as stove and hob, not an issue with ourselves but could be if you needed to cook. There were lots of grills around the pools but you had to go from your room to the grill and remember to take everything with you, so it was not great. The place itself is being updated and I believe that they are installing kitchens in the updated rooms, hopefully this will improve the rooms considerably. Also the furnishings are out dated and worn, the towels are very worn and I hope they are changing these when they update the rooms. I also hope that they address the light switches, they are in some odd places, one near the door, fair enough, but then the one for the main room is hidden behind a pillar close to the lock off door, took some finding that one!! Apart from that its a nice place to stay but has to be a poolside holiday as the beach is non existent, the closest area of beach is about 5 to 10 minutes walk away. Don't promise the kids a sand and beach holiday if you stay here. So not a bad place but don't expect to much from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: lakelizrd
Reviews.Content: Typical up scale Marriott property. The staff is great, the location is the best. Not to pricy for the location. The rooms are spacious, up dated, and furnished nice. If you are looking for a nice hotel on the beach. This one could be the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “the edge of paradise.”
Reviews.Author: imc410
Reviews.Content: wow. breath taking, awsome, pool area splendid.. ocean front resort, great beach, words cant explain how awsome this resort is... it truly is paradise..

Reviews.Title: “The Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: extranan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 9/11/11 for a week, our 2nd stay. It's absolutely the lovliest property in the area. Take a walk along the Beach Path - sidewalk - to your left is a Hyatt and to the right, , past a Westin and several others and the Whaler's Village and on to the Sheraton and you'll find Ocean Club has the very best piece of property. 3 pools, the largest one is where more kids go but I had no problem swimming there & loved that I could swim under a couple of bridges and go quite a ways before I had to turn around. Since I went later in the day, after 3pm, I had no problem finding chairs. Everybody working at the Marriott is very nice, always very helpful. We were in the Molokai Tower, where we'd been 3 years ago, and had the same wonderful sunset view. I like sitting on my balcony - we were on the 7th floor - having my coffee in the morning or wine in the evening, watching people walking along the path, or swimming in that pool, or exercising on the lawn, or just enjoying the vast view of the ocean. They were working on complete remodles of the rooms and we were in a brand new place. Unfortunately it still smelled from the new furniture etc., but a couple of nights with the windows open solved that allergy problem. The brand new bed was a bit hard, but that's okay, seeing as how it needs to last a while. Great pillows, soft, feathery for me, an assortment. Not those awful hard ones so many places are going for. Even the mattress in the living room sofa bed was nice and firm. We had friends visit who were staying at another resort and they were very, very impressed with our view. Ditto the view of the pool and ocean as they stepped out of the parking garage. We had a suite. The kitchenette has a mini fridge and microwave plus dishwasher. Coffee maker, dishes and glasses. There were 2 complete bathrooms. Free internet in the room. Bring your computer. To note: parking garage is Free for us time-share owners anyway. Valet was $12.00 a day, which is handy to use the first night. For eating, there's Tropica at the Westin, which we decided was too expensive this time around, but there are 3 restaurants in Whaler's Village. We went to Cane & Taro, as they had a special - on a Wed. evening - if you order before 6pm, it's half price. And my filet mignon was pretty good. And we could see the ocean. Also for breakfast, there's a McDonald's at the Village, as well as a couple of other fast food places. One night we got Chinese take-out. The Marriott has a place where you can get breakfast or lunch take-out, expensive, or sit at a table and look at the ocean. Longboards is dinner where we ate our last night, because we had a $20.00 gift cert. for signing up to listen to a time-share deal. It's not great but it's okay. And you're right on the ocean. We will certainly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Much better second time around”
Reviews.Author: SFOF/A
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott owners at another property and traded one of our weeks into the Napili Towers, Maui ocean club. We had a 2 bedroom mountain view apt. The apt was beautiful, a full kitchen, with everything you need to do your own cooking. The furniture was beautiful, the bedrooms comfortable. The spa bath in the master bedroom was wonderful, very relaxing. I used it twice. The only problem was the lanai. It is off the master bedroom and living room. The door from the living room opens out towards the small lanai, making it impossible to enter from the living area. ( a design flaw) We went through the bedroom sliding glass doors to get to the lanai. It had 4 large chairs and a round table. We ate many dinners and breakfasts on this lanai. The lanai furniture is too large for the size of the lanai. Other than that, I can't fault this condo. The second bedroom is a studio lock off, with a smaller lanai, 2 chairs and a small table. There is a pull out sofa bed along with the king bed in this room. 4 family members could sleep here comfortably. The studio has a mini fridge and microwave, dishes, coffee maker. The pool at Napili Towers is small and winding, it is great for the people who have the ground floor rooms. you can step outside and take a dip in the pool. There are a few people who I saw get up at 6:30 am and place towels on 5 loungers to save them for the day. they must be families, as there were many people with young children at the complex. Grandparents, parents, and kids. The Napili pool was a great pool for kids and people who want to soak a bit. We only went in this pool once. The main pool has a kids area, as well as lots of room for everyone. Granted, we were there in September after school started, it was not as crowded at it was when we were there in August a few years ago. (I wouldn't recommend this in the summer, been there, done that, not my cup of tea) We loved the slide in the pool, not crowded, and loads of fun! There are BBQs around the property. We made sure to BBQ at least 4 times while we were there. The staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful. From the front desk to the bartenders. All with amazing aloha spirit. Our 8th night was spent in one of the hotel conversions in the Molokai Tower. We had a remodeled ocean view room. It was also beautiful, with a mini kitchenette, separate bedroom and bath, living area with a dining table and comfortable sleeper sofa! The lanais in this older buildings are designed with more a feeling of spaciousness, running the length of the rooms, both sleeping area and living area. They aren't deep, but long and perfect for watching a sunset and enjoying the view. We will be back to this Kaanapali resort, it was a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Visitor for over 20 years & I picked the Marriott Maui Ocean Club”
Reviews.Author: Maui-no-ka-oi12
Reviews.Content: For over 20 years we have stayed at the Ali'i next door (we go to Maui every year) to the Marriott. We loved having a condo with full kitchen, washer and dryer plus lanai. However, we didn't like that we never knew how the condo would look and whether its furnishings, bathroom and kitchen would be up to date. We feel the view, Whaler's Village, and area of the beach in front of the west side of the Marriott and the Ali'i is the best that Maui has to offer. Three years ago while staying at the Ali'i, we saw the new construction of the Napali Tower at Marriott. Our friends who were renting at the Ali'i with us decided to go on the timeshare tour. They loved what they saw. They said that the 2 bedroom units were as nice as any of the Ali'i rooms if not better. The new towers have 2 and 3 bedroom units with a full kitchen, lanai, washer and dryer. Our friends showed us the brochures they got. My husband and I talked after we went home and decided to purchase a 2 bedroom oceanfront timeshare in the Marriott's new towers. We knew we could never afford actually buying a condo in the Alii (don't have $2-3 million just hanging around). But owning a timeshare in the Lahaina/Napali Towers at the Marriott is the next best thing. I know some reviewers (not owners) have complained about costs of ownership, but buying this timeshare is really just pre-paying for your vacation and saving on inflation costs. Maintenance fees could seem high to someone who doesn't visit this island regularly, but a room of the same size with the same amenities usually rents for $600-$900 a day (check rental costs of Ali'i 1 & 2 bedroom oceanfront and Westin timeshare rooms at North Kaanapali, if you don't believe me). When we arrived for our first stay in the Napali Tower, I called our friends and thanked them for all the info they gave us that led to us buying our timeshare. The rooms were great and very up to date. The view is wonderful. You can see and hear the ocean from the room. We found the staff and the pool area to be excellent. We have stayed at this property 3 times and love it. We usually go during summer for each visit and never felt that the property was overflowing with guests. We use the grills at least 3 times per visit and have only had to wait to use them once (20 minutes). We can't wait for our next visit. Having a full kitchen and a place to wash clothes makes the vacation. We can spend the whole day on the beach and come back to the room for lunch. Again one of the best purchases we made. Great property! We are enjoying the Marriott more than the Ali'i. We know that we are guaranteed a great vacation, great room and great treatment by the staff. When we had a problem with our ceiling fan, a technician was there to fix it in 15 minutes. Then the front desk call in 30 minutes to confirm that the fan was fixed. When I asked for extra towels, I got a follow up call to confirm delivery of those too. I noticed that some reviewers don't like the property because they weren't treated like royalty because of their Marriott Rewards status. The majority of people who own at this property are Silver or above in the Marriott Rewards system, so don't expect extra special treatment --the majority of people staying there are just like you. Also, this property has a high occupancy rate, so late check-out or early check-in is usually something they can't offer. Some comment about a lack of a convenience store, I think they just didn't know where to look. There is a gift shop/convenience store on the left when you immediately enter the main lobby. We eat once a stay at Longboard's, Marriott's restaurant, the local food (fresh fish) is as good as any you can get at a restaurant at Whaler's Village. I just wish that they also offered Maui Cattle Co. beef, instead of beef from the mainland.

Reviews.Title: “Worldclass location. Average facility and services. Typical timeshare.”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
Reviews.Content: I cannot think of a nicer more beautiful beach than Kaanapali. A stunning location. The rooms here are furnished with average quality furniture. It's a time share after all. The beds were ok, towels in the rooms were ready to be replaced/thrown away. They were nearly threadbare. Seat cushions on the furniture were overly stiff and hard. It may be to hold up over time with all the overweight people. Whatever the reason, the furniture in the room was incredibly uncomfortable. Amenities in the bathroom were cheap generic, not of normal Marriott hotel quality. And certainly not of the quality of the hotels in the area such as the Hyatt, Sheraton or Westin. We had a two bedroom with living room, spacious, full kitchen and oceanfront balcony. Marriott charges a massive weekly fee for each year of the time share. In this case, two one bedrooms were traded for a two bedroom unit. So for nearly $300 a day just in the timeshare annual owners fee paid to Marriott, what do you get? Don't expect daily maid service, don't expect any bottled water if you're used to hotel programs, but at least a stack of local papers is left in the elevator lobbies. And that doesn't even consider the $70,000 buy in the owners paid for uh...shall we say this privilege. The lobby and public areas are as plain as they come. Cheap cheap cheap. The two largest areas inside the hotel are dedicated to whatelse? Timeshare sales. Isn't that great. These poor midwest boobs that spend thousands of dollars to buy a time share and then pay Marriott in excess of $1000+ dollars annual maintenance fees each year for the smallest and cheapest units, finance the ongoing timeshare sales AND pay for the space they are using to sell more units. That space could easily be used for restaurants, lounge space etc....but no, this place is a timeshare sales machine. As you walk through the property there is booth after booth manned by agents ready and willing to sign you up for yet another tour! In case you miss a booth, the new towers have an agent by the elevators to "welcome" you and solicit you for another tour. The pools and lawn areas are the best reason and only reason in my mind to stay here. There are 8 b'bque grills next to the Napili tower where we stayed. Those are in demand and people run down around 4 pm or so and throw towels and books on the chairs at the tables to "reserve" the grills. So get there early folks. This property has something like 750 rooms and when full it's crazy. There are signs posted all over the place to not save seats, but no one seems to care and the staff looks the other way. They do the same thing in the morning when people run down, get towels, throw them on all the premium chairs poolside and then come back hours later. Just for kicks I wanted to go collect towels and turn them into the front desk, but I never did it, because it would have been as tacky as the behavior we witnessed. If you want to guarantee yourself a private seat near the beach, rent a cabana for two. $70/day. You'll guarantee yourself space and you can order drinks/food from the staff. The hotel is currently updating the original hotel rooms with a new rededsign. Thankfully, occupancy was low or we would have totally been fighting for pool chairs. As it was, it wasn't pleasant trying to position ourselves when we wanted to lay out, but it would have been chaos had the hotel been full. The property sells a plastic mug for $34.95 that can be refilled over and over again with soda or coffee during your stay. For some this is a great value given what individual drinks cost. We simply kept our soda and cocktails upstairs in the refridgerator and refilled during the day as we saw fit. For four of us, we would have paid $140 to the Marriott for drink mugs and we certainly didn't go through that during our stay by refilling our glasses in the room. And I doubt it takes any longer to ride the elevator up to the room than it takes to walk to the self serve area of the pool. The televisions have an incredible array of stations and music to choose from. Internet is free. Self parking was in limited supply and considering the occupancy with the construction going on, I would hate to be there with full occupancy. We used valet two different days because when we got home in the evening from eating out, the parking was all taken. The workout facility has a lot of machines. It's not fancy, but the machines all work and they're newer. No complaints here. We used it four different days and it was never busy except in the morning. We did not eat on property, because the self serve pool restaurant is like any other cafeteria and their restaurant Longboards, while a decent price point, seemed like any other plain beach cafe you might run into. We would much rather walk down the sidewalk along the beach to Hula's or Leilanis and they both have excellent happy hours. Sonz at the Hyatt is an excellent choice for upscale dining and the Hyatt has a great sushi restaurant also. I'm guessing the Marriott puts no money into their food service at this location because the crowd won't pay for it. They've already paid thosands in buy in fees that they will never be able to recoup (just check out the timeshare resale market) and they also annual pay fees of at least $150 PER day or more just to keep their unit...and as I said before that doesn't even buy you daily maid service. Marriott has one of the best things going ever with timeshares. They guarantee themselves 100% occupancy once a project is sold out with phenomenal yearly revenue and lesser services and lower quality surroundings than are provided in competing hotel properties. If you're taking a dozen people with you and don't care about average quality, this might be a great place, but for two or four people, we didn't think the value was anywhere near what it ought to be. In the future if we want space and a full kitchen, we'll do VRBO and save a bunch. Actually the Alii Kaanapali next door is cheaper, far nicer...and no timeshare sales people. We've already booked.

Reviews.Title: “so disappointing”
Reviews.Author: fusca
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Maui Marathon on Sunday, September 18. We checked in on Saturday, September 17. We got to the hotel early and were told our room wasn't ready. We hung out at the resort for a while, and checked back at the desk at 2. Still not ready. We were told they would "rush" our room, and took my cell # to call when the room was ready. Check-in time is at 4, and I received a call at 3:55 saying our room was ready. Wow, thanks for expediting that. Hard to believe that with a 10am check out time, they didn't have a single room available before 4? I'm not used to that happening. The room itself is ok. It's a huge property, so tons of walking to get anywhere. The room was clean. I hated the shower. The shower head is mounted so high that by the time the water hit me, it wasn't strong enough to really get the shampoo out of my hair easily. I had to stay in the shower forever as the water dribbled over me. There was no way to adjust the spray. I was also very disappointed by the hot tub at the Napili tower. Maybe I should call it a lukewarm tub, because we went in at 9pm (we were told hot tubs are open till 11), and it was not hot at all. I was actually shivering in there. What a letdown. And lastly, the lobby is pretty disappointing. Hardly any shops? Not even a convenience store. There is a little shop all the way down by the pool that sells snacks and drinks, but they close at 7. No little shop with magazines, toiletries, snacks and drinks in the main lobby. Weird. The hotel is clean, there are huge pools, it has a great location, but I found a lot of things odd with this stay, and it means I won't be staying here again. When I pay this much for a hotel, I expect things to be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, View and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: a4girl
Reviews.Content: I do a lot of business travel and stay at 4 & 5 star hotels, so my expectations for hotels on vacation are very high. The Marriott Maui Ocean Club didn't disappoint. We had a great room for a week in the main building, with a beautiful ocean view out towards Black Rock. What we liked: the size of the bedroom & bathrooms, the separate living space with mini-kitchen (I mean MINI - just a small sink, coffee maker, toaster, dishwasher, utensils - but definitely enough to do prep and make breakfast/lunch -- no stove) and two balconies, the multiple pool areas and the multiple BBQs which we made great use of. The rooms were clean, the furniture look high-end. There's nothing like BBQing some fresh fish and then eating it on your balcony with those amazing views. What could have been better: I'm not sure why the unit had 2 bathrooms -- really odd. I would rather have had a full kitchen and it would make more sense. My husband thought they may have a problem with drainage lines for a real sink with disposal, so that may have been the issue there. Second, we wish they had a better food selection at the pool area and in the small "grocery shop" they have. Be prepared, the food is expensive. We went to the local grocery stores, stocked up and had some wonderful BBQ dinners for far less $$$. We've visited Maui numerous times and have stayed at the Hyatt on Kaanapali as well - for the price & size of the room, we would opt for the Marriott again. Our next stay - we're trying the condos at the Ali'i.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: gregk111
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks here on an exchange in August 2011. The first week was in the older Molokai tower. We had a 2 bedroom 3 bath condo that was perfect for us- two adults and 3 kids. It did have a tiny kitchen so we dined out except for b-fast and lunch. The second week was in the new Lahaina tower in a 1 bedroom. The new condos are nice and it was nice to have the full kitchen which we used daily. We spent most days at the beach directly in front of the resort even though it was sort of narrow. The snorkeling is great there and you will find turtles if you get beyond the waves. We drove to Hana twice! once the regular way and once the opposite way. Eat the Banana bread on the way and don't miss the hike to Waimoku Falls through the bamboo forest at Oheo gulch (7 sacred pools).

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Club Delivers Again”
Reviews.Author: jjtino
Reviews.Content: We just got back from another trip to Maui and stayed with our Marriott Timeshare at the Ocean Club. This is our second year in a row heading to Hawaii from NJ so you can tell we are big fans of both the islands and Marriott. The Marriott is on a great spot in Kaanapali Beach - within easy walking distance to Whaler's Village where there are great restaurants and shopping and also within a 10 minute drive of Lahaina as well which has more excellent places to eat and shop. The hotel itself is great. My kids (5 & 8) love the pool with its water slide, cave, and basketball. It's really one of the better pools around. The grounds and well kept and the rooms are great too. They are doing extensive room renovations but it doesn't affect you in any way. We had a great view of the water from our ocean view room and the sunsets cannot be beat. Golf across the street is good - $49 twilight rate after 3PM and kids were free (however I think that may be just a summer deal). The beach is very narrow but part of the fun of Maui is finding your own beach and there are plenty of good ones within 10-20 minutes. Overall, this place always comes through. We love it and definitely will be back. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Kaanapali beach beautiful great location.”
Reviews.Author: liv2travel_9
Reviews.Content: They're refurbishing rooms so I think the rooms waiting for a re-do need some attention but overall things look good. Staff is super helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, we can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica B
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Maui Ocean Club we were greeted with lai's and a warm "Aloha". The rooms were fabulous, we have been there two times and stayed one time ocean side and another time island side. You can't go wrong either way. The island is as gorgeous as the ocean.
