The pools are meticulously kept and great for adults and kids alike, with the adult and children's area.The location is perfect for walking down to Whaler's village, where we enjoyed dining and shopping. We feel that it is truly the best place to stay in Maui, and are looking forward to making it an annual family vacation. I could not say enough good things about our stay! PS They also have tons of activities planned by the hotel staff for kids and families.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Time at a Large Property”
Reviews.Author: RCuevas
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to visit a large property. This is unlike some of Marriotts other time share venues, like Waiohai in Kauai. It's the Marriott hotel that's been converted. We were in the Lanai tower, had two bedrooms and 3 baths and the rooms were spacious, the bed comfortable. They are in the process of upgrading the rooms with new furniture and linens. Pay attention to your trades. We didn't know we weren't getting a full kitchen until their staff called us. Thank goodness for that call, we brought a small burner and cooked breakfasts on it. Breakfast for two would have run $180 for the week, so having a kitchen is important to some of us. We enjoyed the views from our room, the beach is absolutely gorgeous. We made good use of the chaises on the lawn, avoiding the pools for the most part. They were too crowded and that wasn't what we were looking for. We didn't take advantage of their "cabana" set up, though the price was right at $49 for the day. They were well serviced and the manager certainly took her job seriously. We got service for drinks at the chaises, the bloody mary's were delicious. EVERY staff member we encountered were very friendly, the desk team was efficient and Toni the concierge helped us with some good places for dinner. If you like big places, this is the one, if you lke quiet locations...uh, not so much. There is a lot of foot traffic by the beach as the beachwalk connects quite a few hotels. Longboards for dinner was decent, though not inspiring and being close was enough to persuade us to dine there. Thanks to all the staff for making us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “We were in heaven for our wedding and honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: horsetrail
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare in Sedona for 2 weeks @ the Marriott Maui Ocean Club. Even though we got the older section, we loved it. We had a garden view and just a teeny tiny view of the ocean. No matter. Almost everything about this timeshare hotel was fantastic. The only thing we didn't like was the little cafeteria type area for breakfast. It was ok but they didn't really know what they were doing sometimes and they didn't go by the menus posted on certain days. On Sunday we went to Umulu for the brunch which is also on the beach walkway (divine) and also went to a champagne brunch up the road at Kaanapali Beach Hotel I think was the name of it. It was great too! Even met 2 different Arizona people there, one couple from 60 miles away in Lake Havasu. We even considered buying into that timeshare but we knew we couldn't afford 2 timeshares so we just enjoyed the time we had there and cried when we had to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat. We will definately return.”
Reviews.Author: deamole
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Maui Ocean Club. We were in a 1 bedroom unit in one of the older buildings. Accomodations were more than satisfactory , although I hear that the newer units are well worth it if you can get into one of them. The resort itself is phenomenal. The pool area and water slide was great. The location on Kaanapali Beach is wonderful. We were there in February, which was at the peak of whale season. I can't wait for thr opportunity to return.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE this place!”
Reviews.Author: red0125
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Maui Marriott since it opened in 1981. With the changeover to time share & the addition of the 2 new towers it is even better. We rented a 2-bedroom in the Napili Tower. We were fortunate to get a high floor & partial ocean view. The unit was immaculate, furnished with beautiful Hawaiian furniture, kitchen was beautiful (no bugs whatsoever, which is an excellent feature in Hawaii). The grounds are perfectly manicured & maintained & the pool is to die for. No problem getting lounges. We had breakfast each morning from the beach market (papaya is a must)! Even splurged for a massage on the beach. The views of Lanai are exquisite. Can't say enough positive about this resort. They really take excellent care of you & are friendly, courteous & helpful. This is a 5-star destination in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “For A Vacation Club Property, Pretty Average”
Reviews.Author: jenjram
Reviews.Content: We own at Marriott in Oahu and traded into this property for a week. First, I have to say that Maui just isn't "my island." It is busy and hectic and not terribly peaceful. (for me) Having said that, I just felt that Marriott wasn't keeping up the property as it should. It seems very due to be refurbished and not worth the high $ amount per night that they charged overnight guests. It disturbed me a bit as an owner, and I just expected more. (no full kitchen, for example) Service was particularly poor and staff was surly or at best, apathetic. I blame that on Marriott management and probably poor wages and training. If you want Maui, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A good alternative to the high price hotels/resorts in the area”
Reviews.Author: Sarasdad27
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was a good choice for us; it's centrally located, making walking to some restaurants & shopping, an alternative that most places don't offer. The service was great and everyone we met from the staff was extremely helpful

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Stricks
Reviews.Content: First, we are owners in the Lahania Tower and go here every Summer. We take one family member and their family. This year we took our oldest son, his wife and three girls (7, 5 and 3). This Resort is first class in pretty much every way you can look at it. The pools are huge and enjoyable. The water slide big and fast. The little kids pool is decked out as a small pirate ship with small slides. The main restaurant, Longboards, is open for dinner and is very casual - not fine dining. Everything on the Kanapalli coast is within walking distance. The Luau next door at the Regency is first class (get preferred seating - it is worth the extra cost). Swim 25 years out from the Dive Shop and you can watch the Green Turtles swim in front of you as they go down to a "cleaning station" to get gromed by the small fish. You can actually swim right up to them as they lie there to within a couple of feet (it is down about 20 feet). The rooms at the Tower are beyond excellent. Huge and spacious. Master bedroom has a huge, and deep, jacuzzi. Bathroom is huge. There are two new towers and the "old" Ocean Club hotel - stay at one of the Towers - PERIOD!

Reviews.Title: “Someone needs to define "Villa"”
Reviews.Author: USAShelley
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at this location. Pool, ocean, gardens are very pretty and very well maintained but the rooms however were very disappointing. That are advertised as "villas" and in reality they are nothing more than connecting hotel rooms that only get towel service once during your stay. The location is great right on the beach and a simple walk from many restaurants. This is our third trip to Maui. We have stayed at Westin, Hyatt, and now the Marriott. I loved the location but again very disappointed in our "villa". Preferred the rooms at Westin and Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “PEFECT 10!”
Reviews.Author: Sagbaby
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Marriott Ocean Club. We traveled with 4 families and spent many months planning it all. A few weeks prior to our trip, we were able to request rooms near each other. They were great and did end up getting us all int the same wing. We have stayed at the older part of the resort both times, and really do like it because it is closer to the ocean and main pools. They have updated the rooms and renovated them. The beds are great and all furnishings were nice. We booked oceanfront (redweek webstie we rented a week from an owner) and had a balcony that was HUGE and overlooked the beach and the pool! It was perfect! We had a great week that and would love to book 2 weeks here next time.

Reviews.Title: “First-class resort -- we loved it and hope to be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: ecaravello
Reviews.Content: Our family had an ocean-front room on the 8th floor of the Molokai Tower and the location and view was nothing short of awe-inspiring. We were no more than 30 yards from the shore of the Pacific! The steel blue ocean waters filled up the entire view of the floor to ceiling windows leading out to the lanai, extending upwards as far as the eye could see. The sunsets from our lanai were breathtaking and featured a panorama of colors from the most vivid oranges and reds to the deepest blues and purples. Our room was spacious, comfortable, and well-appointed. Although we were not staying in either of the two newer towers, I never felt short-changed or that our room was outdated. The furniture, carpet, bathrooms, and kitchenette were well-maintained and stylish. By no means did I dread having to return to this room at the end of our day. The staff was courteous, professional, and knowledgeable. It was obvious that they had been well-trained. Housekeeping would consistently greet us with a friendly â€˜alohaâ€™ and leave us with a friendly â€˜mahaloâ€™, complete with a smile. The front desk staff would greet us by name and a friendly â€˜alohaâ€™ whenever we called down for more pillows or toiletries. Those tiny gestures made a big difference to the pleasure and enjoyment of our stay. The staff seemed to be aware that we were on Maui for the first time, and wanted to show us the genuine Aloha spirit. From the bell hops, to the concierges, to the pool attendants, I was generally impressed by the professionalism and pride in which the staff went about their daily routine. It has to be difficult when your day-to-day is your guestsâ€™ once-in-a-lifetime, but I rarely got the sense that the staff was feeling down or dissatisfied. This is a tribute to the Marriottâ€™s hiring & training practices, and a greater tribute to the fine people who work at Marriott's Maui Ocean Club. I highly recommend Marriott's Maui Ocean Club to anyone looking for a family-friendly resort in which to enjoy the paradise that is Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's Maui Ocean Club..... God's Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: Pinsey60
Reviews.Content: I'll never forget stepping on the grounds of the Marriott for the first time. So beautiful, that it took my breath away. We lounged by the waterfall, listening to the glistening crystal clean water pounding away. So relaxing! A look to the left.... the gorgeous Pacific Ocean. Out in the distance....two islands... Molokai and Lanai. We could see ships in the distance..... whales breaching off to the right. The Marriott has the most fabulous restaurants, summery cocktails.... the staff is excellent. Beds were heavenly, never slept better. First class all the way! This was by far the most luxurious hotel we've ever stayed at on our numerous trips to the Hawaiian Islands. If you stay here, you will NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon..liked it”
Reviews.Author: SheelahA
Reviews.Content: We were on our honeymoon. The room was a little out dated. Our view as looking into the island but we should have paid extra to get the ocean view. The service was okay but not as friendly as I expected. The pool area was wonderful and the bartendars were really nice! I love the location and Maui is a breathtakng island..can't wait to come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: SD-Traveler09
Reviews.Content: Marriott Ocean Club was everything we hoped it would be. We traded a Marriott timeshare to get this property, so I can't comment on the cost. The hotel itself is immaculate. Beautiful open-air lobby/atrium area that is very impressive. Extremely friendly and helpful hotel staff from bellhops to maid service to concierge people. The location is fantastic ... right on the Kaanapali Beach. Walking distance along the beach/boardwalk to all the other Kaanapali hotels. The ocean-view rooms are stunningly beautiful. The main pool is incredible. It's a combination water park and rain forest. Huge pool with waterfalls, water slides, a kids area, water volleyball, water basketball. Plus, there are other smaller pools if you want a more quiet poolside experience. The pictures you see online are exactly how it looks from your room. There's a large fitness center with all kinds of equipment, machines, and weights. Also onsite is a salon and spa (massage, steam room, etc.). Another useful amenity is the placement of various gas grills around the property (near the rooms, near the pools). Much cheaper and fun alternative to going out to dinner every night. The rooms have all the grilling utensils you need. The only complaint we had was the lack of washer/dryer in the units of certain bldgs. We're used to Marriott vacation club resorts having washers/dryers in every unit. The newer bldg has them (but does NOT have views of the main pool). The older bldg does NOT have washers/dryers (but DOES have the impressive views of the pool/ocean). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jtownleyc
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Maui Ocean Club is a beautiful property with loads of amenities. The rooms are large and decorated very nicely. The pools are lovely - the largest pool right in front of the Maui Ocean Club has waterfalls and a kids area with pirate ship. The pool bar is right there so parents can enjoy relaxing while watching their kids in the pool. The smaller pools located by the Lahaina and Napili villas are quiet if you want to sit and read a book. The gym is great and has floor to ceiling windows overlooking the super pool. There is a spa right on the property with all of the treatments you would expect. The gourmet centers in the Ocean Club have bar sized refrigerators, microwaves, and dishwashers. Even though there is not a full size kitchen, you can still prepare every meal if you want because of the nice BBQ grills located on the property. We purchased breakfast foods (cold and hot cereal, bagels, toast, juice, peanut butter, jelly) and ate breakfast on our lanai, had cold cuts/cheese/chips etc to make sandwiches for lunch and could microwave baked potatoes and night and cook our steaks, hamburgers, hotdogs, fish, chicken on the grills at night! The vacation club is in a perfect location as it is right on Ka'anapali Beach and there is a walkway right to Whaler's Village where there is lots of shopping and wonderful restaurants. Be sure to have Hula Pie at Lelani's on the Beach - it is to die for!! The snorkelling right off the beach was also very good - we saw as many fish there as we did on a boat snorkelling trip. There are washers and dryers located right on property that are available if you want to travel light! There are a couple of restaurants right on property and we had a wonderful dinner at Longboards. Also, the club is located right on a championship golf course - it is beautiful!! The parking is free if you rent from an owner at the property however if you rent on your own there is a daily parking fee. All in all, you cannot go wrong staying at the Maui Ocean Club!!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: smrmer
Reviews.Content: We rented our 2 bedroom lockout from the timeshare owner via a broker co. There was so much room: 2 bedrooms, a kitchettte, family/dinning room and 3 full bathrooms. All of the cooking and serving essentials were in the unit. Since there was no stove/oven (only a microwave) we brought an electric frying pan. The grounds are beautiful and right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT property and undersold by their photos - must stay here.”
Reviews.Author: rjfogarty
Reviews.Content: This is a great property and you will be pleased. Clean rooms, impressive appliances (if you get a room with a full kitchen). This is the first time I have ever stayed at a hotel where they actually don't do themselves justice with the photos they use to present their property. Our room looked EXACTLY like the pictures show - sparkling clean and looked like it was built yesterday - but the property and beach view is meticulously groomed and worth every nickel. Make sure you verify the size of your room first, then book it. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: slauderback
Reviews.Content: Location: On the Ka'anapali Beach - Just steps from Whaler's Village which offers great shopping from your basic toiletries to Coach, to fine dining or your favorite ice-cream shops. Walk to Blackrock and jump off, if you dare! My husband and teenagers did, not me! Room: Nice! 2-full baths, 2-balconies, comfortable and roomy. Ammeneties: Beachwalk Market & Pantry is poolside and very costly. It is worth it to buy the mugs, (you'll understand when you get there). We bar-b-qued a couple nights on the grills poolside, that saved a bit! Parking: valet is $15/day. If you don't mind the walk, there is free parking on the other side of the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dasheba
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried about how the Ocean club would be once we found out that it was also doing time shares but it was wonderful! We were asked once if we would like to listen to the presentation and never bothered again when we declined. The room was exactly what we hoped for and was clean and modern. We couldn't hear other guests. We had a great time lounging by the pool and beach and ate at both restaurants. We would definitely recommend the Marriott Ocean Club to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Magazinedude
Reviews.Content: Great property for couples or families and they keep them separated very nicely! Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Starbucks onsight

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: 60795family
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt 10 years ago for our honeymoon. We wanted to take our 3 kids(ages 4, 7 and 9) to Maui for our 10 year anniversary. Descided on Marriot's Ocean Club as one way to save money. Coming from Philadelphia. The kids did great on the long flight so they were excited to get to the hotel. The room was perfect!!! Stayed for 7days. Did the sunrise with my daugter. My husband did the fishing with my son. Submarine ride with the youngest. Visited Lahania, Ocean Center, Iao Valley State Park. Snorkeling tour. Hyatt Luau. Snorkeled at Black Rock(wow...the turtles were amazing). Watched the sunset at Black Rock. It was a great vacation. The hotel location, their programs, the facility and staff was ideal. How perfect is it to have the kids swimming near by, husband grilling dinner and I'm on the hammock reading a book. Then have dinner while watching the sunset. We will be back Marriott. But next time would not do the fishing trip. And would bring our own snorkeling equipment. Saves money and so many places to snorkel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful pool, great facilities”
Reviews.Author: galwaygal87
Reviews.Content: My family spent two weeks here, alternating between the pool and the beach. Walking distance to many restaurants and boat tours on the island. We have stayed here for years, and I look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places ever...”
Reviews.Author: carter18
Reviews.Content: Okay, first I wanted to start out by saying that I cant believe some of the travelers had a bad experience. One of the reviews said the rooms are small. They are only small if you don't have a timeshare and you are just a guest. If you own a room then the rooms are rather large. Okay to the review: This place is great. They had a big slide and a little slide. The big slide was okay but it has a lot of rules. Like no going down on your stomach and head first etc. The Beachwalk had drink cups that you can buy and you can get free sodas there for your whole entire trip if you buy one. The place had 4 towers. There are the 2 newer ones which are nicer and bigger and the 2 older ones that are also pretty big. We stayed in one of the older towers the Lanai Tower. We had a lockoff unit which is basically 2 rooms combined. We had a mountain view in the back so great view of the golf course and the houses. The resort is about 10 minutes North of Lahaina. I had a fabulous time at this resort. I hope to return again.......

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, average hotel in a resort only town”
Reviews.Author: We_love_holidays_107
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Maui before and I booked at the Marriott after reading good reviews on Trip Advisor and wanting a 1 bedroom apartment. The rates were steeper than what we paid even for a 1 bedroom at the Trump tower in Waikiki but the contrast was stark. Having never been to Maui before, we didn't realise that this part of Maui is purely resorts - think 8 story high strip of resorts and nothing else but excluding the atmosphere that such an environment conjures up in Waikiki. So that part was my fault for not doing enough research on the area and I want to warn others. If you're after some beautiful beaches and to steer clear of Timeshare sales people and masses of holiday makers conjuring around pools and average restaurants, stay away from K'aanapali beach and the towns just north of there. Instead, head to the north side and stay somewhere along the road to Hana or alternatively, if you want seriously upmarket, around Waimea is nice (in a Truman show kind of way). About the Marriott though - the pool is great and had a fantastic pirate ship with slides for our 3 year old as well as a larger slide and lots of room for the masses of people so you never felt too crowded in. The room however was terrible. For that much money I expect something better than old green carpet and horrid furniture. There was a side view of the beach (apparently a 'full beach view') from the bedroom and it was perfectly clean but all in all, not somewhere that I'd recommend. The staff were however very helpful (excluding the guy who was part of the 'welcome pack' committee who didn't seem to have the time to tell me anything about local activities, the area or directions). All in all, happy with the service and the pool, disappointed with the room and the resort area. Kind of reminded me of Orlando but by a nice beach.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait for next year!!”
Reviews.Author: vivaciousviv29
Reviews.Content: We just recently got back last week and stayed at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club and it was absolutely perfect! A family of 5 plus grandma came along.The staff was wonderful and so friendly! The kids all had a great time! The eldest (9) took surfing lessons right outside our hotel. We loved it So much he surfed 3 times. Great instructors there! The hotel just left a message about checking out the timeshare deal. No big deal at all! We had a smaller kitchen with no stovetop, which at first I really wanted, but worked out real well with the smaller one! I defentily say use the bbq's they are wonderful and clean! The pools are great and have so many fun activities for all age kids! I have to say there is nothing negative about this resort!We all had a blast! Oh, and if you do the Road to Hana make sure you do alot of stops along the way there and back because it is pretty long and windy(curved roads) for the kids. So make sure you set aside one full day for just that! And defenitely go snorkeling in Honolua Bay which isnt too far from the resort! Hope this helps and Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Dream trip at a beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: Emmertee
Reviews.Content: Our party of 15 just concluded a beautiful trip at Marriott's Maui Ocean Club. We stayed in 2 ocean front, 2 bedroom villas. We stocked our full kitchen at Costco (near the airport) and a nearby Safeway and cooked every night ... We made great use of the grills! We are owners at ko olina but this was our first time trading for Maui. We were in the new, Napili tower and so the suites were beautiful. The pool outside our tower seemed much quieter than the kids' pool. All staff we spoke with were incredibly friendly. The timeshare people left us alone. Overall it was great ... A few things did disappoint since we are used to Ko Olina. 1) you couldn't buy a decent shaved ice anywhere on property or even along the walkway (try Local Boys West near the Banyan Park in old Lahaina for some good shaved ice) 2) pools are more spread out (longer walks to use all pools), everything is more crowded, and guests feel less connected 3) there are only 4 hot tubs!! Not enough. 4) there are no lounge chairs on the beach. On the plus side, the ocean has better waves for surfing or boogie boarding (the quiet bays at Ko olina are safer for small children though), security let us play frisbee on the lawn (a big no-no at Ko Olina), the hammocks Â in the trees are kind of fun, the resort is less isolated -- we snorkeled at honolua bay and at black rock (my brothers saw a reef shark there-yikes!!) overall, we are glad to have seen a new island and experienced a different resort. Thanks, Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy, great location”
Reviews.Author: IamPC
Reviews.Content: Worth staying here. The grounds are nice, not the most luxurious, but well maintained. The 1 bedroom 2 bath suites are very spacious. Everything is clean and in working order except the internet. During our stay, the internet was barely working. Good thing it was free wi-fi in room - so when it worked, it was valuable. The concierge was helpful, but needed an better attitude. The pool is great for lounging and you can walk to the excellent beaches and snorkeling sites. This location is a great launching pad for other activities.

Reviews.Title: “Morning dash to pool chairs”
Reviews.Author: Lahaina96761
Reviews.Content: We often stay at the Marriott in Kaanapali on the weekends just to get away and enjoy the awesome pools. The rooms have always been decent-sized and well-updated even though we usually stay in the older main building. As other reviewers have stated, it is a morning dash to the pool chairs, though. By 9:00am, all the pool chairs on the decks are "reserved" and there are only chairs usually left on the artificial sand areas, and even those are scooped up by 10:00am. I usually see families on their way to breakfast place their towels on the chairs and then come back after breakfast to start enjoying the pool. If you're not down by the pool by 10am, you might as well just wait until 12noon or so before coming down so you can catch some families leaving to eat lunch. I was disheartened to hear of one reviewer's tale of racial profiling. As a local, we definitely get second looks from security personnel, but as long as we have our pool bands on, they don't bother us and all the staff are always really friendly. We have seen an increase in security personnel on the pool decks, so they may have had a lot of "pool crashers" in recent months so are stepping up patrols, however, on the weekends, especially, there are a lot of local families enjoying the pool with no hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: tnincy
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that a family member owns a timeshare here, so my opinion and experience may not be the same as one who just books as a hotel. We did not pay for parking and had some added bonuses due to his ownership. We stayed in a one bedroom, 2 bath, kitchenette suite with a graden view. Let me start by saying that our check in process was fast and in no time we were off to our room. Room was clean and decorated with tropical decor. Beds was comfortable and we found the property to be nicely kept. It had a small refridgerator, microwave, dishwasher, coffee pot. It was also stocked with tableware. It would have been nice to have a small stove as well as a larger refridgerator. We did a fair amount of cooking while in Maui to lessen some of our food expenses. The resort did have lots of grills located throughout property that we utilized almost nightly. Pool area was very lush with tropical plants, waterfalls and was very inviting. You can find hammocks towards the beach area. I cannot say much for the restaurants as we did not eat at any of them. They do offer a variety of activities you can book right on site. We rented a car, so again I cannot say much about this service. Our stay was very enjoyable. We found the staff friendly and courteous. The location is great for the Whalers Village area. A short walk and you are there. Walk a little further and you will find Black Rock, a great place to snorkel and a beautiful beach. A short drive will get you to Old Lahaina. My experience here was a great one and I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to ask which tower you will be staying in....”
Reviews.Author: Marriott_Owner_11
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our 2-bedroom suite in Aruba for a 1-bedroom at this Marriott , expecting that we'd find a similar level of accomodation and amenities....wrong! The Molokai tower was a former hotel. Its rooms are basically 2 hotel rooms with a doorway. This tower is scheduled for remodeling in fall 2011. We were told that the owners' association delayed the renovation for a year. The room furniture was worn, the half-size refrigerator was rusted, the toaster timer didn't work, and the smoke from the toaster was not detected by the smoke detector that was hanging off the wall, inoperable. There is no cooktop in the "kitchen". We went on the sales presentation in the Napilli tower and found the rooms we thought we would receive. Granite countertops, stainless appliances, ceiling fans, etc and larger rooms. The food at Longboards, the hotel restaurant, was just average.....don't waste your money. There are several other great restaurants in the area. Before you confirm your reservation, know where you will be placed!!

Reviews.Title: “THERE IS NO WAY TO COOK”
Reviews.Author: skierguy2009
Reviews.Content: I am a 2 week Platinum Season Owner at Marriotts Ocean Watch Villas in Myrtle Beach, S.C. , and just about an hour ago I checked my family into the Maui Ocean Club as a result of an exchange I did through Interval International. I cannot believe that Marriott and Interval International, through their mutually beneficial corporate relationship, offer for exchange a property for exchange to families that DOES NOT HAVE A STOVE!!!!!!! If it had been stated in the confirmation by Interval International that I was exchanging a Platinum Week at Myrtle Beach for a property that was nothing but two old hotel rooms put together with no stove I WOULD NOT HAVE TAKEN THEM HERE!!!!!! NOWHERE does it state on the Marriott reservation information nor the Interval International reservation that this "hotel room combination" did not have THE BASIC FREAKING AMENITIES THAT ANYBODY IN HIS RIGHT MIND WOULD EXPECT!!!!!!! Now my two children and my wife and I are stuck here, almost 7000 miles from home with NO WAY TO COOK FOR OUR CHILDREN!!!!! Go to the grill, the hotel staff says. Thanks for that Info. Dear Mr. Marriott and Interval International ....this is corporate behavior/greed at its lowest point. You sell this property time close to but not quite to the level of FRAUD by deciding to simply omit the word "STOVE" from the kitchen facilities listing and expect that when people get here and find out they don't have one to just trot down to the grill for seven days, for breakfast, for lunch, for dinner. Of course, there is also absolutely NO mention that this is an OLD converted hotel property. That's just sweet. This is totally and absolutly unacceptable. Ive always gone to Marriott properties in my business trips and vacation trips and quite frankly this is enough for me to stop. Looks like its the Hilton Honors program for my corporate travel from this point on.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: beane404
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many marriott properties all over. My expeirence hear was great. I must prefice this by explaining that I stayed here for 7 nights at the rate of 169 per night (fed employee discount) We LOVED the pool, the beach, the service, the room. We had a mini fridge, toaster and microwave in the room which was great. I will recommend a suite to families though. Food is outrageous in the islands which is expected but it isn't good. The hotel has a great location on the beach and on a sort of "beach walk" area that is very close to various upscale resteraunts and a outdoor mall called Whalers village. We stayed in the lanai tower, which I have read other reviews complaining is out of date. I didn't have any complaints and did not feel the room was out of date. Maybe they have updated recently? They also have gas grills located throughout the resort wtih tables etc so you can eat there too. Which is a nice change from the overpriced resteraunts. Concierge was helpful top we booked several excursions through them! What I didn't like: longboards and timeshare sharks. Longboards had great service and great location but the food sucks. Sorry but its overpriced and terrible. Drinks are good though! They seriously push timeshares, dont get sucked in. We didn't but don't even give them a sideways glance that you are interested. They are literally everywhere!! A quick note about the area - Safari boat excursions is a must! Lulu's Grill is the only restauraunt we loved. Rental car a must. They say they don't let you reserve chairs at the pool and will remove towels if left unatteneded. Everyone reserves, I went to the pool at 9am and there was one pair of chairs without towels but yet NO ONE was in the pool or at the other chairs. Also - lots of super ridiculous snobby rich guests, but I guess thats Maui. I loved this place but would it be worth the reg rate of 349? No, I'd spring for the four seasons or rtiz in that case :)

Reviews.Title: “Marriott vacation club sales program”
Reviews.Author: raineyms
Reviews.Content: I just sat thru my third presentation of this new point system and want to give you my impressions. First let me say I love the Marriott PROPERTIES and the services I receive while on them; HOWEVER, the new point system (a spin off company piggybacking on Marriott's name), while claiming to be better has NOT endeared me and with my conversion of points, showed me the LACK of customer care that the old program was famous for. Let me give you my story. I own 5 properties, 3 in Maui, 1 in Ko'Olina, and 1 in MountainSide Park City. I love Maui. Ko'Olina is for trading and Mountainside, well let's just say this is the property that cost my loyalty, as I have never been able to use the system the way it was intended to get to stay there. I have had to buy my way in, scream, or complain and beg to get a any time for skiing and I own the ski weeks. So here is the point. Marriott decided on the point values. They assigned to me 12875 points (125 shy of the Premium Elite Status and its advantages). After much talk, and pleading I was denied the rights to buy 125 points, BUT was told for a mere $20,200 additional dollars I could buy into the new system and get 2000 points in the new system thereby allowing me the advantages of the new system (i.e. 13 months reservations and access to the new up and coming properties). My 15 years of loyalty to the Marriott Hotel system (Platinum Elite) and 5 properties was LOST all over this requirement to spend $20,000 MORE. From what I read above, many of you have similar issues where your were told you had to BUY MORE to get equivalent status and access to NEW programs and property. How sad! This is a spin off company that does not Understand about the loyalty that the Marriott HOTEL SYSTEM is famous for. I will always love Marriott PROPERTIES (still owned by Marriott) but have no love for the MVC spin off company. I STRONGLY urge you to study your situation before investing more in this spin off program. I may be wrong in my perception and am open to them talk again but after three appeals I am the end of my patience. I will continue to voice my opinion of the issues on all sites and try to get Marriott to intervene and understand how many of us feel but until then, I recommend you not give in and BUY more. Mark Rainey Florida

Reviews.Title: “Awful...”
Reviews.Author: DAMANDEL
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review why I lay in bed at the Marriott Maui ocean club. All I can say is this place is the one of the worst Marriott properties I have ever stayed at. Check in was fine, being gold I thought an upgrade would be coming but alas no better room. Fine, no big deal. My wife, toddler daughter and I get to our room and are somewhat repulsed by the room we walked into. It was dark and dingy and just had that worn feel to it. Fine, no big deal. We are easy people. Go to the pool which is great and et n early dinner since we tired from travel. Get back to our room and that is when the problems start. Phone is out of order, fine no big deal, drain is broken, fine no big deal, dead bug on the balcony carpet, fine no big deal, pack and play they send up is broken, fine no big deal, our room is right above the luau out that sounds like a high school marching band, fine n big deal. My 18 month old daughter finds a used condom by the nightstand, Houston we have a big problem. Are you kidding me!!!!!! March to the front desk because our phone is broken and raise hell. I am an easy going guy but this is the last straw. What does the manager do, she gives me another room, three doors down, exact same size. I am sorry , at this point it is 8 pm, my daughter is dead tired and they want us to schlep all of our stuff to another crappy room. Where is the suite, where is the love! As I write this my wife is booking a room at the fairmont kea lani. Do yourself a favor and don't waste your time with this dump!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort and accomadtions--- food at longboards was really good too”
Reviews.Author: kmkallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights, grilled out by the pool a few nights, ate at Longboards 3 nights, and enjoyed the pools. Would stay again, very nice accommodations Happy hour specials tended to be the same at the pool grills/ bars -- worth buying during those times

Reviews.Title: “BAD TRADE”
Reviews.Author: gslincorp
Reviews.Content: We traded a one br with full kitchen for one. br We got a one br with a small fridge and a microwave. This was not the best for what we traded. Rooms appeared to be two hotel rooms made into a one br with sitting area lr. I think that trading with Marriott ocean club be ready for a big let down on your timeshare exchange. They will not be getting anymore of our business.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with lack of Friendliness and Service for Marriott Gold Members”
Reviews.Author: HonuBoySLC
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott in Wailea, and had a great experience there. However, one of the days, we went up to the west side of the island to explore the Olivine Pools and play around Kaanapali Beach before attending the Old Lahaina Luau. Previously, as a Marriott Gold member, Marriott hotels had a few 'courtesy rooms' where a frequent traveler could stop and clean up before going to dinner, catching a flight, etc. When I inquired at this hotel (by phone), this service was unavailable and I found the hotel representative on the phone to be very unaccomodating. Nothing against Marriott in general, just a bit disappointed in this hotel. When frequent travelers reach certain statuses with airlines, hotels, etc, we love to be taken care of. Fortunately, the Hyatt next door had showers that we were able to use out on the boardwalk (open to the public) to just rinse off. Based on this brief experience, we won't be staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I would look else where's for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: pstropics
Reviews.Content: We had a bottom floor not by choice of a newer tower. The room was smaller than our bedrooms at home. Things were broken, sofa bed was nothing but springs. We ask to change rooms but were told it was booked but talking to others around it was a slow time. Employees were not friendly or helpful except for the bellhops. We suggest travelers check out other places for the price you pay and what you get. Our bodies also hurt every morning from the bed

Reviews.Title: “Just as great this year! Kids love it.”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this place. Don't go here to be away from the kids, bring them with you. They love it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Maui Hotel...Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingASAP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Marriott-Lahaina Tower rooms for a week in April. These rooms are updated and seem newer than the main building. Plus this tower of the hotel appears to be quieter as it's located away from the large, family/kids pool. The parking structure is conveniently located behind the tower rooms. Our room (#2209) was ocean front, king with a small kitchenette. It was very clean, quiet and the view was fabulous! Be sure to request hair conditioner and body lotion as it's not included unless you ask-no charge. The staff was friendly and accommodating if we needed anything. Best deal....take 90 minutes and listen to the "timeshare" promotion and you can get free golf, whale watching or other freebies for your stay! We were upfront with the sales staff and let them know that we were not interested in purchasing a time share and they didn't do the hard sell on us! We ate at Leilani's for taco tuesday...best fish tacos!!! Longboards is okay, nothing special. Overall, this property is amazing...great staff, clean comfortable rooms and what's not to like about Maui?!?

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Teach1977
Reviews.Content: For our March Visit, we were in the Lani Tower. Best Ocean View. Every Night, I watched the sun set. We were in unit 3100. The Unit could be updated, the furniture seemed old. The coffee make, could not be pre set. I thought that odd for a Marriott property. This unit had 2 bathrooms, which is great. I also thought this unit was bigger then the other units we had stayed in in the other tower. We enjoy our time here. We do like the lcation of Ocean Club. Staff was friendly. This year, we ate at Longboards. Food was fair, great view from the resturant. Perfect for the first or last night in Maui. This is a great place to stay. I do recommend the Lani Tower

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - too bad about the "guests"”
Reviews.Author: AceChucker
Reviews.Content: The resort is very nice. There are three pool areas, with the center area being reasonably large and complete. The smaller pool areas are on either side of the resort, and are also nice and a little less crowded. We were in an older building (there are older buildings and newer buildings on the resort), but it was still a very modern and well appointed room. I can imagine the newer buildings are even more spectacular. The pool bar was very good with great staff, but the two restaurants were mediocre at best. That said, there are lots of great restaurants a short walk up the beach. At Whalers Cove, we liked Cane and Taro. Parking is good, and at $8 a night, a Ka'anapali bargain. It is a timeshare property that you can rent (we did), and you do get a voice message to ask you if you want a timeshare presentation. We politely declined, and they didn't ask again. The resort staff are very nice, very professional, and are a real treat. I don't know how they maintain their calm, with these jerks they have to deal with as guests - but they keep smiling and doing their jobs. Some examples - as with any hotel, there are not enough pool chairs for everyone in the hotel at the same time - so they have signs posted indicating that if a chair is reserved with a towel and unoccupied for 90 minutes, they remove the towels and open up the chairs for other guests. We were sitting in some chairs at the pool for some time, and someone came up to us and told us that we were in his chairs - he had reserved them some four hours earlier (when we sat in them, they were clear of towels). A pool worker stepped in, and dealt with him, but he still huffed and puffed at the hotel worker, and then came back to stand over "his chairs" for the next hour, but eventually gave up when we didn't move. I thought that this guest was just a "one-off" until I saw similar confrontations a few more times over the next few days. We had our children's shovels stolen off the beach. We had our Marriott beach bag (a nice welcome gift) stolen from the laundry room. Some "guests" kinda made you feel like you weren't in a nice resort, but more so a cheap motel. We mentioned this to a Marriott staff member, and he replaced the beach bag, apologized for the minor thefts and for the beach chair issue, but did say that it is challenging as some of the guests are very difficult when it comes to their rights to own those beach chairs. So, in short, a great place, great staff, but try to go when there are not too many "guests" to ruin the experience for you. Again, the hotel and staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time a charm to Maui”
Reviews.Author: teacupmama
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Modern rooms close to restaurants..Mmm Maui Grill, or fast food or shopping...View of Ocean..Walk and snorkel ...only gripe is I would have preferred a cook top to a microwave..but that is just me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place - great trip”
Reviews.Author: mommyjen14
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our week long stay at the Marriott from the end of Feb - beginning of March. We had a two bedroom, ocean front suite for our family of 6. This is our third time staying there. We found our room to be clean, well taken care of and perfect for our family. We enjoyed having space for our family and watching the whales from our room. The pool area is large and aside from our first day, we were always able to find a place to sit. The children enjoyed the water slide and swimming in the pools. We toured the grounds, attempted a meal at Longboards (don't bother) and used the grills to make fish, shrimp and chicken we purchased from the local markets. Overall we had a very nice trip and enjoyed the Marriott very much!

Reviews.Title: “just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: ozgirl06
Reviews.Content: All we wanted during our multi-island trip was one room with an ocean front view (open the curtains and see the ocean). We knew we wanted to stay at this marriott after reading the other glowing reviews. The comments were spot on. We were in the Napili Towers. The room was spacious with a kitchenette, the bed was very comfy, and the view couldn't be beat. (nothing like waking up and watching the whales from your bed!) The staff were gracious and the location is great... easy walk to Whalers Village and conveniently located to other casual, cheap, and tasty dining. The only small downside to this resort are the parking decks. While we always found a parking space, the lots are far too small for the number of visitors- both in size of the individual spaces and the total number of spaces available. I advise to heed the other recommendations for renting a small car - you'll be glad you did when time to park at the hotel. We stayed at a discounted rate and the value for the dollar couldn't be beat. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to renew Hawaii memories with our grown children & spouses !”
Reviews.Author: NWDwellers
Reviews.Content: We took our children and their spouses to Hawaii this time to enjoy our time with them and enjoy their adventures and share some of our previous adventures...living on the West Coast..(Seattle)...makes it easy to fly often to Hawaii. We have 9 children so we were thrilled with the accomodations to handle all of us ....what a great trip for our family. The concierge was helpful in booking all of our events and side trips...the rooms and view fantastic...service and availability to the Lahina area and shopping just a short walk aways...couldn't ask for more ...perhaps another trip soon !!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort property”
Reviews.Author: toastytravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the New Year's holiday 2010-2011 and had a fantastic stay. The resort property is nicely landscaped with lots of pools and a cool "shipwreck" pool for kids but you hardly noticed the kids and the noise was minimal, which was great. I love kids, but sometimes all of the kids' club activities and music can make noise a nightmare at the beach and pool, especially at Caribbean properties. (although, maybe there were just fewer kids since they might have all left the resort on Jan. 2 and 3 to go back to school). Anyway, the staff were very helpful and friendly, free laundry is available if in a studio unit (but you need to buy the detergent) and the property has a beach walk that provides access to neighboring properties for outside-the-resort dining like the Westin (good dining) and Whaler's Village. It's also within walking distance to the Ka'anapali golf courses (Kai and Royal). It is a decent ride from the airport and a cab will coast about $80-100 but a company called SpeedyShuttle will take you in a rideshare van for about $55. The outside hallway carpeting in the older, Molokai tower needs to be replaced but the rooms are great, so it wasn't really a drawback from enjoying the resort. The beach has some rocky sections in the water but if you walk along the shore, you will find that there are some areas where there aren't any rocks in the water and you can float around nicely. During whale season, you can view a lot of whale activity from all over the resort. The beachside cabana massages were great and Emiko was a fantastic masseuse! The on-site restaurant, Longboards, was pretty good for a reasonable price (although, living in NYC, I am used to paying a lot so maybe it would seem less-reasonable to others). They made a shockingly good Mai Tai at Longboards as well. The internet reception in our room was really bad, though. Apparently they have plug-in internet in the 1-bedroom suites but the studio suites rely on a weak wireless signal. I had to go out to the reception to really get any usable wireless signal. The trip was simply great and the Marriott did not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best locations on Maui”
Reviews.Author: silverdustrider
Reviews.Content: I remember seeing Marriots beach club when I lived in Hawaii , and is the best location probabally in all of the Hawaiian islands for warm nights and hot un-cloudy days. I say this because my family wanted to know what island was best and where to stay. I prefer the north west shore of maui and thats the best location for sunsets, and beaches, So we decided to plan our trip for a week at Marriotts. They offer us everything i would want for my family to have a nice island experience in the short time we visit.I must bring to light that nowhere did I find surfing mentioned. I needed to pass on tany of you interested there are many quality hawaiian surfing spots nearby worthy of bringing your board. Can't wait to go back and in style.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Club beautiful location and ameneties at Kanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: xmasangel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds and beach. Any beach service you could possibly want. Gorgeous area! The room is the problem. Our room was basically a renovated hotel room. There was no full kitchen in a one bedroom and no washer/dryer for this level of room. This was a hotel building for years and is showing its out of date"ness". Small bathroom with standard tub showers and one sink. Kitchen area had only a microwave for cooking. A very small refrigerator. Studio's at Walt Disney World have this level of amenties! I understand that the newer buildings on property have the updated one bedrooms with ameneties I was expecting here. I traded a week of top notch resort at Walt Disney World for this and am very disappointed in the room. They are also trying to get us to attend one of their presentations...we are not even owners here and they're being kind of pushy... I have attended many of these in the past. I own 2 different 1 Bedroom timeshares and both are significantly better accomodations than this one.

Reviews.Title: “One of my most favorite resorts”
Reviews.Author: ihavethetravelbug_7
Reviews.Content: This is truly a special property. It just feels "right" on vacation. The rooms are spacious, clean and well decorated. The open air hallways give it a Hawaiian feel. Although it is a large resort it feels very intimate in the way it was designed. The staff could not have been more helpful, the grounds and pools are perfectly maintained, and I would go back here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Lahaina Villas--great place!”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiVistor_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one-bedroom oceanfront condo unit, booked online through Marriott, in the Lahaina Villas building (the building closest to the adjacent Hyatt property). The unit was immaculate and up-to-date, included a beautiful kitchen with dishes, silverware, etc etc, a separate whirlpool tub area between the bedroom and bathroom, and a lanai overlooking the ocean. The property was gorgeous with many pools and it seems that the pool areas near the Lahaina Villas and the Napili Villas area do tend to be less crowded and have more peaceful spots than the pools near the main towers in the center of the property. It is just a 5 minute walk along the beachwalk to Whalers Village. Overall no complaints whatsoever, this was a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Late September is perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: SteveEagar
Reviews.Content: We were here as part of a 10 day anniversary trip to Maui. We just traveling as a couple but had a two bedroom unit in the older towers. The new towers with the three bedroom units look much nicer! In any event, when you go to Maui... It's about location and activities. We arrived just before the Maui Marathon, I was a last minute sign up! I have always wanted to run it and was completely surprised to find it was the weekend we arrived. I wasn't totally trained so I ran the half and LOVED IT! Plus it was nice to get out of bed, and walk a half block to the start and finish area! The pool area is nice... A lot of kids. Interestingly, a lot of kids with grandparents. It looked like a lot of people were traveling with extended family - fun! Anyway, the older part of the resort is fine, the newer towers are BEAUTIFUL. we absolutely LOVED the cabanas on the beach. Reasonably priced too... We got one every day. Make sure you reserve in advance. We stayed both here and on the Wailea side this trip. This side has a much more family feel to it, and the other feels more adult vacationers. Anyway, you can't lose!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful setting, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deborah525
Reviews.Content: my husband and our 2 year old son and I spent a week at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club. Our one-bedroom in the Lanai tower was oceanfront...every night you could hear the waves lapping the shore right outside our room. The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. The pools were incredible with water slides and waterfalls and hottubs. They even had a kids pool with a fake sunken pirate ship. The other pools had large shallow areas for kids to play. There were so many smaller pools that we didn't even get to them all. The stretch of beach is gorgeous and we loved just walking along the pathway by the hotels and people watching. They have grills on the premises and our room had a fridge and microwave. We even bbq'd on our balcony. We keep kosher so we brought our own food and being able to cook it was a must. I took surfing lessons at Goofy Foot Surf School in Lahaina and it was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Super Fantastic Resort!”
Reviews.Author: TravellinFamilyUtah
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from my 2 bedroom unit here at the Marriott's Maui Ocean Club. This is among the best timeshare properties we've ever visited. We own three weeks at three different Marriott timeshare projects, but decided to spend Christmas in Maui this year. The entire family is having a great time. We have an "ocean view" unit (not "ocean front" but you'd never know it as the view is fantastic -- looking out at the blue Pacific Ocean. The staff is great, the food and beverage service3 is great, and it's clear the entire staff wants you to have a great vacation. I went up to see the Westin timeshares (a one hour walk up the beach) and while it looks nice from the outside, it doesn't compare to the look and feel of the Marriott. You can't go wrong staying here at Marriott's Maui Ocean Club! We are already talking about returning again next Christmas holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful condo and beautiful view - enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: glacierhiker
Reviews.Content: We purchased a package deal from NW Airlines years ago and had not used it, but were able to reserve and stay this year. We stayed in a 1 bedroom condo in the Napili Towers and the condos are first rate. Views are spectacular and condo has a full kitchen with granite countertops and GE appliances. Very very nice. I had seen the larger pool area before we checked in and was panicked about how many people were there - it was crazy and crowded. However, if we were traveling with kids this would have been ok. The nanpili towers have a seperate pool area and there were families there too, but much less crowded and it was nice. We did not eat at the hotel because the restaurant was crowded. We booked a snorkel adventure through the hotel and unless you are planning on going to the timeshare presentation, they tack on $20 per ticket "booking fee", which they neglect to mention up front. That's my only complaint about the entire experience - seems a little expensive for a phone call. The snorkel adventure at Lanai'i was the highlight of our trip; worth every cent (except for the $40 booking fee).

Reviews.Title: “Forget your worries, forget your troubles, atleast untill its over!”
Reviews.Author: yari1249
Reviews.Content: Great place for kids, grown ups, teens and for the older folks. This place covers all your needs from beauty to relaxation. We stayed in the newer tower and it was incredible! Everything was clean and tidy. I know we travel for the experience not the room but just having a nice place to come too at night is a bonus plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, will come back.”
Reviews.Author: hawaii_fan10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Maui Ocean Club for 7 days and thoroughly enjoyed the amenities. Staff were friendly and the restaurant Long Board was great, too. Will recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: jlcarp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just visited Maui for the first time and it was the trip of a lifetime. We definitely think that our stay at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club had a lot to do with it. We had an oceanfront villa in the Lahaina Towers and it was absolutely amazing. There is a full kitchen, large dining room table, living room with flat screen TV and pull out couch, patio facing the ocean, bedroom that opens onto the patio, Jacuzzi tub, full bathroom and extra sink, and washer/dryer. The villa was very big and spacious, much more than I was expecting. Our bedroom/view was literally less than 200 feet from the ocean. The bed was really comfortable and we loved falling asleep to the sound of the waves crashing outside. It is amazing how beautiful the sunrises are right outside your window, donâ€™t miss them! There were a few things I was concerned about based on other peopleâ€™s reviews, such as people reserving chairs and the parking being really far away. Both of these were non-issues for us. There are signs that say not to reserve chairs with towels and this was never a problem for us, although we mostly lounged at the pool/grass area outside the Lahaina towers which was never too crowded (then again, we do believe we visited in the off-season, or low tourist season). As for the parking, we were going to do valet everyday based on other peopleâ€™s reviews. However, the parking structure is literally adjacent to the Lahaina towers where we were staying so we just self-parked. It would have been more inconvenient to valet park because we would have had to walk all the way back to the front desk. But anyway, yes itâ€™s true, the parking structure does get filled up all the way at night and you will probably have to park at the top. The only bad experience I had was with a towel attendant who had an attitude and closed his station early and wouldnâ€™t exchange my towels for me. Kind of an jerk, yes, but I reported him to the front desk. The hotel property itself is amazing â€“ everything really is at your fingertips! The Marriott Resort shares the same beachline with a number of other hotels such as the Hyatt Regency, Westin, etc. and you can walk to all these hotels really easily along the Kaanapali Beach Walk. You can swim and snorkel right out in front of the Marriott, but the best snorkeling on Kaanapali is Black Rock â€“ we saw so many fish, manorays, and turtles! We were shocked to see so much right outside our hotel. There is also Whalerâ€™s Village, an outdoor shopping mall which has a lot of the stores located on Front Street in Lahaina. We went shopping on Front Street one night, but went back to Whalers Village to pick up anything else we needed. It was also nice how convenient the pool, lounge chairs, and towels were. We would leave the property in the morning and come back around 3pm or 4pm, and it was nice just to lounge for those remaining few hours of daylight, not to mention easy and effortless. Everything at your fingertips Iâ€™m telling you! I would come back here in heartbeat, or even buy a timeshare or own a villa here.

Reviews.Title: “cried on my honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jam1023
Reviews.Content: As members of Marriott timeshare we exchange our unit for an oceanfront room to stay at the ocean club for our honeymoon. We arrived to full tree obstruction of the ocean and handicap accessible (for my 6'3 husband unable to get under the shower head). There was bench in the shower that would fall on us when showering when it got wet. Bed bugs and small bugs in bathroom. Woke up at 5am each morning from children singing to their parents next door. We requested a room change/upgrade especially being our honeymoon and were told nothing was available and there was"nothing they could do for us". Charged for parking 8 dollars a day. We asked later in the week to change rooms when one opened up and were never called and denied us a room change when we called them again. Would not allow us to speak to a manager. No one seemed to care that it was our honeymoon, marriott owners and were very unhappy. The location is wonderful and had beautiful beaches and pools. The food was excellent, but your better off going to Waliea to hopefully have a better overall experience. I have always had great stays at marriotts and love the hotel chain but will never go back to this hotel and would NOT reccomend to anyone on their honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Romance”
Reviews.Author: Daleintahoe
Reviews.Content: I got Mauied. My new bride and I got married (Mauied) on Wailaia Beach. Our room opened up to pool. Our balcony was private. We barbequed everynite and laid in a hammock on the beach everynite! The front desk staff gave my wife to be hand picked flowers for her hair....unexpected gift....great service!

Reviews.Title: “Way beyond Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RIVERMAN63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here October 9 - 16 2010. After I read some bad reviews about the Ocean Club I was worried that our planned vacation of almost 18 months would be a bust... it ends up any worry was misplaced. This was one of the best vacations we've had in years and it was largely due to the great people at Marriott's Ocean Club. Stephanie in Guest Relations, Paul at the Valet and John at the bell desk went out of their way to make sure every guest was having a great experience. Our room in the Molokai Tower was spacious, clean and provided a beautiful of the Lanai Towers, pool and ocean. The room was clean and comfortable. All the amenities were excellent, the grills - which we used several times - were cleaned every day and worked perfectly, the pool was well maintained and the grounds were beautiful. If I am "gushing" it is because this place deserves it. We are well travelled and considered "picky" by people who know us. Even Donavan in the time-share sales office was low key and gracious. Yes, we are Marriott owners for the past 14 years, (not in Maui), but this is the first time I've ever felt compelled to review one of our stays. I've included some photos here for review and I believe you will agree this place is beautiful. Located 4 miles north of Lahaina, you will need a rental car to experience many of the sites and restaurants of Maui. Safeway is one of the best places for groceries. We liked the drive clockwise through west Maui along Hwy 30 where we found the "Best Banana Bread on the planet" - See the book "Maui Revealed" the best travel book for Maui. Also -- go for a drive in the evening to Haleakala for the Sunset.... Leave Lahaina by 3 - 3:30 PM at this time of year. Sunset at the crater offers great views, less traffic and a relaxing time - 45 degres at the summit so dress warm. Anyhow, - Stay at the Ocean Club, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Get Pampered in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: malahide20
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a lovely trip to Maui, we stayed at the Marriott's Maui Ocean Club, it was wonderful. The service was excellent, the staff went out of their way to keep everyone happy and cheerful. The setting for this hotel, is right on the beach, but if you don't want to swim in the Ocean - use one of their many pools - I loved the pool with the waterfall. The staff greet you at the door with a beautiful lei and then take you up to the lovely room. A great kitchen, beautiful bedroom and lounge and a view to keep you dreaming. I took my coffee each morning overlooking the beach at their coffee shop and just sat and people watched - then had the rest of the day to explore - coming back in the evienng to have dinner by the sea. We went horse riding, star gazing and of course eating delicious meals watching the sun set along the beautiful coast . Go stay at the Marriott you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: dmill0918
Reviews.Content: Loved our recent visit to Marriott's Maui Ocean Club and can't wait to go back. It was our first trip to Maui and we thought the resort 's location was close to everything we wanted to do. The staff was super friendly. We ate lunch at the pool bar several times and the food was great. The grounds are beautiful. I just wish the beach was a little larger. THe free washer and dryer in the laundry room was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “All that Maui Has to Offer Right outside your door”
Reviews.Author: thatsnotfunny
Reviews.Content: Went here on our honeymoon and were blown away. We used a timeshare trade and were pleasantly surprised when the friendly clerk told us that we had a room with an ocean view. We walked into our suite which was really two converted standard hotel rooms. The first room had a small kitchenette, couches, and a dining room table as well as a Television. The bedroom had a large king size bed, and television. It was spacious and roomy, and the dual balconies really set off the whole experience. Sunsets at this place are amazing. The pool is geared more toward families, but we were able to find hammocks and mai tai's quite easily on the property. The location was also perfect. We could walk to local restaurants and snorkeling, and always felt like there was something happening in the area. As it was a timeshare, the room was only cleaned once during our week long stay. But there was no pressure to hear a sales pitch and we had free reign of the property. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “crowded but nice”
Reviews.Author: ccpt95
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a week on Kauai and i would do the opposite next time. Maui is much more crowded and the Ocean club is ok. To me it is like every other resort with people putting out towels on every beach chair they can find then not using them most of the day despite signs asking people not to. We even went to the bar and while people were off swimming shopping and doing whatever they were trying to save bar chairs like beach chairs which to me is the most ridiculous thing I have ever heard. 2 days they ran out of beach towels. the rooms in the older towers were actually quite nice just missed having a full fridge but my husband and I got our own bathrooms which was nice. I'm sure the newer towers are nicer but they are newer. Parking can be a pain but at least it is free. nice close walk to whaler's village with restaurants. The 2 newer smaller pools are very nice and did not seem to have as much of the towel hoarding chairs issues and there were less kids which for me is nice since we don't have any and don't like vacationing with other people's kids.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise...for us, extended family and friends!”
Reviews.Author: ccgramaui
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting this location for years...a great escape from Midwest winters. Every year, we invite family and friends to join us...sharing our little piece of paradise. Every year, it just gets better. Whether you are staying in the original or newer towers, there are benefits to both. Newer Towers: (Lahaina or Napili) have beautiful full kitchens with granite counter tops, stainless, full-size appliances and stacked washer and dryer. The kitchen is fully stocked with plates, silverware, bakeware, cooking utensils, serving and storage containers, blender, toaster, coffee-maker, plus hand towels, potholders, paper towels, dishwashing soap, liquid dish soap, and new cleaning sponges. If you have a 2 bedroom unit, the additional (lock-out) bedroom also has its own kitchenette area with a small fridge, microwave, sink, dishware, utensils and more. This makes a perfect "private" room for guests to have their own snacks and drinks handy any time of the day or night. The kitchen, dining room (table seats 6 comfortably) and living room areas look out a full-wall window of breathtaking views. Ceiling fans in each room, a large jacuzzi tub plus two separate sink "rooms" in the master bedroom suite, and table and chairs on the lanai (balcony) complete these bright and cheery, tropical vacation homes. Original towers (Molokai or Lanai): The original towers have the benefit of 3 full baths in a 2 bedroom unit that sleeps 8 (2 full baths are in a 1 BR unit that sleeps 4) and a full-length, large lanai -- especially in units from the 4th floor and below. The main living/dining area is very spacious. The full-wall kitchenette has a dishwasher, microwave, small fridge, toaster, coffeemaker, blender and the necessary eating, serving and food storage supplies. The above (newer tower) cleaning products are also included. Large, stainless barbeque grills are located throughout the property to cook lunches/dinners and save vacation dollars. Stop at Costco as you leave the Kahului (OGG) airport, or drop in Safeway just down the road, to pick up seafood, pork chops, chicken, steaks, veggies and fruits (grilled, carmelized pineapple is the best). Hint: a small roll of aluminim foil is a must to line, wrap & grill everything from veggies and fruit to pizzas! If you are in the original towers, you still have free laundry facilities. The Marriott has converted the pay laundry area into free use of washers and dryers. Grab a lounge chair near the pool area closest to the lobby (near waterfalls, koi, giant pool slide area) and it is easy to check on your laundry while enjoying the sun and fun. ALL Towers: Give you access to one of the largest, most awesome pool areas in all of Hawaii, literally, steps from the beach. Free, high speed internet. The new, large fitness area has the latest exercise equipment. The famous Ka'anapali Beach Walk (sidewalk) runs through the property up to Whaler's Village for upscale to fun shopping (even an ABC store) and restaurants from the new Cane & Taro (great early bird 50% off dinner specials), the sand-"floor" Hula Grill to McDonald's. Continue up the Beach Walk to a snorkler's dream, the historic Black Rock, where a torch-lighting and cliff dive take place just before sunset each day. A Car: A must on Maui unless you want to shuttle from the airport and stay in the Ka'anapali/Lahaina area during your visit. There is so much to see and do on Maui; a lifetime of visits would never cover all Maui has to offer. Winter Stays (the best: Jan. - March): Our favorite, when the whales are there! From your room or even the pool/beach area, watch Mama whales teach their new baby calves how to breach, pectoral fin-slap, spy-hop, fluke (tail) dive and slap. Awesome! Highly recommend the Marriott Ocean Club suites that beat small, crowded hotel rooms by miles!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property and Sunsets - Unit Did Not Match Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: h890
Reviews.Content: First time to Hawaii and Maui. The Marriott property is beautiful along with the sunsets each afternoon. My wife and I stayed in a one bedroom garden/ocean view and our brother and sister-in-law had an efficiency ocean front. Both were in the main buiilding on the ground floor. We had locked-off our Marriott Orlando timeshare unit and were successful in getting both units for the same week. We got on the waitlist through Interval in August 2009 and were confirmed in March and April 2010. We were both celebrating our 40th wedding anniversaries. We were at the pool each day right near the walkway that runs from Black Rock to the Hyatt. This way we could try out the ocean and the pool. The pool was fun and better than the ocean, but water gets warm from the sun. The ocean in cooler but the rocks and the undertow can be challenging. Snorkeling at Black Rock was the best and only a 10 minute walk. Saw a turtle and lots of tropical fish. Go out around the rocks for best sights. We tried other locations, but the weather was cloudy and the sea was too rough. Best time to snorkle is in the morning. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Concierge staff is execellent. You can call aheard and make all kinds of reservations. We reserved a private car for the Road to Hana and had a great guide/driver. Well worth the extra money. Also saw Warren and Annebelle show. Never laughed so much and so hard. Eat at Longboards. Expensive but very good. Try the appetizers. Service staff needs more experience. Units were tired and worn. Our unit has a strong bug-spray smell when we arrived. Also, the dressers draws smelled musty. We accepted it. When the little red bugs showed up on Tuesday around the kitchen counter and bath room sink my wife had a meltdown. We asked for a new unit. At 99% occupancy, there was only one unit available next door. We declined. Instead, housekeeping came an cleaned the unit. The staff was very accomodating. We were disappointed that the unit did not match the standards we have come to expect from Marriott. Bugs were back in the bathroom by Friday afternoon. Our trip to Maui was fun. We eat, relaxed, went sightseeging. Two great resturants were Roys in Kahana and Mama's Fish House. Close to the best two meals ever.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiGrl12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Ocean Club Resort for our 2010 Vacation. It was my finance, mother and friend of the family. This was a great time of year to go. It was not crowded but still "Happening." It was not overloaded with children. The service was fast and convienent. The weather was absolutly gorgeous, mid-high 80's, no rain, and perfect breeze. It was never to hot or cold. The rooms were immaculate. We stayed in the one room guest suite, which was a little tight for 4 people with only one king size bed and a pull out couch and no kitchen. Which made eating difficult. The grills were always available in the evening most of the time with a short wait (10-20 mins max) as you had to share with other guests. My favorite part was having access to the beach walk and walking any store, restaraunt or beach we wanted, or whalers village. It was a nice feeling knowing we never had to leave the resort. It litterally had everything we needed, besides a grocery store. There was gift shops, beaches pools, restaurants for breakfast lunch and dinner, shopping, snorkeling, surfing, grilling, shaved ice, ice cream cones, waterfalls. The only downfall of the stay was pricing. It was extremely expensive. Food, snacks, gifts, entertainment, it seemed like everything was overpriced!! It felt like we were being ripped off because we'd go into town and get something for way cheaper. Honestly, that would not stop us from staying there though. The resort was just absolutly beautiful. We didn't get board for the whole week were there because there was so much to do. I would recommend going at this time of year (september) because that is when the resort is least crowded and the weather is the best. Another plus about the location on the island is that it is located on least windy side and it is almost always sunny and warm as opposed to other sides that see more wind and moisture. It is also a 10 min drive to Lahaina which is an amazing shopping center/entertainment village. Great Vacation and and can't wait to go again next year but stay in a bigger room!

Reviews.Title: “Stunnining property, staff that goes beyond excellence”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler0003
Reviews.Content: I spent my 50th birthday at this property. GORGEOUS garden view in the Napili Towers. The pool was amazing---grotto, kids pirate ship, and giant slide. I was there for snorkeling and saw 3 sea turtles just to the right of the property at Black Rock. After check out, I discovered I'd left a camcorder and gift cards in a small bag. I called housekeeping and they'd not found it. Fortunately, I called a week later and a member of security recognized it as being turned in to his desk as opposed to housekeeping because of the value. He mailed it to me via fedex and helped me retrieve priceless photos. I would give his name, but want to protect his identity from internet invasion. The property was clean well maintained. If it were in my budget, and not a gift, I'd go there every year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property, Wonderful Location, We Would Return!!”
Reviews.Author: YolkyPalky
Reviews.Content: My wife and 16-month old son just returned from our vacation to Maui where we stayed at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club. We are not owners there but decided to rent someone else's timeshare week and are so glad that we did. We absolutely loved this property and location! We stayed in the Lanai tower, 9th floor, 2 bedroom ocean view, and the view is truly remarkable. We overlooked the gorgeous pool and grounds, out over the pacific ocean and over to the Island of Lanai. I would say pay no attention to some of the ridiculous negative reviews on here, I can honestly say I have no idea where they are coming from.
