All I can say is perhaps those that are leaving poor reviews are expecting to receive Four Seasons or Ritz-Carlton luxury while staying at a Marriott. Also, remember this property was a hotel (now a timeshare resort) that was originally opened in December of 1981! Of course there have been numerous renovations over the years, but nevertheless still sometimes shows it age. Couple that with the intense tropical heat and humidity and properties tend to age faster than in other locations. So when I noticed some paint coming off of the bottom of the bathroom door, did I really care? Heck no, it's Hawaii, and things like that will happen in the tropics. What I DID notice was how nicely the rooms have been renovated with nice furniture and large flatscreen TV's in all rooms, though seriously if you come to Maui to sit in your room and watch TV then you are probably destined to write a poor review. You just have to know what to expect, again this is a Marriott, not a Four Seasons, but we couldn't have been happier with our stay. The Staff was very friendly and any request we had was quickly addressed and take care of. On property we ate at Longboards twice and liked it very much, and two times we ordered dinner to go from Beachwalk and ate in our rooms (after long days of driving around Maui, Road to Hana :). The grilled Mahi Mahi with fried rice and vegatables from Beachwalk was actually very good for the money, recommended. Otherwise, like probably so many others we made the stop at Costco (literally right next to the airport) and at the Lahaina safeway and had breakfast and lunches in our rooms. While the older Ocean Club doesn't have a "full" kitchen (like the newer Lahaina and Napili Towers), we found the kitchen adequate and really would have never used a stove anyway. The microwave, coffee maker, toaster, blender, refrigerator, sink and dishwasher was more than adequate for our needs. Only complaint I might have, and this is probably a complaint about resorts in general and not specific to Marriott or the Ocean Club, is the pool chair situation. It seems it is becoming customary at resorts now that many people are placing their towels and a book or magazine on pool chairs at 6:30 a.m. because they might want to come back and use it at 1 or 2 pm. This is a joke and needs to be addressed at all resort properties not just at Marriott Ocean Club. Luckily, we were there in September low season (kids back in school) so finding decent poolside chairs wasn't too big of a problem, but I can only imagine what it's like in the high summer or winter season. Plenty of times we saw four chairs in a row with a towel and book on each one with absolutely no activity for hours. Marriott, and all resorts for that matter, need to do a better job with this situation. But really this was a minor complaint for us since we were always able to find chairs no problem, and with a 16-month old, we could only use the pool for and hour or so at a time anyway before nap times and feedings so it worked out for us just fine. Other nice amenities included free laundry machines (so you don't have to pack as much clothes, and very nice when traveling with toddlers), unlimited use of beach towels (each person gets a towel card which can be traded for two towels which you can return and get fresh dry towels whenever you want.), plenty of gas BBQ grills (we didn't use but saw plenty of people using them and enjoying it), free ample parking in 12-story garage next to Lanai tower. We spent much of our time OUT of the room either by the pool, the beach, snorkeling at Black Rock or Napili Point, driving around the entire West side of Maui, or driving to Hana and back, or walking around Lahaina or Whalers Village. It was very nice to always come back to nice, clean, updated rooms at the Marriott Ocean Club. We would definitely stay here again, and hope to soon!

Reviews.Title: “When Can I Go Again?”
Reviews.Author: Palmsandpines
Reviews.Content: This property was very nice. We stayed in the Lahaina tower and had a 2 bedroom ocean front room. Life could not have been better and we would go back in a second. The pool and beach are great. The building and grounds are well maintained and are very inviting. We have stayed at the Westin in the past and we found that the Marriott grounds are better but the units are pretty much equal; in fact, all most alike. Marriott does need to fix the barbecues which wont light half the time but that is about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, outstanding grounds, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NTP66
Reviews.Content: I can only speak for my wife and I, but we absolutely loved the Maui Marriott Ocean Club. We had a one bedroom ocean view unit in the Molokai Tower, and the view was simply outstanding. While the decor inside the actual units is somewhat dated, neither of us really cared that much. After all, we were in Maui, and anyone who spends a lot of time inside in Maui is absolutely nuts! The pools were absolutely stunning, as were the grounds. Good luck finding better versions of those anywhere else in Ka'anapali - you won't. The staff was very friendly, and the amenities were exactly what I would expect in Maui - free high-speed internet (including wireless), free beach towels, and free self-parking. Speaking of, parking was the only issue for us, some of the time. The parking garage at the new Napili Towers was quite small, and you had to get back early to get a spot. We were lucky and were able to park there almost every night, even though we always got back late. The other garage is on the opposite side of the resort. My family has been timeshare owners for as long as I can remember, so I know what to expect when it comes to a Marriott timeshare - this resort passed the test. When we return to Maui, we will definitely be staying at the Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: foodnfinance
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and nice, but the facility overall is getting run down. They need more umbrellas at all the pools. The BBQ's at the Lahaina tower are in a really lame area near the parking lot. The pools at the new buildings are small and crowded They seem more interested in selling timeshares than improving the property. They even downsized the little market. They need a 2nd resaurant, a real indoor fun adult bar. There is so much potential here. I won't buy anymore marriott property timeshares until they show they care more about updating and improving this property, but I guess they are spending soo much on that huge sales staff that their is no left over money.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Really Tarnishes the Marriott Name!”
Reviews.Author: PrimeNumberGuy
Reviews.Content: This place is the "99 Cent Store" of Maui hotels. By far, it's the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in Hawaii. I will never stay at another Marriott again. The staff is cold, rude, and unfriendly. I am writing this from their Owner's Lounge while trying not to gag at the smell of RAW SEWAGE that is currently permeating their lobby. The reason I am in the Owner's Lounge is because my wife and I have been waiting for almost 5 hours to switch rooms. In order to do this, they made us check out at 10 am, and told us it would only be a couple of hours before our new room was ready. (They did say that it could be as late as 4 pm, normal check in time, but made it sound like getting us a new room was a priority) It is now 5 minutes to 3 pm and after checking in with them twice in the last 5 hours, we are still waiting in their sewage smelly lobby. What a waste of a precious day on beautiful Maui!!! Why were we switching rooms? First, we were next to a room full of loud kids. It's not the kids fault though, it's the paper thin walls. Very poor design. Kids should be able to be kids and have fun without worrying about disturbing people in the next room. (Especially at a family resort!) Second, I woke up with bites all over my feet and legs. I'm guessing that these are from the infamous "Marriott bed bugs" that I've read about on TripAdvisor. Between that and the sewage lobby, I think the Health Department needs to check this place out. Overall, our experience with the Marriott brand has been terrible. Worst. Hotel. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather camp than stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: LiLxBeBe
Reviews.Content: We decided to make a trip to Maui since we have never been. We stayed at the Marriott Towers Lahaina Towers for one night and thank god we only decided to stay one night. The rooms felt and looked dirty for a Marriott. The bed was uncomfortable. The room was small. I have stayed at other Marriott Ocean Clubs before and they were much nicer and bigger. We called Front Desk to switch to another room and they said that we are already in the second newest building. Watch out for little miscellaneous costs here and there. Didn't realize that borrowing balls on a resort could cost money as well. We all felt that the room had bed bugs...I would not stay at this Marriott property at all. It reminds me of a motel. The only pro was the location - very convenient to Lahaina and the beach was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family fun!”
Reviews.Author: csberti
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed in Kihei so this was new to us. We flew in a day early and stayed at a motel just a few minutes walk down the beach the 1st night. The next day we checked in early and then toured around Lahaina until our room was ready. We stayed in the Napili Tower on the 3rd floor Island side. It was a great room. The parking kind of stinks because the parking by this tower is almost always full and the bigger garage is a little bit of a walk to this tower, but what's a little walk while in paradise. I dropped off my family and any bags we had and then went and parked. We have 16yr old daughters and our 14yr old nephew and the only decision we struggled with was whether or not to swim in one of the pools or go to the beach. The pools are awesome! Every morning we would go snorkling down by the Black Rocks. I've snorkled in a few different places in Maui, even Molokini, and this is one of the best places. I even cancelled a snorkel trip to see the turtles, because we could see all we wanted at the rocks. We swam with 3 different turtles, stingrays, and plenty of fish almost every day. The beach is nice, but a little rocky once in the water. It gets better if you walk down towards Whalers Village to swim. We are somewhat conservative spenders so we bought most of our food at Safeway in Lahaina, and just ate dinners out in Lahaina or Whalers Village. I did order the Moonfish from Longboards one night to go and it was expensive but great. We rented our snorkeling gear from a local place which was much cheaper for the week, bought inexpensive boogie boards at Safeway and gave them away when we left, and went to a timeshare presentation to get free tickets to a show and it was the lowest pressured presentation I've ever sat through and only took about 45 minutes. To keep it real, the only things I didn't care for were that you have to pay for internet service in their computer room (unless you brought something with wireless), and that you have to rent beach chairs, boogie boards, etc. Just seems like they nickel and dime you a little bit with all the small stuff. Some of the places we've been before offer all of that for free. I was a little worried when I read some of the comments on here before we left, but my family would go back in heartbeat. Overall, it's Maui, paradise, make the most out of it, and you won't regret it and there's no need to complain :)

Reviews.Title: “Gone Way Down.”
Reviews.Author: marlalan
Reviews.Content: First ocean front, 2 bedroom suite, they gave us was dark and smelly and on the ground floor. They let us look at another one (luckily there was another one to look at), and it was much better. However, fridge was not working, it didn't seal right so it never got cold, and the couch was full of disgusting food stains. They also never provided extra blankets and sheets for the pull out couch and it took forever to get some. Some of the elevators smell like a boys locker room. Hotel itself is in need of an upgrade. Very ugly in the hallways etc..They also used to have a restaurant open for breakfast and a Japanese restaurant as well. It's all gone. There's very little to eat right on the premises. A real pain to keep going out for meals. Service and people are just o.k., nothing special. Pool water is cold, and forget getting a seat under an umbrella unless you stake your claim early and don't leave all day. Not my idea of a vacation! The timeshare sales people are swarming everywhere you go trying to get you to buy more or upgrade. Maybe they should get a life or sell cars instead. It's really annoying being constantly asked to listen to them about their time-shares. Unfortunately, we are already stuck with one. Big mistake to buy a time share with Marriott. Promise you all kinds of trades and places to go when they can't deliver and keep changing the rules. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: terrymitch
Reviews.Content: Marriott Ocean Club offered a fabulous view, great amenities, the beach was amazing. Plenty to do. Longboards has the best calamari appetizers and the servers are wonderful. The long beach walk offered many sights and shopping venues. Highly recommned.

Reviews.Title: “manage your expectations...”
Reviews.Author: meetjimbo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the great location (and my loyalty to the Marriott brand as a Platinum member), but that's really where the excitement ends. Hard to believe that Marriott is proud to brand this property with the rather cursory room remodel they did in the 'older' part of the vacation club property. I was in an oceanfront room in the Molokai tower, and again, the view and location were fantastic, but the room was about the caliber of an un-remodeled TownePlace Suites. I had higher expectations of my Marriott property, but I guess I should've booked the one in Wailea or ensured I stayed in the newer tower. Having stayed at many Marriott resorts, from the JW Collection to the business properties, this isn't the crown jewel in the chain. If you want to stay in Kaanapali, I can recommend the Hyatt and Sheraton as much better than this Marriott having stayed at both within the past year. Oh well, next time I know better. For families, this is a good place. There are a lot of childrens activities and the pool is quite large to keep the kids entertained. This is definitely not the property for a quiet or higher-end/higher-clientele stay. If you have descriminating tastes, you may be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “1st stay at Napili Tower”
Reviews.Author: Cleeclub
Reviews.Content: We are owners at MOC and upgraded to the Napili Tower a couple of years ago. We had stayed at the MOC a couple of times before and didn't care for the interior blase interior hallways, not having a full kitchen or wash/dryer in the unit. The Napili Tower has all those appliances, plus easier and nicer entrances. The beds are very comfortable and the units are spacious, although not as spacious as in the older MOC. We were hoping that the pool in front of the Napili Tower would be more quiet with less kids as in the main pool, but not such luck. The jacuzzi was always filled with splashing kids, it was not very inviting. Luckily, the lawn area between the pool and beach was ideal for reading and napping, a place to catch some peace and quiet. There was quite a bit of sand in the Napili Pool because the rinse off showers were placed in the far corners of the pool, people didn't want to bother walking that far, so in they went from sandy beach into pool. Someone didn't plan the showers very well. There should be one at each entrance, at least a foot rinse. Back to the unit - 2 small balconies with heavy iron furniture. 2 chairs and small table on 1balcony, the 2nd one barely fit 4 chairs and a eating table. It was a struggle to open the door and squeeze around, we ended up using the slider from the bedroom rather than the door which swung open the wrong way from the living room. The outdoor furniture is way too heavy, hard and too large for the size of the balcony. Cold to sit on too. We ended up taking the living sofa pillows and putting them on the chairs for comfort. Again that wasn't thought out well. Should have just stuck with the same MOC balcony furniture. But the worst is the parking situation for Napili Tower guests. Extremely limited because it is mostly used by valets. The design is poor as well, once you're in, there's no way out except backing out. The parking structure over at the Lahaina Towers is a hike, was totally unacceptable. Self parking is complimentary for owners, but valet isn't until we complained and ended up getting comped for the valet as well. At least they acknowledged the problem and accommodated us. There is also little, if no control of who does park in the 2 story structure, even people that use the beach. No parking sticker, no gate, anyone can basically park there. There are a few other annoyances with the units at the Napili Towers, but we learned to live with them for a week. And yes, people put their towels on the chairs by 6:30-7am and didn't use them for hours. No staff member came by to control the towel reserving of chairs which is something that they could have done a better job of. Housekeeping came in for the 'mid-week tidy' even though we had paid for a full clean. Apparently wasn't on their sheet. If we hadn't been in the unit at the time to be able to ask the maid, we probably wouldn't have gotten it yet paid for it. Came back again the following day for a full clean even though we only had 2 nights left. Other than that, we love the location and enjoy Maui. Especially Mama's Fish House, watching the windsurfers, the Slackkey concert at Naplili Kai, Cirque Polynesia was entertaining, snorkeling at Honolua Bay, Slaughterhouse and N. Kaanapali Beach, breakfast and lunch at the Sea House and the casual, right off the beach, Castaways. The drive up to Julia's Banana Bread stand in Kahakuloa was quite the white knuckle experience, worth every scary mile. Kids even hiked down to the Olivine Pools for a swim , but not good if wearing flimsy flips. The week went by too fast - as always.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money”
Reviews.Author: SMJCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the newer buildings and yes the room looked nice. We had asked for a quiet room on a higher floor and were given a room on the 3rd floor by the service entrance and across from the loud nightly show at the hotel next door. We had 2 adults and 1 child who slept on the pull out couch. We had to make the bed on the pullout ourselves ,the bed was awful and full of springs. There was only 2 of each item in the kitchen and not 4 as the room could accommodate so it made it very hard to eat. At 10:00 am every chair on the hotel grounds was covered with a towel but yet only a small fraction had people on them. We had to place our towels on a sectioned off grass area so we could go swimming. They did not light the tiki lamps by the pool at night, only the main ones on the path so there was no atmosphere. A fire alarm warning with loud speaker talking woke us up one day. We usually stay at Marriottâ€™s and really like them but will not go back to this one. The beach was not the best beach.

Reviews.Title: “If you want your kids around a beach...”
Reviews.Author: Diggitysiggty
Reviews.Content: If you want your kids around a beach where smoking pot is a daily event and to be harassed by wanna be cops this IS the place for you! Beach is great many of the staff are too however there are sufficient inept lairs to ruin your time while robbing your wallet

Reviews.Title: “Terrific site - but beware the hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdwatkin
Reviews.Content: Travel caution here - there are 3 parts of this hotel, 2 of them are brand new offerings in line with Marriott's Vacation Club (MVC) and they are everything you would expect of Marriott. Then there's the part we stayed in - the "conversion" hotel, which is a purchased hotel that Marriott did a very poor job of semi-renovating. We ended up in this part by accident using the awful Interval International exchange company to book the trip where they stated it was equivalent to the normal MVC properties. The grounds themselves are beautiful, the pools are great and the staff is friendly. The beach is not "all that". Its rather small, about 15-30 feet of it before hitting the water, then lots of rocks. To get to a decent beach is a good hike either north or south of the hotel. When you stay here, you are paying a premium for the location and the facilities, but the rooms are far overpriced for what they are. About the rooms in the conversion hotel: upon checkin there were ants in our bathroom. Then the tub drains were clogged with human hair and other gunk - disgusting. Stains on the furniture and carpets. The manager moved us to another room. The frig was in poor condition, wouldn't keep our stuff cold enough - the engineer said "that's just how it is". Eventually got a brand new frig in the room and it worked properly. Onsite dining is the same mediocrity I've come to expect from a MVC property. Every meal is about $50-$75. We ate poolside, it was decent. "Longboards" is their high-end restaurant, overpriced and underwhelming. One meal for example, the Opa with coconut lime sauce was great, but my wife's beef was way overcooked, my son's Grilled cheese was burned and my daughter's burger came out fine. There are plenty of great places to eat in nearby Lahaina and having a frig helps with the high-priced breakfast and lunches. The grills were almost always in use. To sum it up - great location near Lahaina, lots of nearby activities, terrific facilities, friendly staff and dumpy hotel rooms in the conversion part (only book the newer towers). There are better options for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: AutoPilotOn
Reviews.Content: What is not to like. Definitely a family resort. Three pool areas with kids play area. Plenty of chairs. Hammocks everywhere. Rooms very nice. Outstanding beach area. Outstanding grounds. Restaurant food very good. Service excellent. Staff excellent. 5 minutes from massive shopping and restaurants. Great Sunsets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit Again”
Reviews.Author: Teach1977
Reviews.Content: This is the 3d time we have stayed here in the same tower, Molaki. Finally construction is over and the towers are all built. Prices have gone up. Our unit 7019, had 2 bathrooms and 1 bedroom. Nice unit, with a balcony overlooking the Ocean. Good location of the Timeshare. Free parking for timeshare owners, $8.00 if a hotel guest. My one concern, hard if nt impossible to get shade at the poo. Towels were everywhere at 7:15, every morning, no one was around, just the towels. This did bother me! We did not eat here, just the coffee mug for $36.00. I would stay here agin on a trade.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ballnchain1010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort through Marriott timeshare. It was a beautiful tropical paradise. the pool was great and the location was excellent - a short walk on the beach or boardwalk to whalers village (a large outdoor shopping mall with restaurants & nightly shows). it was also nice to walk to the hyatt as they had nice restaurants and wildlife on the grounds. if we hadnt had the time share, as a couple i'd prefer to have stayed at the hyatt as they had swim up bars & less kids running around, but would definately stay here again. Very clean and well managed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: PAEagles
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2br 3bath ocean front unit in the original section of the hotel and we were there from July 9 to 17. We could not have been happier with our stay at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club. The place in terrific in all aspects; the pool is unbelievable, the grounds are immaculate, and the people who work there are very friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean and super big, way to big for only 4 people, we could easily have 6 or 8 people in the room. The hotel was very attentive to your needs, if you called down for anything they were knocking on your door within 10 minutes. The pool area is really great, it has waterfalls, volleyball, a basketball hoop and slides, lots of fun for people of all ages. The pool is only about 30 yards from the ocean so you have ocean view from most of the lounge chairs. There is also excellent bar and food service at the pool area, someone came by frequently to see if you needed anything. Right next to the pool is the pool bar which had afternoon happy hour specials. Between the pool and the ocean was a nice walking path that winds its way along the ocean in front of all the hotels. About a 5 minute walk down the path is Whalers village which is a great place for shopping, eating, and drinking, it has quite a few outdoor bars and restaurants. They have several outdoor grills which are very popular but not difficult to get. We cooked out 3 nights and it worked out great. By the way, the grills are spotless as they must clean them everyday. We rented an ocean front cabana for $40 and it was worth every penny, we had a great time as the other people we were with rented them the same day so we had four in a row. Couple of other things: Plenty of free parking, free high speed internet thoughout the hotel and pool area, and a great fitness center. Overall we had a great time and would stay there in again. The only negative thing I would say is that it is difficult to get a lounge chair if you are not an early riser. You need to be down at the pool by 5:45am to get the best locations, 6:30am will get you good locations, generally if you're not down by say 8:15 your pretty much out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds/excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: firsttimerstomaui
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week at the Marriott Ocean Club. We rented from owners and stayed in a a 1-bdrm/2-bath on the 9th floor of the Molokai tower. Room was nice, not outstanding, but very clean. I wish the lanais from the bdrm and living room were connected, though. These older towers will be renovated in August, so I won't go into detail about the rooms, since they will be changing. Super pool was excellent and my 6 & 9 y.o. daughters loved it. Pool lounges were nearly impossible to find, however. Guests were saving lounges with towels by 6 a.m. and I am not exaggerating in any way! This was frustrating, since hotel staff did not remove unattended belonging, though they were clearly not being used for hours at a time. Chairs became available around 4pm. Beach/snorkeling directly in front of hotel was okay, though water is very shallow over reef. Just next door, in front of the Alii Resort, is an excellent sandy-bottom beach with calm waters that my kids loved. On-site Longboards' restaurant was excellent, as was the service. Pool service was acceptable, though the bartender had about as much personality as a wet sock. Maybe he was having a bad week?? Self-parking was easy, but a moderate walk from the rooms. Grounds and buildings are immaculate. We used the grills to bbq and noticed they were cleaned every morning by staff. Beachwalk Market was over-priced and had limited selection, so we shopped at Safeway at Cannery Mall. Weekly activities were numerous, but we did our own thing. Overall, an excellent property and we would stay again. Our trip was July 3-10 and the only thing I would change is not to stay on the 4th. The resort had great activities going on around the Super Pool, but it was soooo jam packed with people that we did not participate. Great view of the fireworks from our room made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected and more!!!”
Reviews.Author: debe79
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our vacation, we stayed at the Marriott Ocean Club and we totally enjoyed the resort. Our vacation was from June 26th to July 3rd, we stayed in a one bedroom two bathroom condo. The rooms were great and clean, the bed was very comfortable. The only issue was that our room wasn't ready until 5pm, which wasn't too big of a deal since we were vacationing with two other families so we hung out in their rooms. The pool was fabulous!!! We had a hard time getting the kids out of the pool. It was great to have the pool bar service for the happy hours and the food, all of the servers were nice and friendly. They also give you a towel card at check in for two beach towels per person, but don't forget to turn in your towels when you check out or you will be charged $25 for two towels. We ate at Longboards which we enjoyed. The men loved the ahi tuna. Whalers Village is a great place to walk to for all of the restaurants and shops, there's something for everyone. We would walk there at least once a day. We also enjoyed the restaurant Hula Grill, they had the best, best macadamin crusted mahi-mahi. The beach in front of the Marriott was pretty rocky, but all you needed to do is go down the beach a little ways and you would have a sandy bottom, which was great for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, oversold, overcrowded”
Reviews.Author: auburndan
Reviews.Content: Mom and Dad gave my wife their timeshare for the week, so we can't complain too much. Bottom line, this property is on the downturn, the pool is undersized (built to accomodate only one tower -- now there are three). You need to be aggressive if you want a lounge chair near the pool -- requires camping out by 6:30 am or forget it, and dual "cabanas" facing the beach cost $40 day. People are friendly, but unless you plan to purchase more vacation rental time, the staff ignores you. If you are a Mariott Timeshare member, be aggressive and use bonus points to upgrade to a suite. The basic room is disappointing. Our room (6107) was ocean facing, but there is no air circulation with the slider wide open (not even a ceiling fan in the room). The basic room is just a hotel room -- and you need topay an extra $25/nite for houskeeping if you want fresh towels or linens. But Maui is Maui, and our hotel is free. We got what we paid for......

Reviews.Title: “Right off the bat, be aware that this is...”
Reviews.Author: scottpajason
Reviews.Content: Right off the bat, be aware that this is a time share property. We booked our honeymoon through Orbitz and got a decent ocean front room by the big pool. The hotel rooms are a little dated, but well kept. Service is good on the property and employees are very friendly. You can get discounts on excursions like snorkeling, if you take the painful time share tour. The restaurant, Longboards is tasty, offers Happy Hour, and great staff. Our problem with the resort was it's not the most ideal honeymoon accomodations. It's a family (kids, lots of kids) kind of place. Also, time share people are ignorant and seem to leave their common sense at home. If you want a quiet and enjoyable stay on Maui, stick to Wailea and the higher end places.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: onthegomommy
Reviews.Content: We just got home after staying a week at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club. We rented our 2b/3ba from a timeshare owner. I was a little nervous but it worked out perfectly and was less expensive than renting directly from Marriott. We were guaranteed a garden view but were pleased to see we also had a pretty good view of the ocean from all 3 lanais on the top floor! We were in the oldest tower but it was spotless, had flatscreens, 2 microwaves, 2 toasters, 2 refrigs, crisp linens and enough of a kitchen that we could microwave meals and have breakfast. The location is 100% perfect! You are right on Kaanapali Beach right next to the Hyatt. They have 3 gorgeous pools and the grounds are immaculate. We were worried about crowds but it wasn't overwhelming. We always found chairs (maybe not pool front) but we could almost always get a view of the ocean. You are given cards to trade in for pool towels daily. I've read some reviews that complained about this but I don't see the problem. They have free washer/dryers which is a blessing. The food at Beach Walk was really pretty good. The pool bar is pricey but what else would you expect. The staff as a whole were very attentive and always friendly. We had a couple small issues in our room and they were fixed within 20 minutes of phone call to front desk. Not bad! Overall for our family of 5, our room was huge and comfortable and we had a perfect week. Didn't eat at Longboards restaurant but had drinks. They do need a more friendly bartender. They only asked us once about the timeshare presentation. We did attend and got $75 gc and used at Momma's Fish House in Paia. It was worth our time! We cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Mike1944
Reviews.Content: We booked through our Timeshare with Interval, and it was a beautiful Resort right on the beach. Hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating and Resort was impecably clean. My only complaint was that we only were stocked with 4 dishes and utensils so we had to wash constantly. I would, however, stay there again. We dined at Lelani's right down from the Resort and it was excellent, as was the pricing. The Hula Bay restaurant was next door to it and was great also.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Keffco
Reviews.Content: We were guests of Marriott owners who swapped in here from Kauai and we got an ocean view (6015/16) in the older section. No kitchen, but microwave, bar fridge, sink, ice machine nearby, free laundry downstairs. Two king size bedrooms, very comfortable. In the midst of all the Kaanapali beach activity but easy to find a quiet shady spot to enjoy the awesome water views. Great beach walking along a path up through N Kaanapali to the old Embassy. Sandy swimming beach. Restaurant is very good but the cafe is a bit like a fast food spot, we avoided it. Market on site for essentials.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort with great service and location - just a walk to the beach!”
Reviews.Author: 2gfrcol
Reviews.Content: We just just stayed here 4/30/10 thru 5/7/10 - with another couple in a 2BR oceanfront with kitchen/living room and (2) balconies in newer buildiing section. The staff from check-in to check-out was just wonderful and friendly. From a couple that vacations alot.......very aware of customer service and issues with resort properties.......this was definetely a "winner" all the way around. The bedroom very clean; bed comfortable with ample space (minus air pillows - not comfortable); bathroom had all amenities; no problem with noise; safes in both rooms; kitchen and dining room able to accomodate up to (6) for dinner; the whole property is non-smoking as well (all of Hawaii is) which was great! The resort marketplace food/restaurant open at all convenient times and had pretty good breakfast items for your first morning after mainland trip - recommend parfait/french toast; prices are fine considering the location....you sit oceanfront watching all of the activities. Our favorite place to watch sunset and have mai-tai's was at Longboards during Happy Hour every evening from 5-7PM; Rene was perfect for this job.....made us laugh and happy all the time! They have great appetizers and drink specials while sitting on surfboard type seats.....very cool and fun. One word of caution.......keep your footing on the sand and chair close by after having couple of drinks....this could be a challenge. You are sitting oceanfront watching beautiful sunset between palm trees and property grounds. If you drink too much....you can go to nearbye hammocks also to sleep! This is a timeshare resort property......no major push at all.......do recommend attending presntation because you do get alot of perks/savings if possible! Kathleen was our host desk person check-in at our villa towers; she was awesome also.....very friendly/great smile everyday. The pool service/staff was also great.....always coming around to see if you needed anything (food/drinks/book tours, etc.) Great number of pools for all family....adults/seniors/children with many hot tub areas. Great exercise room also to shed off any additional Hawaiin plates of food. Resort sits in front of walkway area open to all public.....this was a added plus because you can wake up early if from East Coast and do AM walk sunsrise and hear ocean/birds while exercising in front of all other beautiful resorts(great time to take addtl pictures). Whalers Village really close bye with great restaurants including Hula Grill and of course an ABC Store. If you do not have car....you can catch the local bus for $1.00 from this location which will take you down to Lahaina for additional shopping/eating opportunities. We also saw the Cirque Hawaii show across the street...it was just okay .....we got it free as part of time share presentation attendance....if you do attend timeshare presentation.....ask for Craig Thrift. Valet parking is available but you can park free at (2) nearbye locations. The concierges desk help was always very helpful and booked us a tour to Lanai via ferry from Lahaina. This was one of our most memorable experiences.....if you have not been able to see Maui from afar....highly recommend. Best way to do it is let activity desk book you the whole day experience with open 4x4 jeep...visit the (2) hotels including the lodge while in Lanai....go to the Garden of Gods/Shipwreck Beach areas. Don't forget to take alot of sunscreen and extra clothes/snorkeling gear for change. Garden of Gods beautiful but alot of wind/red dirt...be ready to be cleaned up before heading back to ferry at port. Lanai also has a little downtown in middle...lots of nice shops and people.......one of the best places to get a Hawaii plate for lunch and just watch the local life go by....very relaxing and less cosmopolitan than Maui. This is one of the best vacations we had and would like to thank Marriott for everything.........they are doing everything right at this resort!

Reviews.Title: “I'm still apologizing to my family for booking us here.”
Reviews.Author: washingtondcgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked my family of four adults in two standard oceanfront rooms in the Lahaina & Napili Villa tower in mid-May. I still feel awful about it. The quality of the hotel, service and amenities were subpar for Marriott. The rooms are adequate if small, but smell as though they are regularly fumigated with coconut glade to cover the mildew stench. It'd be understandable if the hotel were one of the more affordable, older family-run establishments, but the towers are relatively new and not inexpensive. Also striking is the nickle-and-diming: Despite paying $250 a night, the hotel housekeeping will not change the bed linens without a hefty charge. In a beach enviroment, that means sleeping in sandy sheets no matter how much care you take after a day or so. The walls are also paper-thin, Â and since this is a family-heavy hotel, that means listening to screaming kids in the next room. The main pool is heavily crowded even in the off-season, and one of the pool bars closes two days mid-week. Overall, I felt like we wasted our money and really made a bad decision staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: rett1
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday from a 6 night stay at the Marriott Ocean Club. We had a Studio/Oceanfront room # 8305. It was everything we hoped it would be, and so much more! We we're in the Naplili tower, 8th floor. Very peaceful. Lanai looked out over the Naplili pool, lawns, beach, and finally the ocean! This was direct oceanfront. The studio has a kitchenette. Micro, good size refrig, 12 cup coffee maker, 2 slice toaster. We requested a blender upon arrival, and it was there within minutes. The staff at this resort can't do enough for you. Very prompt and helpful service. The Longboards restaraunt on the property was very good! They offer many specials, and oceanfront location. It was the best meal of the trip! Also very convient to the beachwalk, and Whalers Village. Pools we're Wonderful, also a huge grassy lawn with plenty of lounge chairs. I would recommend this to anyone wanting a beautiful oceanfront location!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: liv1ers
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we came to the Marriott after staying at the Maui Ritz for 5 days. Marriott Ocean club sounds fancy but it has more of a motel 6 ish feel to the rooms and how you enter the rooms. The staff was friendly. The pictures look better than reality. We selected it for the water slides and priate ship for our 3 year old daughter. Our daughter was too small to go down the water slide so that left the pirate ship which she did enjoy. We paid $271/night which seemed extremely high for what we experienced. I would sum it up as a 3 star hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room but odd shower head and TV remote”
Reviews.Author: redmondmomoftwo
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we have stayed at the Ocean Club and were very pleased with our room until we tried the shower and TV. Shower has a detachable shower head that requires you hold it while washing yourself. When you put it back up on the wall it takes a minute to figure out how to swivel it so it sprays down and it is located only about 5 ft off the floor!. Very odd. Also, TV remote doesn't work like the ones in every other hotel. You have to use two remotes and enter in some odd code and who knows what from there. We didn't bother and treated room as one without a TV. Room also has a small flat screen TV. For an otherwise upscale room, these items were a disappointment. Other than that, the location is fabulous, and the pool area is one of the best, and since we spend most of our time outside these annoyances are easily overlooked..

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: Parktraveler46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple spent a week at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club. Our second floor unit had two bedrooms, three baths, living room/kitchenette. Each of the bedrooms and the living room had a balcony with two chairs and a side table overlooking the pool and ocean. The rooms were quite spacious and immaculate. While there was not a cook top or oven, we did have a small refrigerator, microwave and dishwasher along with adequate dishes and utensils. The hotel has a number of large gas grills where we were able to prepare several dinners. While the resort bustled with activity during the day, it was very quite at night allowing for a good nights sleep. There are several pools available, which were crowded during the day, but not busy prior to 10:00AM or after 7:00 PM. There was lovely landscaping around the pools, but despite having "three acres" of pools, I did not find any of them laid out in a manner to allow for lap swimming. The Ocean Club is located on Kaanapali Beach which s a planned resort community with a sidewalk along the beach that connects all of the resorts, hotels, and a shopping center. The location of this resort is excellent and we found that we were able to walk to a number of shops and restaurants. The beach in front of the Ocean Club, is among the finest in Kaanapali Beach. While we did not have children in our group, this would be an excellent place for children and extended families. TIP: We found the best place to purchase fresh fish and seafood to grill was at the Fish Market on Honoapiilani Rd. About a block from the Fish Market is the Farmers Market which has some very nice fresh produce. These two markets are much better than the Safeway Market that everyone shops at in Lahaina. Next door to the Farmers Market is a coffee shop which had the finest Kona coffee we found.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: LONG3
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in the Napili villas for spring break this year. Everything was perfect. We had a two bedroom, mountain view villa. The entire place was spotless and had every amenity. We used the Napili pool and the main pool and both were nice and extremely fun for kids. We also liked that everyday from 1:00 - 2:00 you could get shave ice at the main pool for only $1. Everyone we came in contact with at the resort was friendly and seemed happy to be at work. I was even greeted at check in with a beautiful flower lei. It was also nice to be able to walk to the Whalers Village each night to shop or go to Yogurtland (my favorite!). The only negative probably is the parking. If you got back after 8 p.m. it was hard to find a spot in the Napili parking lot. Don't hesitate to stay here. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Expect more from Marriott-not maintaining their properties”
Reviews.Author: King06
Reviews.Content: On a number of fronts, Marriott is slipping on quality, upkeep, service and experience. I am currently staying at the Marriott Ocean Club in Maui and it hurts me to say that this facility is not keeping up with other Marriott properties and certainly not with the competition. Let me give you a few examples: 1. Peeling on the ceiling of the guest room 2. Bathroom doors that are warping and peeling 3. Couches that are stained and gray from too much wear. According to Trip Advisor, this ranks #6 in Lahaina...I'm quite frankly surprised, as there's a number of properties nearby that are superior. Also, what's with Marriott not taking any accountability for putting us in room without a full Kitchen, as we had booked and paid for. Essentially, they told us, there's nothing they can do about it. Also, be aware of the neighboring property that puts on a loud concert 5 nights a week. If you want a restful, relaxing vacation, think twice as you get loud music and drums booming across the entire property. Okay, it typically goes until 9:00PM, but still, I come on vacation to relax, not to get stressed out by loud music events next door. Especially when you arrive from the US mainland, where your bodyclock is 3-6 hours behind Hawaii time; 9:00PM local time is midnight-3:00AM for most folks from the mainland. All in all, we've had much better stays elsewhere. While it has a great view of the ocean, we expect alot more from Marriott. They're really dropping the ball. If you're coming to Maui for a vacation, take some extra time to evaluate your options before choosing the Marriott Ocean club.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: cckc123
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in the Marriott Maui Ocean Club on Kaanapali in late Feb. I got a good deal on the web for a 1 bedroom suite with â€œgarden viewâ€�, but it turned out to be overlooking the parking lot and the tennis court. The room was big, around 800 sq ft with 2 bathrooms, but the room was a bit aged and the furniture looked very old fashioned. Got free internet service in the room and $6 parking fee which was acceptable. The room was very clean, bed was comfy, and 2 big flat screen TV in the suite. The shower head in the bathtub was too big but the water pressure was a bit weak so when you use the shower the water was running very slow. The mini kitchen was fully equipped and you can also use one of the many BBQ stoves near the pool. The ground and the pool were beautiful and very close to the beach. The staff at the Marriott was very nice at all time and will try their very best to help you. Check-in and check-out were fast and efficient. The hotel is just 2 mins drive to Whalers Village with lots of shops and good food. Try out the tasting menu at the Hula Grill, the food was good with outdoor seating and the price was just ard $25 each (can also try KIMOâ€™s on the Front Street in Lahaina, very good food and nice view of sunset, also have good outdoor seating).

Reviews.Title: “The place to be....”
Reviews.Author: dclhomes
Reviews.Content: When I checked in there was a MAJOR [--] complaining and upset about something, I really wanted to go punch him, I could think on only one excuse to act like he did and that would be a pile on your bed??Anyways I was telling my wife on the way up to our room. She says- maybe he had a good excuse, then we go into our ocean front room to discover it faces the parking garage. Now mind you I was staying for free (used Marriott points) unless you stood out on lanai and looked out over it to the right then you could see the ocean (possible ocean view?). They gave me a different room which was great, service was good, everything about this place was great again! Never saw the [--] again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Todd_Tomorrow
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui and we were really excited to stay at the Marriott Ocean Club. We've always been pretty happy with Marriott resorts and were hoping that the Ocean Club was up to the usual standard. It was! We had a second floor "studio" which was a king bed, fold out couch and small kitchenette (microwave, sink, refrigerator). The room was large and the lanai big enough for 2. The only thing missing from the room was a desk area. Instead, they had a small table and two chairs. Nice but a desk would have been better. We stayed in the Napili tower, which was newish and very comfortable. It had it's own pool and a great view of the beach. The grounds of the hotel are great, very well maintained with lots of flowers. The beach area is perfect - wide and sandy. There is a "boardwalk" in front of the hotel that runs along all the hotels in the area up past the Whalers Mall. Being in walking distance to the mall was great - as it gave both shopping choices and other choices for meals. Meals at the hotel were pretty limited - the pool "market" area (sandwiches and drinks) and Longboards, and outdoor dining restaurant. No room service (bummer). The staff was very good. The timeshare folks were not pesky at all and the overall feeling of the resort was friendly and comfortable. We will probably be back next time we travel to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: vacationlover797
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with 4 other couples just spent a week at this timeshare property. We were there for 7 nights and we had a fabulous time! We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa with a full kitchen and a w/d. We were on the first floor with our lanai facing the beach which was a great thing until the last day of the tsunami warning :). There were always ample lounge chairs on the lawn or by the pool. We did stay in the tower close to the hyatt side. The pool was clean although I must say the temperature in the jacuzzi tub was extremely hot (about 104 degrees). The room was clean and the bed was absolutely comfortable. On two occasions we requested something from the hotel (BBQ grill utensils & salt) and they were in our room within minutes and after that we got a call from the front desk wanting to know if our request had been fulfilled. NICE! They have a great fitness center! I had some of the appetizers at the Longboards Restaurant and they were yummy! Coconut shrimp, wings, calamari...they were all very good and if you go at happy hour you get them half off! No pressure at all from the timeshare people. We had a blast and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Maui Ocean Club”
Reviews.Author: GladysG4
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel, toured Maui, Lahaina, Haleakala, and loved every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location and not too pricey for a timeshare exchange...”
Reviews.Author: LarBearSSF-CA
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed out Marriott exchange at this location. The restaurant has a some GREAT deals on dinner specials and happy hour. The breach front is well taken care of and the pools are clean and well maintained from what we could see. You are not allowed to bring the chairs from the hotel down toward the beach, but you can "rent" beachfront cabanas to relax in if you really intend to sit on a the beachfront for an extended period of time. The timeshare presentation was NOT high pressure or pressured at all. It was hard to turn it down, but owning one week is all you really need to exchange into another Marriott. If you CAN afford it, purchase one of these 3 bedrooms for an every other year ownership. It'll give you good trading power for other islands or anywhere else in the world. Plus you really don't want to go to this island year after year, see the others too!!! :-) Good location to get around to other parts of the island. Rent a Jeep WITH 4x4 and do the WHOLE tour around the road to Hana and down south, it is worth it if you can get up and go around 8am. The resort is close enough to ALL the best beaches around, go to it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: mama34
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed in Marriott's Maui Ocean Club. We would definitley return!! We stayed in the Napili Towers in a 2 bedroom ocean view room. The staff was very friendly and the grounds were very clean and manicured. My kids loved going from the ocean to the pool and vice-a-versa. The only down side was the Longboards restaurant. Our waiter was rude and the food is pricey and no so great! Walk down to Whaler"s Village and eat at Leilani's! The food was great and I loved the price of the kids menu.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: scubachick_7
Reviews.Content: Traveled with friends who own a 2 bedroom timeshare in the older section of the resort. We had a 2 bedroom, 3 bath unit, with a partial kitchen. Units were very spacious and comfortable, clean, and plenty of towels provided. 2 small refrigerators, and balconys were located off both bedrooms and the living room. We were not able to check in until the published time of 4 pm, and had to check out by 10 AM. They do have a suite where you can shower and change after you check out, if you have a late flight like we did. Groceries were pretty expensive, as was food at the restaurants. Quality was good. Our favorite restaurants were Kimos in lahina, the hula Grill, and the Plantation house in Kapalua. Every day, we rented the ocean front chairs which provided comfortable seating and shade options. Cost for a unit with 2 lounge chairs was $40 per day, which was kind of expensive, but well worth it in my opinion as I need to limit my exposure to the sun. We saw hundreds of whales during our 9 day visit - early february, which is apparantly prime whale watching time. Service was good throughout the resort and this was one of our most favorite vacations of all time - very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly. Nice location”
Reviews.Author: US40
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a three bedroom ocean front villa on one of the upper floor of the Lahaina tower. The view was breathtaking and the rooms are large and very functional. The various starter kits (dishwasher, coffee, etc.) were better than in other resorts and we got a free tidy service once during our 7 night stay. The staff is friendly, but not always knowledgeable. Most of the staff is focused on selling you a time share unit and I found them a bit more persistent than in other Resorts. The pool area is very nice and even though the resort seemed to be well booked there was always enough space around the pool and plenty of lounge chairs everywhere. Of course food and drinks are very expensive (like everywhere in Maui) but the full kitchen with regular size refrigerator gives you options. As for Golf, I would highly recommend Kapalua village course (one of the most scenic courses I have ever played) and the pretty easy Wailea Emerald course (about 1 hour away). Whale watching on the Trilogy was pretty cool. Scuba rental from snorkel Bob's was easy and reasonable and we all enjoyed ourselves and had a great vacation. Check www.redweek.com for rentals from owner. I recommend using their escrow service for a secure, easy transaction.-----ALOHA----

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dewser40
Reviews.Content: We won a trip to Maui through my work and knew it would be amazing just because it was Hawaii, well we never dreamt it would be this amazing!! When we first got to the hotel we tried to check in early but the room wasnt ready. The front desk was very friendly and said we were more then welcome to hang out at the pool or the beach and that they had an area where we could change into our suits if we wanted to. They took our cell phone number and said they would call when it was ready. We decided to check the grounds out and since we were from Minnesota, and the Vikings were in the playoff's we wanted to watch the game. We hung out with a few other Minnesota Die Hearts at Longboards (the hotel restraunt/bar) and watched the game, as it turned out we should have went to the beach as we all know the Vikings didnt win! Besides the Vikings losing, it was a great experience they called us to let us know the room was ready. We went to our room and WOW.... it was amazing! When we first got there I thought oh bummer not a ocean view, our room overlooked the tennis courts. As we looked around from the balcony, what did we see but the most beautiful mountain view ever! As it turned out we watch the sunrise from our balcony every morning it was AMAZING! We had a one bedroom with small kitchen, dishwasher, micro, small fridge, perfect size for holding breakfast food and lunch. They have a very nice grilling area that you can use which is great, we had steaks 2 nights! Wish there might have been more dishes, but it was fine. It had two bathrooms which all women love. The bedroom was beautiful and the bed was VERY comfortable. Especially with the 4 Hr time change it is great when you can sleep! The Grounds were awesome, the employees were very friendly, Longboards restaraunt was delicous!! We were lucky one night they had a shrimp special, Stuffed shrimp, Excellent, the best we had ever had! The atmosphere was great, we sat outside and had dinner and could listen to the ocean as it was just a few yards away. The pool area was great we found a spot that we liked, a bit more private then the open area. It had a waterfall that we could listen to as we laid in the sun and read or just rested. There are a ton of areas to find for your perfect spot, the swimming area is fabulous! Absolutely NO pressure for Time Share!! They gave us the speech we let them know we were not interested last we heard about it! Thank you for that!! We couldnt have ask for a more wonderful place to stay, all I can say when people ask how it was Is AMAZING. I hope your experience brings you just as must happiness as it did us!!

Reviews.Title: “Great to Rent...Just Don't Buy a Timeshare”
Reviews.Author: HamachiReno
Reviews.Content: Marriott's Maui Ocean Club surprised us on the upside. Though our one bedroom ocean view suite (or do they call it a villa?) was a little dated, the view was incredible! The resort is very kid-friendly with a 3.5 acre superpool and a special "shipwreck beach" that kids love. They gave us a crib and high chair to use all week for free, as well as discounts for some of the local restaurants and shops. We walked around all the resorts in the Kaanapalli beach area, and this one had, perhaps, the best beach. Some of the other resorts only have a narrow strip of sand in front of them, but Marriott's had a real beach with plenty of room to stretch and play. Our unit did not have an oven (just a microwave) but worked well for breakfast and lunch. The whole resort is timeshares. We rented by simply calling the resort directly and were given our choice of dates at about $350/night (including all taxes). We also saw units on Craigslist for a similar price, but they were rentals by owner (not much guarantee against fraud) and all were for specific 7 day periods which were hard to use with our airline miles. According to timeshare owners we talked to, the unit we stayed in sells for about $19k for one week a year. The maintenance fee is about $220/night for owners, and rise every year. So for just $130/night more, we got flexibility, no lock in, and got to keep our principle (which can earn more than the nightly difference with simple, safe investments.) I ran the numbers. For ANY length of ownership, it is better to rent than own these units. That said, we recommend this place as a rental, especially if you have kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to take small children”
Reviews.Author: kcsea
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one-bedroom in the Napili Tower and really appreciated it. The rooms are new, and everything worked. The fridge, stove, oven, dishwasher, and washer/dryer were full size (or near full size). The kitchen, dining, and sitting areas were large. The bedroom itslef, however, was cramped, as was the lanai, but the overall size of the unit never made us feel crowded. We had an ocean front, which is really set back aways, but still had a good view of the little pool below and what we could see the ocean and beach through the trees and walkway. For a place that caters to families with kids, the walls and windows kept out most of the noise. Besides the rooms, the pool areas are the drawing card. Our toddler loved the pirate kiddie pool and exploring the big pools. They could use more lounge chairs. The staff was very helpful and stay out of your way. The condo sellers come on a little strong but did not bother us too much. The section of the beach in front of the hotel is not as nice as further north down Kaanapali Beach, which is in easy walking distance. There is a fair amount of coral and rocks, so be careful if you tread into the water there. The surrounding area is a busy resort area, so it is not best place if you are seeking a tranquil setting or an authentic Hawaiian experience. We ate once at the poolside cafe when the restaurant had too long of a wait. The food was better than typical pool food, and while it was definitely overpiced, it was fair for resort prices. The value will depend on how good of a deal you can get through Marriott or owners renting their week. The rack rate of $500 a night seems way too much, as it is not in the same luxury class as places like the Ritz or Four Seasons, but we loved it on a discounted price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiTraveller_10
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Kids had an awesome time in the 3 pools, main pool is huge with waterslides and waterfalls etc. Great location on Kaanapali beach. Restaurants excellent. Staff were fantastic. Our villa was roomy, clean and had a lovely view of the beach and ocean. We loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great for anyone!”
Reviews.Author: SacTraveler01
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week here. We have a 2 1/2 year old and it was perfect. Our room was a one bedroom and we were on the ground floor. The suite overall is really big but the bedroom was a little tight. Especially w/ our pack and play in there. We were literally 10 steps away from the pools which very few people were at so our toddler could "swim" around w/o us worrying about big kids running into her. Loved having a washer/dryer, and full kitchen. Utilized both of those quite frequently. The automated and secure doors are a little noisy especially at 5:00 in the morning but it didn't bother me much since I loved the location of being on the ground floor the rest of the time. Beach was great, husband took a private surf lesson w/ a great instructor. Mostly stayed in Kaanapali area. Went to the Aquatic Center/aquarium. It was windy that day so a good excursion but little and wouldn't go again. Overall had a wonderful vacation and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Napili Villas were perfect”
Reviews.Author: ltmm69
Reviews.Content: Rented a one bedroom, oceanfront villa for five nights. Kitchen was fully stocked with pots, pans and utensils. All appliances were top of the line (stove, full fridge, micro, dishwasher). Room was huge and fit three adults and one child easily. We were on the ground floor, about 10 feet from one of the smaller pools. Watched whales from the patio table. Main pool was fantastic with waterfalls and pirate ship for the kids. Large, immaculately kept, green spaces for the kids to play on. We received one message from the timeshare folks asking if we wanted to hear the pitch- didn't return their call and was not bothered further. Booked all our trips in Lahaina, directly with the whale watching boat (ULTIMATE WHALE ADVENTURES was fantastic!) and with the Atlantis sub- again, avoiding the timeshare pitch from all the "cheap tours" places. Expensive, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Marriott Maui Ocean Club - perfect location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: okebubbles
Reviews.Content: We just got back from ten days in Hawaii of which four were spent at the Marriott Ocean Club - if I could do it over again we would have never left there. The location was perfect for us, right on the beach, just a few miles from Lahaina where we went for a couple of meals, trips to Walgreens, and to the boat dock for our whale watching adventure. Except for the coral located right in front of the hotel, the beach was really nice. A vendor offering surf lessions was conveniently located near the resort and was a huge hit with my teenagers. The shops at Whaler's Village and Black Rock are just a short walk down the beach. We had an ocean view suite (not ocean front but still a nice view of the ocean) which featured a king bed and sofa bed, refrigerator, dishwasher, coffee maker, and kitchen utensils. A big bonus for me, since we have a family of four and were traveling for about two weeks, was the free washer and dryers - that saved me about $25 in laundry fees. The pool bar was fun, the pool was really nice, and the snack bar provided a pretty good selection of breakfast and lunch items. The Longboard's Restaurant was very good both times we ate there and the pool bar's lunch items were also good. The towel station tried hard to sell me on their suntanning products and Maui Jims sunglasses but I just ignored them. I suppose the timeshare people were also trying to hard sell us too but we also ignored them and the messages they left on our room phone. Every single staff member that passed by us said aloha. The employees were very, very nice. The clothing shop operaters were great too, except for the snack shop in the lobby - she was a little grumpy every time I was in there. I thought the Marriott Ocean Club had a great location, very nice rooms, good beach, and great food and beverage options.

Reviews.Title: “Great If Not For the Classless Timeshare People”
Reviews.Author: 3dayweekender
Reviews.Content: This was kind of a mixed bag because of the pushy timeshare people. The location of this place is truly amazing and the 1 bedroom condo we had (in a 3 story older tower) had to be one of the best oceanfront views on property. We were right on top of Longboards restaurant so the night view was of the ocean illuminated with the tikitorches and wonderful live music from below. Keep in mind, however, the beach right out front is very narrow, at some times in the day, it was even 10 feet wide. You have to walk down the beach a bit to even have sand castle building space. The BBQ grills are wonderfully accessible and picnic tables positioned to have an ocean view-we had some wonderfully homemade dinners there. Keep in mind there is no stove or oven in the units. We made a trip to Costco and had plenty of continental breaksfast items and sandwich stuff for lunch. On a downer note, the lady at the concierge desk was a little snobby and short tempered when we asked about activities. We got some amazing time share deal which included taking a time share presentation. The morning of our presentation the dishwasher/sink flooded while we were out and soaked the entire counter where some groceries were, kitchenette, and a few feet of carpet in the main area. We came back to the room to get ready for the presentation and saw the huge wet mess. We called the front desk and asked if we could cancel the presentation, the front desk said we could. While cleaning up and waiting for housekeeping, minutes later we got a call from the timeshare desk, they explained the front desk â€œdoesnâ€™t have the authority to make that decisionâ€� and threatened that we would have to pay the rack rate of the room if we didnâ€™t â€œget down hereâ€� and take the presentation. At that point his tone just became insulting and I asked to have the GM contact me. Hours passed and the timeshare desk manager continually called with a threatening tone. After hours of what felt like harassment, I emailed the GM directly and he finally called, apologized for the behavior of the timeshare desk manager, and assured we wouldnâ€™t be bothered again. We were bothered again hours later by an angry timeshare manager and just told him to contact the GM. What a day ruined! We would have less pressure and conflict attending the presentation, but then again maybe not. The location of this place is truly amazing and the 1 bedroom condo we had (in a 3 story older tower) had to be one of the best oceanfront views on property. The beach right out front is very narrow, at some times in the day, it was even 10 feet wide. You have to walk down the beach a bit to even have sand castle building space. The BBQ grills are wonderfully accessible and picnic tables positioned to have an ocean view-we had some wonderfully homemade grilled dinners there. Keep in mind there is no stove or oven in the units. Also keep in mind while the limited beach is a â€œwhite sand beachâ€� technically, the water is not clear like one might expect from Maui. Itâ€™s no where near the crystal clear water of Grand Cayman for example. The pool was fantastic for our little one. The slide and the pirate ship made for hours of great fun. The highlight of our trip was a morning sunrise walk on the beach (the benefit of still being on California time) to Whalers Village for coffee. If you come here and donâ€™t have to deal with the classless timeshare people this is a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel, in an incredible location.”
Reviews.Author: DWLasVegas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. Our room was right on the beach, when they say ocean front, they aren't kidding. The pool is huge, has a great slide, in short, it's one of the best pools I've ever seen. Rooms have everything but an oven. Beach was nice, although right outside the hotel, the shallow area of the beach had alot of rocks, but if you just go a few yards either way, it's sandy. Would definately stay here again, in fact the wife is already planning next years visit.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch--Buyer Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTumbleweed
Reviews.Content: We planned a family reunion at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club this Thanksgiving. We researched hotels for months and found a good rate of $275 night at this location if we PRE-PAYED IN FULL. We were told there were NO CHANGES or cancellations allowed with this rate. We agreed and pre-payed over $2,000 in July. When we checked-in I verified that this was a pre-payed room and they agreed. However, they wanted my Visa for any incidental room charges. This is standard practice, so I agreed. We had a nice stay. Great location, but the air conditioning did not work in our room so we were a little hot all week. However, when we checked out... we were informed that they were charging us an addtional $2,000 because we had stayed in a room with an "upgraded view" that cost over $500 per night (not the $275 room we had already pre-payed for). Why would they change a pre-payed rate that didn't allow changes? We had no idea we were in an upgraded room, did not ask for the upgrade, nor did we authorize an upgrade. And now Visa says we can't dispute the charge because we did stay in the room and the burden of proof is on us to prove we didn't ask for an upgrade! How can you prove that? The Marriott does not have to provide our signature or a recording of our voice authorizing the upgrade (of which they have neither). Basically, Maui Marriott is a time-share (sales driven) business. They can upgrade anyone at any time without authority (and the salesperson probably gets merit pay for these upgrades) because they know you can't prove that you didn't ask for it! RIP OFF! Everyone we've encountered at the Marriott corporation who we've contacted to resolve this matter has been horribly rude and unhelpful. Please, if you choose to stay here, watch your wallet closely and document everything. Also, read all of the MANY emails Marriott will send you confirming your reservation. We had 14 confirmation emails that all listed our original price, but they slipped one by us that had the $500 room rate listed. BUYER BEWARE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, sunny days in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: KathyMiller
Reviews.Content: We used our Marriott Rewards points to book this resort in Maui. Hadn't ever been here before, but read good reviews on TripAdvisor. We stayed in the new building. Had a studio room. It had a small kitchen and balcony that overlooked the lawn, pool and beach. The room was very nice and up to date. The entire resort was good. The people were extremely friendly, everyone on the island was very nice, helpful and friendly. Our favorite things to do was taking the road to Hana. Unbelievable! And taking a helicoper ride with Maui air. It was the best ever! Coupons for lots of things in the little books at the airport and all around. My husband is a fisherman, not much good fishing there though. He went out one day reef fishing and caught a few. We saw a few whales too. Not a whole lot to see just yet, but the few we saw was neat. Lot's of shopping around. Whaler's Village was walking distance on the sidewalk by the beach. Lot's of eating places there too. Overall the trip was great! I don't have any complaints about anyone or anything the whole week we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Services!”
Reviews.Author: Rondall
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the new towers ( i think napili tower) and loved everything about it. 1 bedroom ocean front was really big with a great kitchen and living area. The kitchen was well stocked for a week stay with most everything you need. Washer and Dryer came in handy a few times. We requested an upper floor for a view but when we arrived there were none available, so we got a ground floor room. The next day the more than accommodating and friendly front desk called to move us up to the fifth floor but our ground floor room was great. Basically walk out the back door and we were possibly 12 feet to a great salt-water pool that was never crowded ( the main pool was always packed) and very few kids at this side pool as well. Our room had a great bed, big bathroom with walk in shower, jet tub for two, 2 sinks, comfortable bed, 2 flat screen t.v.'s. For most I would recommend stopping at some type of grocery store by the airport (walmart, safeway) and picking up coffee, and some easy breakfast and lunch things. But do go out to eat dinner, we had incredible meals. Cane and Taro in Whalers Village was the BEST around this area hands down. It is new and well worth it. The beach front by this hotel was a larger area than most and very nice. Chairs were available to rent easily and towels were always available from the hotel for the pool and beach. Black rock was O.K. snorkeling but go out on one of the boats away from shore for incredible snorkeling. Obviously I liked it here and would recommend for most everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Beckcom
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time! Traveled with my mom, my 6 year old and 4 year old and husband. Resort couldn't be nicer. Was in one of the older towers for 7 days. Had lots of room. Loved the large bedrooms. Doesn't have a stove so we brought a griddle. Made pancakes, grilled cheese, ect - well worth it. The grills were easy to access. Loved the 3rd bathroom - the kids had their own. Was in the new towers for 2 days - they are beautiful! The bedrooms are smaller but you get a lot of space in the living area. Must have hit it at the perfect time, there were no crowds at the pool, beach or anywhere. The super pool is out of this world. The other two pools are very nice also. So close to the ocean and the beach was very soft. There are lots of rocks so bring the surf shoes. Walk about 1/2 mile to the Sherton and you almost sure to see see turtles. That was amazing! Can borrow sand toys and some floats from the kids club. We left ours there when we left so others could use them, there seems to be plenty. The staff and resort couldn't be better. Highly recommend. Old Lahania has lots of places to eat, get off the main drag a few blocks to find more price friendly ones. Penne Pasta has the most amazing meatballs and very well priced. What we did... The Maui Tropical Plantation is definitely the one to go to with kids. The hike at the Ioa State Park a few miles past it is a wonderful! Waterfalls, paved path, rocks to climb, beautiful. Haleakala was wonderful also, we went up for sunrise and hiked for a while - take jackets. Road to Hana is quite a trek. We did it but you have to be really committed to it if you take kids. They definitely get board. The walking tour offered free from the property was a little interesting - would do it if just adults, with young kids would skip it. Royal Lahaina Luau I think is the one for people with families. The kids are free with a paying adult. The show is showy and corny at times but the dancers are great and keep everyone's attention. Having kids food (hots, chicken nuggets, mac and cheese) is a god send to those with picky eaters. My son and daughter still talk about the fire dancers, which hardly any of the others had. Sure it wasn't the most authentic but great for our group. We all enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!! Stop looking now...you've found the best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: azfrankfour
Reviews.Content: This is such a great place to stay! We loved it and made our trip to Maui even more relaxing and fun!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: hollanderc
Reviews.Content: Our high expectations were not disappointed. We had one bedroom suite in the older building but it looked to be updated. We had two beautiful bathrooms and views of the ocean and pool from our balcony. The grounds are absolutely stunning! We went surfing in front of the resort, which was great fun and surprisingly easy. It's a 15 minute walk to great snorkeling with turtles at Blackrock and 5-10 minute walk to Whaler's village.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family stay”
Reviews.Author: ErinF73
Reviews.Content: This was excellent!!!! We had a 1 bedroom with the pull out sofa bed for our 4 1/2 yr old. They provided a pack and play for our 10 mo old. The pool is great for kids. Nice play area that you don't have to be in the water with them and lots of 3 ft areas for the older kids to still be able to touch. Great slide for those over 42". You can walk to Whalers Village, or go to Longboards for nice dinners. Lots of options for good food depending on what you need, take out, dine in, etc. You are a short drive from grocery stores and Lahaina. Can't say enough good things about this resort. Will be booking again for next year here.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: PetalumaTraveler
