Reviews.Content: We are owners at the original Ocean Club and also have a week at the Marriott Las Vegas, which we were able to trade into the Lahaina Towers. We were there October 30 through November 6. We had a two bedroom villa with a garden view. To the right, was the parking garage, but to the left, was the pool area and beyond that, the ocean. This room would be considered an ocean view almost anywhere. The Lahaina tower is just a few years old and it is really beautiful. It has a full kitchen, so we ate our breakfast and lunch in almost every day, and we had dinner in a few nights also. It's also nice to have a washer/dryer in the room. Very convenient. The beds are very comfortable and it was very quiet at night. This was our third stay at the Ocean Club, but the first time in a new tower. We love this property because of it's location. We drive there for about a half hour from the airport and then hardly use the car. My husband golfed twice at the Kaanapali golf course. I would go down to the Lahaina Cannery Mall for coffee in the a.m. or to Safeway for food. Other than a trip to Kapalu to the Plantation House for brunch, we did not use the car. You can walk to Whaler's Village for dining and shopping (there is a great ABC store there). We love Lelaini's and the Hula Grill. Both have fun bars and good food. We did go into Lahaina one night and ate at the Lahaina Girll. Excellent food, but very pricey. The best part of this property to us, is the location. We have been to Maui six times now and just want to go and relax. This place is perfect for that. We did not hear good things about Longboards, the restaurant on site. You can get much better food at Whaler's Village or in Lahaina for a similair price. Walk down to the Hyatt Regency and sit at their outdoor bar and watch the sunset. Beautiful! The only downside was the timeshare presentation. We were talked into going because my husband could get 2 rounds of golf, which is worth almost $400. We were honest going in that we already had 2 timeshares and weren't in a position to buy another week. The salesman started out very friendly and understanding, but as the presentation went on, he became almost beligerent and angry when he realized that he couldn't sway us into a sale. Other than that, the staff was wonderful, friendly and helpful. We are going back next year! Will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: FNC058
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7 night stay at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club and had a great time. We arrived earlier that posted check in time and they took our cell # down and called us when the room was ready. We had a one bedroom in the Napili Villas and it was perfect. Great kitchenette, bathroom facilities and the AC unit was in the living area so you couldn't hear it. We didn't hear any noise at all, the room was practically sound proof. The staff was friendly and efficient when we dealt with them. The pools and grounds were well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: carsie18
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the lock-off rooms in the Lahaina Tower (ocean front) from October 27th-November 1st and were truly happy with our choice. We weren't sure about this property but are sure glad we chose it. The room, although small, was very clean. Housekeeping seemed to sneak in and clean it, sometimes when we were gone for just an hour!!! The view from the lanai was wonderful and just the right size for two people. We loved waking up to see the ocean and Lanai in the background. The fact that the room had a fridge, microwave, toaster and coffee maker was great. We stopped at the Safeway and bought some groceries and had breakfast and lunch everyday on the lanai. We actually went to Longboards twice and enjoyed our meals there. Not it's not cheap but then nothing on Maui is! The pools were great. We spent most of our time at the one outside our villa but did venture over to the main pool which was lovely. I would defininitely stay here again but next time I would bring the kids and stay in a 1 bedroom villa - even though our room did have a pull-out couch. It would have been much too small for a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: aabbzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 2 bedroom/2 bath villa. It's an ideal accommodation for family w/ young children. It's like being home! The units are brand new and well maintained. If you need anything more, concierge will get it for you.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: riverandsnow
Reviews.Content: What a great place. We stayed in the older Lanai section Rm 329 with a moumtain view. The one bedroom units were quite roomy. Roomier than the new Napili timeshares we toured. The only negative was ours, and 3 or 4 rooms on the 2nd & 3rd floors in this section are across from the hotels very large AC and electrical units. We didn't use the lanai much or keep the windows open due to unsightliness and noise. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The rooms and grounds were very clean. The bed was quite comfortable. They have a great meandering pool with waterslide - waterfalled swim through grotto - a childrens area complete with water play area / pirate ship - volley ball area etc. The beach is narrow in this area and you kind of have to jump down a couple feet to get on it. The hotel should notch the bluff or provide steps. The water doesn't look too promising in terms of snorkeling but it turned out to be the best snorkeling I found during two week in Hawaii. Just past the breakers you are into fish. Lots of fish. After 100 feet or so you are into some really great coral features. I saw several turtles laying down in coral nooks or swimming. Would not recommend the on site "Longboard" restuarant as most of the food was mediocre, especially for the price charged

Reviews.Title: “New Napili Villas - Pictures”
Reviews.Author: jaimo77
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying in the Napili Villas that opened in Jan. 2009. I am posting a ton of pictures because I became very frustrated with the lack of real pictures when researching this place for our trip. There were tons of pictures/reviews for the regular Maui Ocean Club (which is right next door and which we stayed in last week). I hope the pictures are useful for others hoping to stay here. Let me just say this Napali tower is amazing. Everything is brand new and beautiful within the unit. They did an excellent job of decorating and decking it out with the top of the line appliances. The Napili tower has only ocean front views or island views. The Lahaina Tower has partial oceanview rooms also. We have an ocean front and it is amazing. There is a huge grassy area in front of the tower and then there is the beach. They have situated the living and kitchen area so you can see straight out onto the ocean and the view is breathtaking. The kitchen has everything you need to cook in and is a good size. The dining room table can comfortably seat 6 people and 8 if necessary. The living room is a good size and the entire space feels very open. The entire living/dining room and kitchen are tile with a rug in the living room. The bedroom is nice, but on the small/tight side (the rooms in the older part of the Maui Ocean club are much bigger). There isn't much room to walk around in the bedroom and not much room to store stuff other than the small closet. Teh bedroom is carpeted which is nice. The bathroom area itself is also pretty tight with a toilet and shower. There is a very large soaking tub that is between the bathroom and the bedroom. It is nice if you like to take baths, but I would have rather had more room in the bedroom. The balcony in this 1 bedroom unit is also on the slmall side and barely holds a table and 4 chairs. The main part of the hotel/pool area is amazing and I know there are ton of reviews for that already. I would def. recommend these new towers and cant' wait to come back next year! Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: ChaserMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great! Marriott's Maui Ocean Club was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Second trip to Maui Ocean Club”
Reviews.Author: pomcentral
Reviews.Content: This was our second year vacationing at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club. The grounds are beautiful, right on the ocean at Ka'anapali Beach. We had an ocean view room in the Molokai building on the 3rd floor which had a spectacular view. We also enjoyed the super pool with waterslide. It is within walking distance to Whaler's village and to the Hyatt next door (Drums of the Pacific luau). Our son took surfing lessons. Snorkeling at nearby Black Rock was crowded but many fish were seen as well as 2 large turtles. The pool was recently refurbished with night lighting added. The staff was very accomodating before and during our stay. The rooms have kitchens, so we recommend a stop at Costco on Dairy Rd. next to the airport. There are also BBQ's with seating areas for enjoying lunch or dinner outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Adventure”
Reviews.Author: KellyABB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marriott's Maui Ocean Club for the first time and stayed in the new Napili villas. It was a wonderful experience. Villa was spacious, close to the beach and the view was excellent! There were lots of activities for the kids to take advantage of (surfing, a game room, beach and the pool, etc). Nice places to eat on site and close by. Will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary botanical gardens throughout hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeanneDuluth
Reviews.Content: Extraordinary botanical gardens throughout hotel. Bautiful beach area. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Property”
Reviews.Author: IrishVirginia
Reviews.Content: I can only echo what the previous reviews have stated - this is one of the nicest properties that we have ever stayed in. We have been trying to stay here for years using points and it took the recession to get us in! Not only that, we were upgraded to a suite that was just beautiful. The location and atmosphere are superb and the staff and other guest were very friendly. I noticed many people had stocked up at Costco on their way in from the airport and that would have been a good way to save some $$. We didn't have a good experience at the on-site restaurant, Longboards. Highly recommend Hula Grill at Whaler's Village. We took advantage of the Hospitality room. What a great concept! I would recommend that this Marriott enforce lounge saving around the pools the way the one in Wailea does - 30 minutes unattended and you lose it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and weather”
Reviews.Author: Opengtune
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure to stay at the Ocan Club for seven days. We stayed in the new tower. We were in the locck-ff portion of a condo on the sixth floor. initially i had reservations about staying in the smaller room but since there were only two of us it was perfect especially given the view of the ocean and the sunsets we had every day. The beach at the resort is narrow but there are plenty of pools and private areas in the resort. if you want to snorkel consider walking down the beach to Balck Rock before you book an expensive trip out to Molokani. You can rent snorkel equipment at Boss Frogg at a fraction of the snorkel trip. For dining wak down the beach to Hula Grill and Lailana. We ate downstairs at both and upstairs once at Lailanas (for fish tacos). The menus downstairs are cheaper and the food is good. However, we had terrible meals at Longboards which is on the resort premises. I would suggest skipping that until they improve their service and menu. Off premises the best restaurant i have visited in years is Sansei in Kapalua. The food is wonderful but very crowded and difficult to get a reservation. Might want to consider calling the the first day you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: buckbunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for a week in August. The hotel was beautiful. The staff was very friendly and helpful. From where to eat to finding a local chiropractor (they had a GREAT recommendation) they were knowledgable and more than eager to help. The hospitality room was invaluable to us. We were flying back to the East coast and our flight didn't leave until late at night but since we had to check out had no place to get ready. The hospitality room had everything we needed. GREAT idea!!! The only thing that we didn't like was that the pool at times didn't seem clean. There was quite a bit of sand in the pool since the beach is right there. Unfortunately people were not courteous and use the showers that the Marriott provided to rinse off before getting in the pool. That is the only complaint that we had.... WONDERFUL property!!!

Reviews.Title: “Always Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldwind
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal for 3 nights in a suite for $214 a night- occupancy is way down as in all Maui hotels. Sure cheaper than owning a time share here - will never understand that concept. Room 2032 has a lovely view of the HVAC system and maintenance vehicles so if you are interested in a view - raise your eyes and see the mountains! Main pool is great. Walked over to Napili Tower - river pool there is very small and pool bar closed due to low occupancy. Got an early check in at Noon but only was given 11 AM as a late check out. Staff would not budge on that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on Kaapanali Beach”
Reviews.Author: laug
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a stay at the Maui Marriott in the new Napili Tower. Our ocean front villa was nicely appointed with a full kitchen, washer and dryer, refrigerator, microwave and stove and the most amazing view. These villas have only been opened since early 09 so they are in great condition. The Napili tower and the Lahaina tower both have their own pool with the Napili tower also having a bar next to the pool. Since there isn't drink service at these pools it was nice to at least have a bar close by to get those cool tropical drinks. You need a room key to access the elevator which adds a bit more security to the building. We have daily housekeeping since we booked with points. If you book through Marriott you should check to see how frequently housekeeping comes if that is a concern. My only complaint with these new villas is that the balcony is super small compared to the balconies at the older section of the resort. There was para-sailing and surfing on the beach and you could rent covered lounges there also. There was a lot of beach this August, more than in previous years but the beach size changes seasonally so you never know how big or small it will be. The main pool was super crowded and people were up before sunrise plopping down towels to reserve their chairs so it was nice that there are smaller pools next to the new towers that are not crowded. The main pool is the only one with drink and food service so you miss that at the smaller pools but the bar at the Napili tower does take food orders also. Marriott either needs to extend drink and food service too ALL pools, or enforce the 45 minute towel rule during the busy summer months. The new Napili tower ocean front rooms will be the perfect place to whale watch come whale season. Bring your binoculars! I've been coming to this resort since it was just a Marriott hotel with a small pool. It is nice to see how it has grown into a destination resort. If you have a family this is the place for you. The childrens pool is fantastic with a pirate ship and sand, and the main pool is huge with a water slide. If you stay in the Napili or Lahaini villas you'll have a full kitchen and can get up to a 3 bedroom villa that will easily sleep 10 people. They claim it will sleep 12 but that would be a squeeze! Both new towers also have barbecue stations complete with tables so you can come down barbecue and sit and enjoy your meal. What a great idea! Parking is a hassle the spaces are small and the main parking structure is next to the Lahania villas. There is a small parking structure next to the Napili villas but it filled up fast and valet take up a lot of spaces. But parking is a hassle at every resort so either valet or plan on walking a bit. Of course remember you are in Maui! The best food on Maui is at the Lahainia Grill (not to be confused with David Paul's Island Grill - old owner, new restaurant). You will not be disappointed. There is no view but the meal more than makes up for it. We stopped at Costco near the airport and bought food for breakfast and lunch so we could save some money since restaurant prices are pretty high in Maui and all of the islands. The grounds are beautiful and the new towers have their own pool, the Napili tower also has a bar near the pool. Since the main pool was always super crowded it was nice to grab a spot by the Napili pool that was way more peaceful than the main pool.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: basketballtraveler11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights after staying at the Marriott Vacation Club on Oauhu. This was the nicest resort I have ever stayed in. We had a 2 bedroom suite that slept 8 people comfortably and we had an ocean view as well with free laundry machines inside the suite. The grounds are gorgeous. There were plenty of chairs to lay on by the pool and plenty of room to lay your towels on the beach. The resort gives you each a towel card which is good for 2 towels at a time so there is no need to bring your own. We rented to padded chairs with umbrellas 2 days and they were wonderful, as well as reasonably priced at $40 for the entire day. The restaurant at the hotel didn't have much of a selection but it was pretty standard with the other hotel restaurants in the area. There is plenty to do right around this hotel as well. Our group took advantage of the jet ski's and surfing lessons on the beach. It is a short walk from Whalers Village which has tons of shopping and restaurants. The gym at this resort is very nice for a hotel gym. There is also a path that conncects all of the surrounding resorts which is a perfect walking/jogging path. This hotel was amazing and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Points Stay Marriott Ocean Villas - Oceanfront 1 Bdrm - Lahaina Tower”
Reviews.Author: HonuGirl
Reviews.Content: Aloha, stayed with Marriott points and booked in July before Marriott increased all the point requirements for timeshare stays. The unit is very nice however, we felt like we were staying in an apartment. The views of Lanai and the beach were really great. Small balcony with a table and four chairs. Good for sunset dinner and morning coffee. The grounds, pools and beach are very good. Bit of an under tow at that beach, however if you like to be near the beach under a palm tree, I would consider this resort perfect. Every afternoon there was great shade under the palm trees and a great breeze with opportunity to go to pool or beach to cool off. The trade winds outside the Lahaina building were really perfect. We walked either way and it was hot. Just perfect in the afternoon. No one asked us to take part in any timeshare presentation. Free Internet worked well and the Lahaina building has a good parking structure. I would recommend this timeshare resort for families if they were able to book a 2 bed room unit. Since there was only one bathroom in our 1 bed room unit. Since we were not time share owners we did not participate in the drink specials, food discounts and breakfast. I would ask about all the discounts if you are considering exchanging to stay here. Easy walk to Whalers village for shopping and dinner. Try the new Lahaina Farms grocery store for your gourmet dinners that can be grilled on the numerous BBQs.

Reviews.Title: “One of Marriots Best”
Reviews.Author: karamell
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at this hotel and it was wonderful. We were fortunate enough to stay in a one-bedroom villa in their newer tower. It was one of the best rooms that I have stayed in by far and I have stayed with Marriot quite often. When we went to check into the hotel, I asked if I could be upgraded to a oceanfront rm. The young lady helping me with my check-in gave me the upgrade just like that and I was so pleased. When we opened the door to our rm. in the Napili tower, we were blown away. The room looked out over the ocean and the pool for the Napili tower and it was beautiful. The room had a full kitchen, dining for 8, living room with sofa sleeper and a 2 person spa tub in the master bath. If your are looking to buy a lei at the airport, then save your money. Once you arrive for check-in at the hotel they will give you your leis. They give the same one that I almost bought at the airport for $10 and they even have a different one for the men. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The grounds of the hotel were absolutely beautiful and I am working on my return trip back already! The only negative thing that I have to say is that parking stinks. My advise is to pay the upgrade for valet!

Reviews.Title: “unexpected”
Reviews.Author: srbeachbum779
Reviews.Content: I purchased a time share week from the owner. I was not confident in my decision to do so since I had never stayed in time share accomadations before. We were all very happy. We were assigned rooms 1408 and 1409 (ocean front). The time share was a lock-out (2 bedrooms, a den with a kitchenette and 3 bathrooms). I brought an electric skillet since I knew there was no stove or oven, only a microwave. Actually, there were 2 micowaves and 2 mini-refrigerators which had larger that usual freezers for their size. All kitchen ware was provided (can openers, dishes, silverware, bowls, etc.). A couple of coffee packets, filters and sugar was provided. You can purchase more at the Beach Walk Market next to the pool or bring your own. We asked for condimates whenever we went to a fast food place so that we could have some for when we grilled . The grills were busy around 6:30-7:30 PM but the wait was not too long. We ate breakfast in the room , fast food during the day and dinner was either grilled or we went out. We had Mia Tias and onion rings at Longboards. My husband said the onion rings were the best he has ever had (I don't eat onion so I can not comment). We walked down to Whalers' Village and ate at Leilani's- upstairs (casual dining down and more upscale up). I had Ono which I never had before. Excellent. My son's friend had a teryaki steak which was the best he had ever eaten. We did not go to Costco when we arrived because it was to late. We did visit it on our way to the airport when we were going home. Just like other Costcos, the food at their restaurant is cheap. One man my husband talked to had eaten there 5 out of 7 days. Our hotel was too far to do that. Definitley go there for your groceries. Wat cheaper than the groceriy stores. We shopped at Safeway and Foodland (got grocery cards for both). Saeway had pinaepple on sale. Bought one and it was great. Went back and bought 2 more. Now all of the pineapple back home (Texas) tastes so blah!. We stopped at a roadside produce stand. One pineapple was $7.00! I don't think so! We paid around $3.00 at Safeway (they sell fruit and veggies by the pound). Snorkeled at Black Rock (at the end of Kanapali Beach) and saw 2 turtles. Went to Big Beach. It is a drive but when the South swells are up it is a blast. The waves are shore brake so it could be dangerous but there are lifeguards. They are really funny when they make announcements. The highlite was the surfing lessons. We took them from Goofy Foot. Very good instructors. You can pre-purchase a photo CD of the entire classes surfing skills ($20.00). The 2 boys got up every time. My husband and I, not so much. All I can tell you, several months before taking lessons, practice standing up. Begin on your knees , push with your arms and legs to a surfing stance. My arms were so tired from paddling out and my legs turned to spaghetti after trying to stand up several times. I still had a ball. One last tip; Hilo Hattie's in Lahaina has free parking for 2 hours with a purchase. They sell .99 calendars. You can park and walk to some of the stores. If you want to spend more time, there are several pay parking lots.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Get Better than this!”
Reviews.Author: ALERTDIVER
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 day stay at the Marriott. We had the best vacation ever. We have been here before and plenty other Marriotts, but this was heaven on earth. The rooms may not be 5 stars, but I can say they are well appointed with most everything you may need. Beds were comfortable and we chose to eat out most meals. We did stock up on snacks, fruit and drinks at Safeway. We spent very little time in the rooms. To do laundry was free, you just need to go to laundry room. Easy. We ate at Longboards (ala carte everything but excellent) Pool Grill and Market (also very good). At night we either ate at Kimo's in town, Leilani's, Hula Grill or at Whaler's Village. One night we did go to B.J's Pizza on Front street to have a more less expensive dinner. It was great. We heard Cool Cats was also good for less expensive food. The best part of this whole place is the grounds. We stayed out at the main pool most every day. Yes, we had to get up early but we are early risers. There is a 45 minute time limit on saving chairs, which I think is a great idea. We dislike when travelers place their items down and leave for half the day. We watched as pool security took towels and items off chairs in the morning and stacked them to the side. The pools are incredible. The beauty of this place has us wanting to come every year. Our sons played basketball in the pool with other travelers and they went on the slide every day. They are teen boys that did not complain ONE time. Miracle! We will absolutely be back next year and if you are contemplating whether to come and stay here, the answer is YES! You will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Victoria68
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from a week in Maui at the Marriott Ocean club. My husband, myself, 2 of my daughters ages 14 and 11 and my 15 year old nephew. We had a blast ! The resort is gorgeous. Rooms are wonderful, we stayed in the older tower with a view of the main pool and the ocean, our views of the sunsets were breathtaking! Rooms were clean and we had more than enough room for the five of us. Although, in the older tower there is not a full kitchen, we made do with keeping breakfast and lunch foods in the 2 smaller refridgerators in the room, we also made use of the microwave and toaster. Staff was extremely friendly and attentive to our needs from the moment we arrived to the minute we left. We split our time between the beach and the main pool, both were wonderful. Although, you do have to wake up at the crack of dawn to get lounge chairs by the pool, we did this twice.Kids swam and used boogie boards in the ocean at the beach right in front of the resort.Location of the resort is perfect, just a short walk to Whalers Village and Black Rock. We snorkeled at Black Rock one day and saw 3 turtles, it was very thrilling. We rented a car for the week as this was my nephews first time to Maui and we wanted to show him the sites! He loved it. And it is just a short drive from the resort to Lahaina where I like to do most of my shopping and where the family likes to dine! I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in maui”
Reviews.Author: royLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the first leg of our honeymoon. The hotel is massive. The pool is unforgetable because it is just so big and wonderful. Waterfalls and slides included. The hotel restaurants were expensive, we did not have breakfast included and had to pay for it, little did we know it would be so pricey. The location is fine. Maui is a quiet island and this is a lovely place to stay. Nearby there is a beach shopping mall you can walk to. The rooms were not that great, I thought it looked a little dated, but large enough with a good sized bathroom. The best thing I liked was the hotel itself, the pool area, the restuarants, the golf course, the club, the animals in the hotel, parriots etc. Compared to the other hotels that we walked past, we were happy with our hotel. Have I said the pool was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Best time of my life! AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: sertasheep
Reviews.Content: We had an oceanfront villa, with a kitchen and everything, and it was absolutely breathtaking. I know this is a review and should be made up of tons of words but when I think back I am just speechless about it! The patrons there were SO kind and accomodating...I have certain food allergies that they took care of without hesitation...the lobby, the grounds, the view, ALL FLAWLESS!!! I can't wait to go back! The pool area was beautiful, the room service was delicious...linens and sheets soft as can be, just a lovely experience. You wont be disappointed at this resort!!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “One word - Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: tri-ej
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long stay at Marriottâ€™s Maui Ocean Club during the 4th of July weekend (couple with 3 kids -14, 10 & 9). We traded our Ko Olina villa with a 2 bedroom oceanfront villa at the new Lahaina Tower. I must say this resort is absolutely gorgeous. The new Lahaina 2 bedroom villa has a full kitchen (stove/oven, microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher, blender, toaster and coffee maker), granite counters, ample utensils, plates, cups, bowls, etc, also has stacked washer/dryer. Has a dining area and a living room with a pull-out couch that transform to a queen bed. The living has a huge glass window that overlooks the beach. The master bedroom has king bed, large jet-tub and vanity, separate bathroom and shower. Also a sliding door that leads to a porch which also overlooks the beach and the resort grounds. The guest room (which can also be lock-out unit) has a king bed, a pull-out couch/queen bed, sitting area, sliding door with porch overlooking the beach, a mini-bar with microwave and mini-fridge, coffee maker, vanity, bath and shower/tub. The 2 bedrooms and the living room all have flat panel TV with dvd players. Just below the Lahaina tower is a pretty good sized pool with waterfalls and jacuzzi. This pool is always less crowded than the main pool. Though the main pool is a lot bigger with slides, a pirate ship (which kids really like) and a number of water falls. Thereâ€™s also another pool below the Napili tower which is also less crowded most of the time. Besides the Lahaina pool is a play structure for kids which is right next to the Lahaina parking structure adjacent to a tennis court. The resort grounds are really gorgeous and well maintained. There are barbecue grills all over the place, however, securing one of them can be challenging during late afternoon hour when everybody wants to have barbecue for dinner. Longsboards restaurant is just right next to the main pool and they serve descent foods. They played live bands and had arts and crafts exhibits by the main pool on the 4th July while we were there. Whalers Village is about 10 mins. walk along the Beachwalk from the resort. It has shops, more restaurants plus the Whalers Museum. Lahaina Cannery mall is about 5 minutes drive where thereâ€™s a grocery store that you can buy food to cook meals at your villa. If youâ€™re looking for more shops drive down a couple more minutes to Lahaina town and there you will find a lot. Back to the resort. Never had any problem with any of the resort staff, they were all friendly and willing to help anytime. One thing you should remember is that this is a time share resort, therefore, housekeeping is only done once a week. Canâ€™t say much about the rooms on the Main tower (as Iâ€™ve never seen the inside of the rooms) but the rooms at Napili tower are pretty much the same to what I described above. Another thing to note is that parking garage for Lahaina tower is just right next to the villas. I heard people complain that parking for the Main and Napili towers are quite a walk away from their villas. Other things to do: Drive up to Haleakala Crater - breathtaking view up there (half a day trip). Drive the road to Hana and be blown away by the scenery (whole day trip for us). Snorkel at Molokini Crater â€“ great experience. Honolua Bay is also a great snorkeling site just a few minutes from the resort. Google Honolua Bay for more info. When you get down from the hiking path, go to the right side of the rocky beach â€“ clear water, lots of fish (maybe turtle if youâ€™re lucky). Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: lettergirl40
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new towers. We had a 3 bedroom 3 bath. It was totally amazing. The rooms were spacious, clean and inviting. We were on the first floor right by the pool. Thought this might be an issue. However, it turned out to be wonderful. There were no noise issues and the ease of going from the pool to the room was great. The beach was nice. My husband and kids took surf lessons from the group at the hotel and really had a good experience. We ate at Longboards, after the reviews there was little hesitancy, but we found the food to be very good and the live entertainment was great. The front desk clerks were helpful with directions and suggestions. Another plus we found is the gas grills and tables. We cooked out twice while we were there and then we would relax in the hammocks. I would stay here again and again...We loved everything about the Marriott Ocean Club.

Reviews.Title: “Like it, love it, gotta have it.”
Reviews.Author: dukendeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 wonderful days from 5/29-6/5. It was my husband and two 18yrs. We stayed in the older unit so I was alittle upset we had no cooking facilities. The rooms and beds were amazing as always with Marriott. The walk along the beach is great in the morning and at night. Whalers village is so close as many other activites. We snorkeled with Teralani's the best in my book which is just a short walk down from the Marriott near Westin. Jet Skis and other water activietes parasailing are right in front on the beach to enjoy. Staff was accomodating. I agree with one writer about the 7:30 am phone calls especially when you have a 5 hour time change and your phone rings. i enjoyed the fact that we did not have to pay for laundry in the coin operated area as we thought we had that in our room. The main pool was closed so our room looked over it everyday the bad thing we never saw one person working on it the entire week we were there until the day we left they started moving chairs over. I felt the ppol could of opened alot sooner if people would have worked on getting things back into place. I have always loved going to Kaui this is my first time on Maui and I must admit I did enjoy it. It is alot more crowded and there is alot more activity at the resort so sometimes peace and quite may be hard to find. Especailly since the walk way is open to everyone. My biggest compliant is Longboards (rude service) we waited over 20 minutes for someone to wait on us and finally the waiter walks over after three employees noticed us waiting there and said that this section was closed. Needless to say i was not happy. My other complaint is locals going into the pools and hot tubs. The Westin or Hilton all have property wrist bands I think this is a big problem for Marriott and they should start this also. Overall I'd be back in a minute. Lahina is a great place to spend the nightlife and walking the quaint town. Great places to eat and many shops. I can honestly say we LOVED it here. Kaui is also fabulous is if you want a quieter atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: gzusreins00
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. Exceeded our expectations. Staff was very helpful and very friendly. Grounds were amazing. Rooms were very nice and comfortable. The a/c problem we reported was tended to immediately. The only drawback was the long walk from the parking garage but it most definitely didn't mess up the wonderful experience this place was. Very romantic and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful clean beach, nice property, great staff”
Reviews.Author: judescash
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 day stay at the Maui Ocean Club, it was a family trip, and we had a great time, it was a gift to us, so I can't comment on the value for the dollar, I don't honestly know how much our room was. It's in a great location for walking to Whalers Village for great eating and shopping, also the Pantry and Longboards on the property offer great food for a decent value you could virtually remain on the property and be entertained and have your needs met for days. It was a little difficult staying while the main pool was under construction, but surprisingly the other pools were not as crowded as you would think, it seems quite a few people prefer the beach, where if you have children, you can rent umbrellas for shade on the beach and make a day of it. There are quite a few daily activities going on every day on the property for guests which you can participate in, Bocce Ball tournaments, fishing with the staff off the shore, surf lessons, yoga in the A.M. near the pool. The only real complaint I have is the cleanliness of the kitchen and bathroom in the room we had which was a 1 bedroom suite with the kitchenette. It was dirty, the cupboards are NOT wiped down, the handles were grimy, dishes had been put away dirty by previous guests, the coffee maker was cracked. The bathroom was just marginally clean, light switches were disgustingly filthy, so was the blow dryer handle and the door handles. In fact, I got so grossed out I went to the local Safeway market and got a tub of Lysol wipes and went back and wiped everything down, it was that bad. The beds were clean and comfortable, the sofa and side chairs were on the newer side and seemed clean enough, the carpet seemed clean. The outside grounds are beautiful, the lobby and interior is maintained very nicely, the pool was always clean and sparkly, the wait staff poolside is very friendly and attentive, in fact all the staff are really nice and friendly. We ate in both restaurants on the grounds and the food was good and fresh. If you have small children book a lower floor room, it's a huge property, and getting from point A to point B can be exhausting, so minimize dragging kids, pool toys and towels by staying close to the pool in a lower floor if you can. A big plus is if you have a rental car, there is a 10 story parking structure on the property, and self parking here is free for as long as your stay, that's a great value. If you don't have a rental car, plenty is there on the property to keep you entertained as well as Whalers Village on the beach path walkway. Overall, unless your Howie Mandel and you have serious germ-a-phobia, and the dirty bathroom and kitchen won't bug you, then you will have a wonderful time at this hotel, it will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: coloradoamanda
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Ocean Club in a 1-bedroom unit in the Lanai tower (5th floor). Pros: *The fitness center is state-of-the-art, and has three separate rooms: machines, cardio equipment, and free weights. It's kept frigid in all 3 rooms, which I loved. *The staff was friendly, but left us alone for the most part (which we appreciated!) *Granite counter tops in the kitchens and bathrooms. *Kitchen was well supplied with dishes, soap, utensils, etc. (Microwave, but no stove/oven) *Rooms were fairly large *While there was some construction going on, the noise wasn't overbearing for us. *TVs were HD *Two patios with chairs/tables --- one off of the living room, one off of the bedroom. Both had lovely ocean views. Cons: *We did have to call to request a room cleaning mid-way through the week and more towels a couple of times. This was a very mild annoyance, but they quickly delivered them within 10 minutes. *The Welcome Center called our room FOUR days in a row at 7:30. Apparently, they finally realized we weren't coming to the welcome center after the fourth try. . .Again, a very mild annoyance. *Parking spaces were tiny. While we had to go to the top floor of the garage to find parking a few times, we always found a spot.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Return One Day”
Reviews.Author: LoveVacations
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club. We stayed in the older section (Phase I) with our children ages 6 & 8. At first I was hoping that we could get an upgrade to the newer units as the new units have a full kitchen, but was glad we were in the older section since we were right by super pool. Our one bedroom, two bath unit was very roomy. It was two large hotel rooms connected by a walk through. The huge doorwalls led to two separate balconies. The living room had a small kitchenette with small refrigerator, microwave, and dishwasher. There were dishes, glassware, and flatware. Along with the pullout sofa in the living room we also requested a rollaway. At night time with the sofa pulled out and the rollaway down, it was a tight squeeze, but still room to walk around. During the day the rollaway was easily put out of the way by putting it on it's side. The bedroom had a very comfortable king size bed, chair, and desk and there was still a lot of room. A rollaway could even be put in the bedroom with there still being a lot of room left. It was a very peaceful stay. Never heard any loud noises outside of the room to disturb or wake us. The grounds were beautiful and well kept. The pool was fantastic! Very large with waterfalls and slides. The only problem by the pool was that by 8am most of the pool chairs were reserved with towels. We did eat lunch on property one day, but the menus at the restaurants weren't very appealing to us, so we didn't eat on property more. The Beach Walk Market & Pantry had limited breakfast and lunch items. It was also a place to purchase miscellaneous items (milk, fruit, ice cream bars, etc). The beach was very nice, but not really swimmable. Within 6 feet from the shore there was a lot of coral. There were some people snorkling, but no one swimming. We loved the walk along the beach which made it easy to walk to Whaler's Village for shopping. Can't wait to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “The best resort in The world”
Reviews.Author: clarsenseattle102
Reviews.Content: Exellent Resort very Kid friendly but its a little far from the Kahului Airport to get home. the marriott has 2 restaurants, 4 towers,and a awesome waterslide. I come to the marriott every summer for 2 weeks looking forward to returning next year already have my reservations for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for Families with Kids”
Reviews.Author: i-like-vacations
Reviews.Content: Although rooms are rented out, this is predominantly a timeshare resort, meaning that it will almost always be at or near full capacity. It was noticeably much more crowded than the Sheraton or the Hyatt, which anchor the ends of the boardwalk in Kanaapali. I do think it's a perfect place for a select group -- families who want to be able to have some of the comforts and convenience of home while away on vacation. Is NOT the place for a romantic getaway, quiet and peaceful break, or for those who like full-service pampering when on vacation. There are 2 older towers in the middle of the resort (where we stayed), where 2 prior hotel rooms have been converted into a single unit, with a king bed, sleeper sofa, 2 full baths, and a kitchenette (sink, dishwasher, small fridge - no freezer, toaster, coffeemaker, and basic kitchen supplies). There is free wireless access. Laundry is also free on the lower level of one of the towers ($1 for Tide). We were happy with our accomodations, although it definitely was not as nice as the brand spanking new facilities in the 2 newer towers. The advantage of the older towers is that you're much closer to the central pools, where most kids and families hang out. Also is very convenient to the parking garage. Pools, pools, pools. This is the highlight of staying at the hotel. Is a great place for families with young kids. Expect it to be crowded. Easy access to beach also. Loved the location along the Kanapali boardwalk, as it was nice to go for walks everyday. Easy walking distance to Whaler's Vilg for shopping. (The nice thing about this place, is you have a kitchen to sometimes eat in or store snacks and drinks... a plus with little kids, or those who purchase alcohol.) The food place is just adjacent to the pool and the boardwalk... burger or sandwich costs about $10. Breakfast will prob cost about $10 pp also. Beer at the pool bar is $6-7, drinks were $8/9. (If you plan to drink coffee or soda on a daily basis, conside purchasing their Marriott Mug for $30 --it gives you unlimited refills for the duration of your stay.) Although our room didn't have a stove, there are gas grills scattered around the property, and I never had any trouble finding one to use. We grilled burgers, hot dogs, kebabs, etc... was kinda fun to grill in paradise, but I realize that this is not for all! There are 2 supermarkets close by (5-10 min drive) to the hotel: Safeway in the Lahaina Cannery, and Foodland (in a shopping ctr in Old Lahaina, right by McDonalds). I went to both, and thought that Foodland was a bit nicer. (Agree with others' advice to apply for the club card at whichever store you go to to get the store discounts.) Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay... but it's NOT the right place for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: josh1231
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights at the very end of March. This is a great hotel. We had a studio unit on the 11th floor that was ocean front. Rooms: We stayed in the new Lahaina Towers section. The studio was nice, and came with a few dishes, and a small refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. The balconies are nice sized and really allowed for some great whale watching while on the patio. The beds are really comfortable like all of the newer Marriott timeshare properties. Although we were in the studio, we knew the people in the 1 bedroom so we got to see their room as well. The kitchens were amazing, and had dishwasher, full sized refrigerator stove, and everything else you would expect to find in your own kitchen. The counter tops were granite and the rooms overall were very nice. Staff: Fantastic! Everyone was very nice, helpful, and friendly. We never had 1 instance where I thought the staff was less that great. Even when I took my keys with me from the valet and they had to call me in my room, they were very nice. Grounds: The grounds are very nice and there are many pools to explore. One thing I will note is that the pools in the original section are packed, whereas the pools by the Lahaina towers and Napili Villas are much less full. There are Gas Grills placed all over the property to use and we actually used them twice and they worked great. The property is quite large and there can be some walking. There is a parking garage right next to the Lahaina towers and another one right next to Napili Villas so I didn't experience the parking problems some have reported. I ended up in Valet for most of the nights because the stalls were too small to park my rental Corvette in comfortably. Overall: Fantastic! I would love to stay here again. We plan on coming back next year. I would highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Whale watching dream come true”
Reviews.Author: BBBulldog
Reviews.Content: The Maui Ocean Club is a behemoth 16 acre resort which by its sheer size has advantages and drawbacks but a superb location and excellent whale watching activity will make the resort a worthwhile location for most. Expect lots of noise and children, hey Marriott caters to families, and some of the worst self parking of any major resort. Rooms very so much but can accomodation just about anyone. Our 1 bedroom studio was just fine and had a wonderful ocean view so no complaints. Some other tips: WHALE WATCHING: We used Trilogy and they were great--saw dozens of humpbacks including calves. Wow. WEATHER: Right now, strangely unpredictable. One day stormy and windy next day jaw droppingly beautiful. Sunsets on Kaanapali can be magnificent. (see photos) POOLS: Elaborate and intricate rarely crowded with plenty of jacuzzis. Kids will love the Pirate pool. DINING: All the usual places Leilanis, Hula Grill, Kimo's on Front St. Hard Rock are terrific. BARGAIN: LuLu's at the Cannery Mall offers 50% dinner prices between 5:00 and 6:00 and their food is terrific with a nice upscale sports grill atomosphere. Guys will love the sports in HDTV. Also, a great value is Penne Pasta off of Front St. on Dickenson. Casual but very high quality for the price and they offer whole wheat pasta. SNORKELING: Depends on weather, of course but Black Rock near the resort is pretty good--get there early in the morning for less traffic. BEACH: Worth the drive to Kihei for the 3 beaches. SHOPPING: Lots of good choices at nearby Whaler's Village, Cannery Mall is indoors and Front St. has lots of galleries. FITNESS: For those interested the fitness/exercise room is great-much larger than many Marriott properties.

Reviews.Title: “Risky Business”
Reviews.Author: lalitadivine
Reviews.Content: In 2008 our family of 4 rented a 1 bedroom condo in the new Lahaina Villa at the Maui Marriott. The grounds are lovely as are the brand new condos. We were located poolside above the entrance. Seemed a little lacking in privacy at the time, but the balconies are tiny, so you don't spend a lot of time there. It was nice, however, to open the drapes in the morning to see the lovely trees, pool etc. Thinking we would upgrade this year, we went back to the same timeshare owner and rented a 2 bedroom. This was a prime springbreak week, so it cost us $5,000. We checked in yesterday, 3/22/09. The room is lovely, the extra bedroom just what we needed. Two small decks and large picture window on 2nd floor afford us a view of not only the Hyatt parking lot, but public entrance to beach, dumpsters, large bags of trash, maintenance carts and multiple rolls of carpeting......what a drag! And all of this for only $5k. This is Maui, so we will spend a lot of time walking the beach and enjoying the foliage. Even on vacation, you need to chill and get out of the sun after awhile. I would recommend getting to know an owner with an assigned unit or guarantee of location. We, however, will never take a chance on this resort again .

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: RobReno
Reviews.Content: The MMOC is a time share at Kaanapali Beach. This is a great location. You can walk along the beachwalk passing by several other hotels and resturants, and Whaler Village with many shops. We love an early morning walk. Great for whales watching, snorkeling (best at black rock), beginner surfing, or boarding one of many boats for a snorkel/whale watching cruise. Across the street are two 18 hole golf courses - Ka'anapali (North course is more scenic). We have a one bedroom, ocean view. Great views and spacious room for two people. Kitchen is small with microwave, half refrig., wish washer, coffee maker and standard kitchen utensils. Lanais are small. They added new flat screen TV in bedroom. With two people and two bathrooms and two closets the space is very comfortable. They have regular special promotions for their restaurant Longboards. It's outside with great views of sunsets. It's better than it was a few years ago. They just started wine tasting - which was a lot of fun. Big pool will be down for maintenance for two months April and May, but there are two other new pools, the ocean, and plenty of lounges to soak up the sun. We're looking forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Napili Towers - 2 bedroom suites - Nice, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: ObLaDiObLaDa
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week at the new 2-bedroom Napili Towers. The rooms were nice and comfortable, but I do not think that they justify the high prices here. We were drawn here because there were five of us (two adults and three teens) and we wanted the 2-bedroom suite. The kitchen was also very nice and allowed us to cook some meals here. The on site restaurant, Longboard's served average food that was priced far too high. (Avoid their lettuce wraps which are a heavily mint-flavored mess). They also added in a gratuity of 18% for our party of 5. Pretty presumptious, I thought. Of course, you are paying for both the wonderful view (right on the beach) and the evening entertainment. The concierge staff were average and not overly friendly, but the personnel at the check-in area were wonderful. They offered me much more good local information than the concierge did. They were also always very cheerful and happy to help in any way. The pools were both very nice. I did hear that they were going to be closing the kids pool in a month or so which will overwhelm the adult pool and make for a noisy time for the owners and guests in the Napili Tower during that time. The grounds are gorgeous as are the views of the beach and neighboring islands. We saw whales every morning while drinking coffee on the lanai. We took surf lessons from the guys in front of the hotel/beach. They did a great job. The location of this property is perfect. Right in the middle of the Ka'anapali Beach Strip. Just a short walk to Whalers Village, the Hyatt or Black Rock. Overall we had a nice stay here. Their prices should just be about 25% less.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: cdatraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at the MMOC. We are timeshare owners at this property of a 2 BR villa every-other-year and took the opportunity to use the entire space for my husband and our two children (ages 4 and 2), my parents, and my brother and sister-in-law as my parents were renewing their wedding vows. We had a great stay! We arrived on a Sunday around 1:30 pm. The Villa wasn't ready, but our luggage was stored and we were given towel cards and signing privileges to enjoy the pool area. We had drinks and lunch at the pool bar. Our room was ready between 3:30 and 4:00. The 6th floor oceanview unit had a FABULOUS view of the ocean and pool complex below. The units were undergoing cable upgrades and receiving flat screen tvs during our stay. The unit was clean and appeared fresh. The lack of a washer and dryer and rangetop in the unit is a bit of a disappointment, but they have converted the coin-op laundry system downstairs to free laundry. They have also added 4 new gas grills integrated into the main pool area which made grilling very convenient for dinner one evening. My husband booked 3 scuba dives through the beach activity center and enjoyed all of them, despite the windy conditions. My one complaint this trip would be the weather, but who can control that? It was unusually windy the entire week. We actually drove south to Kihei to the beach one afternoon to find calmer, sunnier conditions. The kids managed to enjoy the pirate ship complex despite the wind. We did not eat at Longboard's, although my parents and children enjoyed dinner there one night. Overall, we had a very enjoyable stay and are excited to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected and Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: wizone
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui but we have been to Kauai several times. We went specifically to see the whales and the resort provided the perfect opportunity to view the whales from sunrise to sunset. We took an excellent whale watching tour that I recommend on another review. The resort seemed very overcrowded with lounge chairs literally on top of each other with very little room to move, but that does not mean that there was not constant activity as guests either found an early parking spot or played musical lounge chairs as emptys became available. Also there is a consistent amount of traffic on the sidewalk that connects all of the resorts. My wife and I were also surprised at the number of children in and around the resort during this period, though there are plenty of amenties for families and this really is a family resort. The resort was clean and consistent with what you would expect from Marriott though our room was a one bedroom lockout in one of the older buildings that desperately needs to be remodeled and brought up to date. We had a good time but I am pretty sure that if we ever decide to visit Maui again we will not be booking our time at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club. It was just too crowded and in our experience overrated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week in new Napili Tower”
Reviews.Author: Lvtolvlife
Reviews.Content: We were one of the first people to stay in the new Napili Towers. We had a one bedroom "oceanfront" unit with full kitchen. We learned quickly that although the Napili Towers have only oceanfront and mountain view categories, there are rooms on the curve of the tower that face another tower and should be considered more "ocean view" not oceanfront. If you are sitting on your balcony facing forward you look directly into the other tower and fellow vacationers on their balconies. You have to turn to your right to see the ocean. We figure we got a lousy view since we were staying using points (although our reservation was for "oceanfront". We asked to move and they kept saying they had nothing else. Since the tower was almost empty we pushed and they finally moved us to a room on the 3rd floor that was truly oceanfront. The one bedroom units in these towers are wonderful. These units should not be confused with the main building which is converted hotel rooms. The Napili & Lahaina towers have full kitchens. And the living rooms are HUGE. We stayed one night down at the Westin Villas in a one bedroom and they were half the size of the Marriott's one bedroom. The kitchens are wonderful with granite countertops, stainless steel appliances including a full stove, microwave, refrigerator and dishwasher. We picked up a pizza at Costco one night and it was great to be able to cook it in the room. The villa is well stocked, with everything you could need for your stay. The only disappointment was the bowls. There were little tiny bowls, which were not a good size for cereal. We did haul all our stuff downstairs for a cookout one night. We had another guest mention they had tools for cooking outside at the grills, but my husband went to 3 different places and nobody knew where to find them. Our biggest problem was parking. It is a 10-15 minute walk from the parking garage to the Napili villas. My husband would drop us off at the front by our tower and it took him at least 15 minutes to find a spot and walk all the way back to the room. If you have a choice of staying in either the Lahaina or Napili Tower,.. especially if you have an oceanfront view, I would pick the Lahaina tower. The tower itself is closer to the ocean. The Napili Tower is set further back and has a large lawn and pool area in front. You get more noise coming up to your room from people in the pool and playing in the grassy area. You also see more of the surrounding hotels because you are set back farther from the ocean. Not to mention the VERY long walk to your room. The parking garage is attached to to the Lahaina tower which makes it more convenient. We went the first week in February and it seemed ok as far as crowds. I personally think this property would feel overcrowded during a busier season. I like the location of the Westin Villas down the road better, but the villas are much smaller, especially the living room areas and I would recommend the Marriott Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Maui No Ka Oi”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaMauiGirl
Reviews.Content: My family owns a timeshare here at the Maui Ocean Club and so we go every year to this little piece of "Paradise". I look forward to the trip all year long and starting about now when I am 5 weeks out from going is when I get really excited! I can't say enough great things about this resort and location. We have weeks in both the old towers and new Lahaina tower. The older towers Molokai and Lanai don't have the full kitchen that some would like but the new towers Napili and Lahaina sure do and they are fantastic! You can use all the pools no matter where you stay and the staff is always willing to help with anything that may arise. I would tell anyone that is thinking of going to Hawaii to for sure pick Maui Ocean Club for your resort! Oh there also a members party once a week that anyone staying there can attend and it has free drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) as well as free prizes!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Club is Nice”
Reviews.Author: cseanmc
Reviews.Content: I was actually pleasantly surprised at the Ocean Club. My father gave a free time share week to my wife and me to the Marriott. The staff was very nice from the minute we arrived. We were promptly greeted and escorted to the front desk. Check in was quick and easy. Our only issue during our whole trip was that our room keys did not work when we checked in. After a long flight this was not what we wanted to deal with. I went back to the lobby and they made new keys and a staff member escorted me upstairs which was a nice touch. The keys still did not work so he had to call maintenance. They arrived quickly and fixed the issue with the electronic lock. Yes it was an inconvenience but they were prompt and got is resolved. As I said this was the only issue all week. The condo is basically two hotel rooms converted into a timeshare. The front room has a tv, couch (pull out bed), kitchenette, desk and patio. The second room is a bedroom that also has a patio. Both rooms have their own bathrooms. For 2 adults this was plenty of room. You could probably have 2 kids as well and it would be fine, but 4 adults would be crowded. If you are used to staying in hotel rooms with flat screen TV's and modern furniture that looks like it is from Ikea, then yes the furniture is outdated. Honestly we spent so little time in the room it didn't matter. The bed is big and comfortable. The kitchen includes a small refrigerator (but it is bigger than your standard dorm room fridge). We went to the grocery store and bought breakfast food (cereal, milk) , sandwich stuff for lunch, beer and wine. We were able to put everything in the fridge that needed to go and had plenty of room. There is a coffee maker so get coffee. Also included is a toaster, a microwave and a dish washer. The kitchen was fine for the basic essentials. There are a number of very nice grills downstairs by the pool if you want to cook something (they looked very nice and clean and had grilling utensils attached to them). As far as the construction noise goes, we had none whatsoever. Our room was next to the new building they are about to open and we never heard any noise. I assume it is opening in the next few weeks although it may be opened already. There is very little beach in front of the hotel. In fact the hotel has no beach chairs on the sand. That was the most disappointing things about the resort. Several of the hotels down the walkway had much better beach fronts the Marriott. The Main pool area is nice. It is quite large so it never seemed too crowded. If you have kids there is a water playground area for them to use which seemed pretty cool. The grounds of the hotel were well kept. We did not eat at Longboards, but we did eat breakfast in the store by the pool one morning. The food was okay and service was prompt. We did use the pool bar on numerous occasions. The bartenders were always friendly and the service was great. They have flatscreen tv's in the bar facing each direction so you can catch sporting events (I love Hawaii-you can watch nighttime sporting events from the mainland in the late afternoon sitting by the beach as the sun sets). The Marriott would not have been my first choice in Maui, but I must say it was a very nice stay. I would recommend this play for families with kids as there were numerous activities for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Views!”
Reviews.Author: newjersey68
Reviews.Content: We were at this resort from December 2008 into January 2009. We and another couple went to warm Maui from the cold New Jersey winter. Overall, we had a great time and think highly of the hotel and service. If you are high maintaince, you may not like some aspests of the hotel. The hotel was clean, but a little outdates in decor. You have to pay extra if you want a mid-week maid service. It was also annoying to have to call for fresh towels every few days. There were a lot of kids in the pool and at times they did make a lot of noise while enjoying the pool. This did not bother us, as we knew what we were signing up for...a family resort, not couples only. Longborads was a great place to eat. The Hula Grill was very bad and costly! We were there on New Years Eve, were rushed in and out in 30 minutes! The food was sooo bad and made us feel "off" for the rest of the night. We walked along the path passing many of the other hotels and it looked as if we had the best location, with the best pool and view. My husband and I went to the spa. I had an okay massage, but my husband hated his. My husband said that he wated to relax, but the women talked to him most of the time...annoying! We spent more money on food than we expected because we did not have a over/stove. I believe the new section hadsthat, but not sure. There are 2 airports in Maui, which we wished we knew. One is open until 4 PM and the other much later if not 24 hours, which can determine what flight you take from home. There is a COSCO on the way from the big airport to the hotel, I recommend stopping there to pick up food, The supermarket is super expensive! If it were not for the 10 hour flight, I would return here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay but lacked kitchen amenities”
Reviews.Author: twinkiestar99
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week here over Christmas in their older 1 bedroom condo. There was four of us and it was nice to have two full bathrooms. The bedroom was nice and roomy and the bed was wonderfully plush and comfortable. Unfortunately, the pull out couch was very springy and sagged in the middle. The kitchenette was small and we were disappointed that there was no oven or bigger fridge. Considering that we were spending a whole week there, it just wasn't sufficient for our needs. The furniture was a little worn out but in good condition. The staff was friendly and accomodating. There wasn't much of a beach, however the pool made up for that and we did not have any problem finding lounge chairs. Overall, our stay was pleasant, but we would try to get one of the newer 2-bd units with full kitchen next time.

Reviews.Title: “Would return over and over”
Reviews.Author: atlbeme
Reviews.Content: As an avid reader of trip advisor reviews, I go into a place aware but open minded. We loved this resort. Usually we don't like larger resorts because they are crowded, it was not. It certainly helped that it was off season. There were a few kids and games in the main pool, we swam in the smaller pool by the new Lahaina tower and had no issues. Our room(s) were in the older part of the building, Lanai tower, top floor. We had a great view back to the mountains. This provided us with lovely sunrises and many rainbows to watch. It was great that each section (master bedroom, living room, and guest lock off) had its own balcony. The staff at the resort was always friendly and accomodating. The prices in the resort beachwalk market were outrageous, but we stocked up on necessities at the Safeway and Star Markets. One downside to the older rooms, there is no full size fridge or stove. We did have two microwaves and two half size fridges. It's true that there is very little sandy beach directly in front of the main section of the resort, that starts in front of the new (unfinished) Napili towers on north side of the property. Anyone who complains about this is just too lazy to walk a few extra feet to get to the wider part of the beach. We loved the chairs on the grass, its much cleaner and the grass is great to walk on! We holed up every day in the corner edge of the chairs furthest away from the center of the resort and felt like we are almost alone. Whalers Village for shopping and eating is a short 10 min walk down the beach walk and a little further you can snorkel around the Black Rock. The best thing of all, The sunsets. The resort faces west (as does this entire stretch of the Maui coast). The sunsets were Beautiful! This resort was worth the stay and worth going back to again.

Reviews.Title: “Sort of nice place with some problems”
Reviews.Author: DanT1953
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Marriott Ocean Club in Lahaina for 2 weeks, July 20-August 3. Staff was very polite, friendly, helpful. Facilities were clean, well maintained. However there were a few problems that interfered significantly with our vacation experience. First of all, all areas of all swimming pools were plagued with people-both kids and adults-throwing balls, playing catch, water volleyball, water basketball, etc. There was literally no place you could swim peacefully without having to worry about being hit in the head with a thrown ball. There should have been some designated swimming pool areas for "no ball playing", but there were not. Second of all, this problem extended to the extensive grassy areas in front of the hotel where most of the sun bathing lounges are set up. Again, ball playing of all sorts in all areas, no designated "no ball playing" zones, definitely a problem when some of the guests began behaving as though they were in a state park playing touch football through the lounge areas. On several occasions I had to engage in unpleasant interchanges with some of the ballplayers to insure my family was not going to be injured accidentally. Third, almost no beach. The surf comes all the way back to a steep vertical cliff-like formation several feet high-and ocean floor out from there is rocky and inhospitable. Almost impossible to swim in ocean at this resort, necessary to walk several hundred feet north, to get to a decent beach. Finally, no acceptable beach access; necessary instead to climb over a rope fence, and then climb down the cliff. This in contrast to the resort just south of this property, which has the same sort of beach problem but nevertheless has built easy access points to the ocean, stairs, ramps, etc. It's a stretch to say that the resort is on Kaanapali Beach at all, it's really on the point of land that separates Kaanapali from Lahaina, an inferior location for beach quality. It's a decent resort if you are not primarily interested in ocean access, and if you bring a helmet to deflect thrown balls. However if you have the typical romantic image of relaxing on a nice beach with your spouse or significant other, swimming in beautiful ocean waters, I would not recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: vacationsamany
Reviews.Content: Great location right on Kaanapali Beach. Easy access all within walking distance. With the kid pool, big priate ship, you don't have to many little kids in the main pool which is nice. Pool has a great waterfall features, bar area is also nice. The restaurant by the pool has a variety of quick food, pizza, and hamburgers and priced fairly. This is a hotel that is converted into a timeshare, the rooms in comparison to a regular time share are smaller but vs a regular hotel room very nice. The main restaurant upstairs is Suhsi and excellent, the downstairs restaurant is over priced and not as high of quality as expected. We love this hotel and go often can't seem to put a reason to it but always consider it when going to Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, Construction”
Reviews.Author: SFOF/A
Reviews.Content: I was aware of the construction going on at the Maui Marriott, thanks to tripadvisor, therefore, I requested a top floor away from the construction. On arrival we were given a lower floor facing the construction of the new tower and the digging around the new pool. The first room was very dark and looked directly at the new building. I couldn't believe it. I went to the front desk and spoke with a guest service lady, who was very sweet and filled with Aloha spirit. She did her best to find us a room closer to the ocean. She succeeded, and moved us 2 rooms closer, we still looked straight out at the construction site, but also had a view of the ocean. This was lovely for sunset watching, the only time we enjoyed the balcony. The construction noise starts at 7am, with hammering, it gets very loud at 8am with heavy trucks beep-beeping all day long, except for lunch break, noon to 1. You can still hear the trucks with the doors closed and the aircon going. The racket stops around 5pm. You are spared the noise on the weekend. We have been to Maui many times, we have seen all the sights, gone snorkeling, the road to Hana, Annabelle and Warrens, the volcano, the winery, etc. When we go on vacation, we like to sit on our balcony and enjoy the peace and quiet. We had none, except when the workers went home at 5. If you expect a quiet place to read, meditate, forget it. The large pool is very crowded and packed with children enjoying the slide, playing ball in the water, etc. There are lawn chairs on the grassy area in front of the new pool, this is the place to enjoy a book, as well as look out at the ocean. There are palm trees to help with the shade. We had to stay away from our room all day....just to relax! The Marriott staff members get 5 stars from me as well as the sunsets.... There are 2 places to get food at the Maui Marriott. One is a small grocery store, where you can order pizza, hot specials, sandwiches and salads. You can eat outside on tables, or take the food and go to your room. Longboards is the only sit down restaurant. It is open at 5 for cocktails and 5:30 for dinner. The food is delicious, fresh, tasty and well prepared. The Whaler's village is a short walk, you will find good restaurants there, our favorite is Hula Grill. The rooms in the converted hotel don't have a way to cook your meals, but there are barbeques all over the property and a microwave to heat food. There are 3 kinds of rooms here, new lovely villas with full kitchens, converted hotel rooms with no kitchens, no noise or dirt from construction and the third kind of room, where we stayed. I would stay away from this Marriott until it finishes the construction, expected to be completed early 2009. After that, I'm pretty sure this place would get a great review from me.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Heathelc
Reviews.Content: At the Marriott Maui Ocean Club we are always treated with the best service we have ever had at any hotel or resort that we have stayed at and that includes Westin, Hilton and three Fairmont properties as well! Provided you don't arrive in the late evening expect to be greeted with an orchid lei and a cool bottle of water. When we arrive the well trained valets leap to attention and rush over to assist us with our vehicle and our luggage. As a matter of fact they are so eager about it . One day my husband and I were going out to do a bit of sightseeing and he went to the parking garage to pick up the car while I waited at the front of the hotel. No sooner had he driven up when one of the young valets rushed over to the car ahead of me to open the door for me. I joked as we drove off that I thought he was going for a ride with my husband instead of me! They hold areception every Monday night for the timeshare guests on the triangle of lawn overlooking the ocean. Free drinks flow; there are appetizers, music and a raffle for free visors, spa robes, tickets to shows etc. The only time that I felt that the staff was perhaps run ragged was the year we went in August so both of our school/college aged children could accompany us. We were told by a staff member that the resort was at 99% capacity. The months that we found it less hectic were September and March. And in early March the whales are still there. Try the Trilogy Lanai Daylong Sunset Cruise during whale season. Words cannot describe it. And if you are lucky enough to have Captain Owen as your tour leader all the more memorable. Don't miss the Garden of Eden(fee) on the Road to Hana. Also the black sand beach at the State Park(name?). Ho'okepa Beach is a sight to see when the windsurfers are out in full force. And for a fun place to shop in Paia try Jaggers. The nice ladies who work in the shop are very willing to help. Also, I love beading and if you do too don't miss Aloha Bead Company in Paia. Oh and to eat: Hula Grill and Lelani's and Kimo's all owned by the same company. The macadamia crusted Mahi Mahi is outstanding at the Hula Grill and the fish tacos are wonderful both at Lelani's and Kimos. And don't forget to have a huge piece of Hula Pie either at Leilani's or Kimos. You can get Hula Pie flavored coffee beans at Sir Wilfreds in the Whalers Village. The dessert at the Tiki Terrace at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel is out of this world. Try the Caramel Macadamia Nut Eruption.....Macadamia Nut Ice Cream piled on top of a moist brownie with Caramel Syrup and whipped cream and chopped Macadamia Nuts. It won an award at the Taste of Lahaina. Also the weekend that falls in the middle of September is when they have the Taste of Lahaina and Island Music. Three times we have scheduled our holidays around that weekend. See the website from the Lahaina Town Action Committee for more info on when it will be this year. For cheap but good eats and a fabulous view check out Aloha Mixed Plate on Front Street behind the Lahaina Cannery Mall(right behind Safeway). Oh, and Pacific O at the opposite end of Front Street....you can see the owner James MacDonald buying fish right from the fishermen in the early afternoon. It is a wonderful restaurant...veranda style on the beach. Heading back towards the Airport; perhaps on the way to your plane(remember the food is either non-existent or not what it once was on the 5 hour plus flight back to the west coast) so you may want to stock up before you get to the airport. Marco's Grill and Bar is a very nice place for that last meal on Maui. And it's right on the way to the airport as well. Think anything from sandwiches to wonderful pasta dishes with a definite Italian flavor. On your day in Paia you can get very fresh and reasonable priced fish dishes at Paia Fish Market. Be prepared to share a long picnic style table with strangers. It's a very popular place. For dessert with a view stop at Mama's Fish House. It no doubt has the most wonderful view on all of Maui. We had dessert and freshly brewed Maui grown coffee in their lounge. Tried lunching there one time and came to the sad conclusion that both dinnerand lunch are pretty steeply priced for what you get and the waitresses seem to have been especially trained in how to act haughty towards their guests. Now I know people defend the steep prices by saying the fish has been caught that very day and all the ingredients are so fresh but really, everyone ,you can get freshly caught fish almost everywhere on Maui anytime you want to!
