Well, all this makes me want to be on Maui right now...sigh. Have to wait till April. Hope the fares go down some by then...it's a bit crazy now! PS I suppose if you are used to having a washer and dryer in your home resort then it might seem a bit inconvenient to take your laundry from your suite and down the elevator to the pool level to use the laundry room but we have always done one evening of laundry about half way thru our stay and combined it with a nice long soak in the hot tub gazing at the stars. You just have to rouse yourself one or two times to check on how the laundry is doing!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: hbkim
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time in our 2 bedroom unit with plenty of room to bring both grandmas and our 2 children (ages 9 & 7). The room was clean, updated and the gorgeous oceanfront view, who could ask for more?? Was there for the 4th of July last year and the resort was very busy, having to stake out your pool chair early in the morning or you were out of luck! However this year was great with much less people (although the desk said they were sold out?). Plenty of pool chairs available at all times of the day. Not sure if it is due to the soaring cost of airfare with less people traveling or just the fact I was there on a holiday weekend last year. In the 2nd bedroom there is only 1 bed and a pullout sofa bed which I know would be uncomfortable for grandma so we requested a roll away bed upon which they promptly delivered to our room minutes after checking in. They also have an egg crate to make it more comfortable but she said it was just fine with out it. We stayed in the tower furthest from the construction and rarely heard any noise at all. Had read other reviews that you could hear pounding all through the resort grounds but evidentally that part of the construction is over. It was hardly noticeable at all! All the staff was friendly except one lady who blamed a back flip off the bridge into the pool on my husband who didn't even do it!! He was sitting near the bar enjoying a smoothy with our daughter. It was clear she did not believe him, oh well. The location is great as well with many activities within walking distance-shopping & dining at Whalers, parasailing, snorkeling at Black Rock, surfing, or just playing in the ocean, can't go wrong with Marriott Ocean Club!

Reviews.Title: “Nice.....very nice”
Reviews.Author: 100tamember100
Reviews.Content: We are owners in the original three story building. We had a unit on the farside away from the construction. It overlooked the interior of the island, golf course and mountains. It was a beautiful resort. They have two pool areas. I highly recommend the pool closer to the Lahaina tower. It is nice there. If you have a chance, take a tour up to Mt. Haleakala. It is gorgeous up there as well. The staff at the Marriott were friendly and we did not have any trouble with the locals on the beach. We stayed from 7/20 to 7/27 of this year. The property is located in the Kaanapali Resort area and is well situated. I highly recommend staying here if you have a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the locals!”
Reviews.Author: tracyleestravels
Reviews.Content: The resort was great. Friendly service, clean and the beachside bar-b-ques were great. However, the beach right in front of the resort has these locals that hang out there everyday. They do not like visitors getting in the way of their bogie boarding. The group of locals, (teenagers) hit my 7 year old son in the head with their bogey board. And when confronted, they tried to start a fight with me. Then just a few minutes later, they hit another kid and when that kid asked what happened, the locals told him to get off "their" beach or there was going to be trouble. Turns out that two dads and a bunch of locals got into a fight. Fists flying and everything. Whenwhile about 20 families were spectating. I went up to the head of security for the Marriott and complained that they were protecting the locals more than the resort visitors. His reply was there is nothing they can do. It's a public beach and there are fights there all the time. I continued to tell this security guard that I had planned on buying a timeshare here, but would not now if my kids were not going to be safe on the beach. He replied, "good for you and better for us!" BEWARE!!!!! Obviously, visitors don't come first at the Marriott Ocean Club!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and great location!”
Reviews.Author: LT1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 3 wks. Hawaii vacation. We stayed in the new Lahaina tower at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club. We are owners. Our garden view actually had a view of the new pool and ocean. The room was in great shape and the beds, with the down comforters, were comfortable. However, I wish that the rooms were equipped with murphy beds for their additional beddings, instead of sofa beds. The full kitchen with washer/dryer was helpful with breakfast and lunch. It saved us money. The new tower has self parking adjacent to the bldg. so it was super convenient. The parking stalls are tight though. The swimming pool was fabulous and really not as crowded as other people make it out to be. There were plenty of lounges to go around, especially now that the new tower is open. Anyone can have front row seats to the ocean. The location is amazing because you can snorkle (right in front of the surf shop), and boogie board and swim to the right of the Napili tower (under construction)! You can use the walking/jogging path to get to one of the best free snorkeling around...Black Rock, and to have fun nightlife (Whaler's Village). My entire family loved the work out area. There were lots of machines to use and a small day spa where I got a massage. The spa also has a dry sauna and steam room! I visited a room in the original building. It was very clean with a gourmet center (mini kitchen with no stove/oven). My family would stay in one of those rooms if it meant being in the location of Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Marriott”
Reviews.Author: RandyandKaty
Reviews.Content: This was a decent deal for a 1 bedroom at a Kaanapali beachfront hotel ($2000 for 7 nites; no extra parking charge). The rooms are fair sized with a nice King bed in the bedroom and an awful sofabed in the living room. Most, if not all, units have a mini kitchen which includes a small fridge, microwave, sink, dishwasher, dishes and utensils, but no stove. There are numerous barbeques scattered throughout the property. Nice set of pools, friendly staff, choice location. But this is a big property so it can get crowded around the pools. There's a videogame room but it's barely adequate. No ping pong, pool, shuffleboard, horseshoes or tennis. Since this is primarily a timeshare property, much of the choice space is devoted to selling other timeshares. So the best part of the lobby is a big timeshare sales office. The same is true for the beachfront and pool level, which has a second sales office. Beware of rooms in the Lanai tower with a mountain view. You'll be located above the loading dock, so it can be noisy late at night and early in the morning, and all during the day. We love leaving the doors open in Hawaii to enjoy the tropical air, but it was way too loud. The Marriott doesn't have the ornate lobby or nice restaurants of a Hyatt or even the Westin, but overall a pretty nice place if you need a 1 bedroom to sleep 4.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings About this Property Compared to other Marriott VC Locals.”
Reviews.Author: JERSEYGROWN
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ocean Club, Family of 4 through Marriott Vacation club Exchange June 2008. Alot has been written about this location and will only comment on things not mentioned by others. First, this is a long trip from the East Coast, went Via Phila, to Phoenix, Maui via US Airways. To my surprise no problems with flights or connections. Leave 1-2 days early 7-10 days to give yourself time to adjust to time schedule if possible. Traded my three bed unit in the Carribean for a 2Bed/3bath unit, with limited kitchenette in the Lahaina Tower Mountain View, although the check in desk called it a "Garden View". Frankly, if you get a high up Mountain view I think it is as nice as an Ocean View/ because the Western Maui Mountains with the changing cloud patterns are truly beautiful, so don't despair.To clarify what these older units are like: which I had trouble figuring out from the trade. They are hotel rooms linked together i.e lock off type arrangements. Our three rooms were large and the 3 full baths werea plus. On the downside , I am used to a Full Kitchen/Laundry, etc at my home resort, so the limited kitchen was a minus for us. However, we did have two mini-refrigerators, one in the main "living room" and another small kitchen in the master Bedroom", so we definately used both. There is a slit space for the"freezer" but we made do. There are ample plates, cooking utensils, microwave, dishwasher, blender, toaster with some start up supplieswhen you arrive. Three TVs for the kids and DVD. The feel is more like a "Very Big Hotel". However, the two newer towers one completed, and one under construction are far better, and I would insist on this for a trade if I am to return. The unit looked like it had been newly redecorated. Check-in was so so, room not ready until 5:00PM, There is a distance to walk from the self park garrage to your tower which is bit of an inconvenience, but you can pay for valet parking $12.00/day. No greetings with Lais when we arrived on Sunday but looks like they only do this on Saturday arrivals, so my kids were a little dissapointed. The pool system of slides, caves, etc is really nice for the kids. The lounge chairs fill up quickly and it got a little crowded. The beach was a big dissapointment. The surf was strong and there was very little sand to stretch out on between the grass and the water. We are used to the much wider beaches in Jersey and frankly, the beaches, snorkeling, calmness, clarity of the water are far better in the carribean.But if you are a surfer, this is the place to be. They said the beach frontage varies depends on the time of the year. I used the outdoor gas grills to cook on, which alot of other familes who go there every year seemed to have down to a science I like the idea of the famiily that took their portable George Forman grill to cook on in their room. It was a bit of a pain to haul your food, utensils, and felt like college days?? etc up and down the elevators to your room, but you will meet friendly people at the grill who will share the space with you. For the size of the complex, they should at least have another laundry room or so in each tower. I felt a little strange walking through the lobby with my laundry basket, but again I am used to a washer and dryer in my prior Marriott Units, but everyone does this, so you will feel right at home. The plusses: There is so much to do and see for families, and with a car we went to little towns like Pai for dinner, "Milagros Food company"-Mexican/ Spanish cuisine was fabulous. So venture out from the Kanappali area. If you eat at the hotels or in the surrounding area it is expensive, but Lahaina Farms, and Safeway were a convenient short drive for breakfast and lunch groceries if you choose to eat out for dinner. We took Valley Isle Excursions to Hana- Definately first class, and Trilogy Day/Sunset Cruise to Lanai- take it for the sail boat ride, chance to Snorkel on Lania, but again the surf was a big issue if you are used to snorkeling in calm waters. Their dinner was quite good, and the sunset return was a highlight. I would definately return to Maui again in 3-5 years and would definately want an equivalent trade in one of the newer full Kitchen 2-3 bedroom units in the newer towers especially if you have kids with you, but the beauty of the island made up for some of the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, could use some sprucing”
Reviews.Author: loriv247
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Ocean club from 6/22-6/27. We were sent an preview invitation from Marriott because my sister is an owner there. We were given a 1 bedroom unit in the molakai tower , corner unit rm 5020 with a kitchenette (no stove or oven). The fridge was small but worked out. I brought my portable electric griddle because I knew there was no stove. This allowed me to cook eggs, bacon, pancakes and french toast for breakfast. Then grilled cheese, chicken, steak for lunch. I highly recommend bringing one if you plan to cook. They need more lighting in the kitchen area, its a little dark. We had a nice wraparound lanai because we had a corner unit. We had a view of the construction but also a partial ocean view so that was nice. The construction noise was minimal. We were never bothered by it.The BBQ's on the property are few and far between. We always had to stand in line for one. When we first arrived, the bellmen ignored us. We weren't used to that,as we've always had prompt service at any other hotel we've stayed at. We had a few other rude instances with the bellman at this resort, but a few good experiences as well. The front desk staff were always pleasant. The bar and poolside servers were understaffed. We practically had to tackle one to get some service. Also, the drinks were awful. Barely any alcohol and overpriced. Bring your own booze and make your own drinks in your room (they have blenders). Marriott also offers a refillable souvenier mug for $26 that gives you unlimited sodas and ice tea refills during your stay. We chose to forego since we bought 12 packs of soda and kept those in our room. The nearby Safeway has good deals as well as the Costco near the airport. As for the room itself, great size, comfy bed, small bathrooms (but you get two with showers so that's a plus). The exterior is dated. They need to replace the doors and paint the outside. They also need to replace the machines in the laundry room. They are really noisy and old looking. The pool was very nice and the kids and adults alike loved the waterslide. Be prepared to reserve your chairs before 6:00 a.m. if you want shade. Marriott discourages this, but I never saw them enforcing their own "45 min. rule". As for shopping, they had a few different stores to choose from, but Whaler's village is just a 1/4 mile walk down (take the pathway along the beach). Its so pleasant that you don't mind the distance. The timeshare presentation was very little pressure and it was actually enjoyable. We did not buy one yet but are strongly considering it now. The new 2 bedroom units are goregeous, albeit pricey! The beach was unswimmable because of all the rocks and the reef so close to the shore. Even if you are a snorkel enthusiast, its hard to get out there without scraping your knees or feet. Some of our best beach experiences were on the Wailea side of the island. As for parking, be prepared to walk a ways if you choose to self-park. The charge is $6 a day for non-owners. Valet is $15. Given our experience with the valet/bellmen, I'd recommend self-park. Overall, good experience with just a few complaints. Great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay..Maui is paradise”
Reviews.Author: rottiro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club using our timeshare. I lucked out and traded an efficiency for a 1br 2bath oceanfront unit in the Lanai tower. They listened when I requested not to be near construction. The room was very nice. It was clean and comfortable and big. The only downside was the Lanai's. There were 2 but they were dirty and didn't have a table so were not ideal to sit out at...but the view of the ocean and the sound of the ocean was fantastic. We were all the way in the back away from the elevators so had to walk the stairs but we were close to the self parking. The pool at this hotel is the NICEST pool area ever! I never swim but went in everyday and under the water falls. The entire pool experience was great and it was nice to walk to Whaler's village for lunch and to other hotels. Kaanapali beach is paradise! Some favorite things : The Hammock in the shade by the ocean at the Marriott....true relaxation....Banana Bread at Keneau Peninsula on the way to Hana...I always end here. The view is breathtaking..you need to drive all the way down to the very small town. It's worth the trip to go half way up and not all of the way to Hana....Mama's Fishhouse was pricey but really delicious for lunch...... Kimo's lunch salad..it was a teriyaki chicken over salad with an amazing papaya dressing. Yum.....Plantation House had an amazing view..food was pretty good although I didn't love my fish. Sansai the early bird (25 percent off)or the after 10pm 50 percent off and Karaoke is fun....The crab and mango roll and butter fish were amazing. The Gazebo is really good for breakfast and the line moves fast. Best pancakes!! Longboards...the Buffet prime rib dinner was surprisingly good but in general there are better restaurants. Everytime I go back to Hawaii I come back here (it's my third time) instead of trying another island......I might try Kaui or the big Island next time but would miss the Marriott and Maui :)

Reviews.Title: “I got the deal of a lifetime...I have absolutely NO complaints.”
Reviews.Author: Just4Jme
Reviews.Content: We went and stayed here on an invitation I had received 2 years ago...I felt so happy they honored it and once I saw the room I was even happier! We had a 1bd/2bth room with OCEAN VIEW on the 4th floor in one of the older towers. Room was clean a little outdated but comfy all the same. We were not required to attend the timeshare introduction but choose too so we could get the 100.00 resort credit. After the 50.00 I had already gotten upon arrival it paid over HALF of our room tab....and believe me we charged almost EVERYTHING to the room. We ate at the little cafe place on site pretty much every single day. The resort has an option of purchasing a coffee mug w/ lid for 24.95 (26.95 by the time we left) which gives you unlimited drinks for the duration of your stay. The resort itself was wonderful. I have no complaints they even had a complimentary room available for people who had later flights and wanted to still lay out by the pool. Big room w/ common area and private bathrooms w/ showers....but because of my inablity to tell time we missed our flight and had to stay another night. Marriott gave no discount on any of there rooms for an additional night so we drove over to the south side, Kihei. WE LOVE THAT AREA!!!!!!!! The location of the Marriott was very very tour est tee versus more of a authentic feel that we got while staying the night on the other side of the island. Another story for another time I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Vacation Club, Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia51
Reviews.Content: I knew of the construction going on long before we got there but unfortunately the only room they could give us was on the construction side in the Molokai Wing Suites towards the water end of the building. It was a very nice suite, a front room, one bedroom, two balconies," two" bathrooms and a full kitchen (everything you'd want except the stove). With the glass sliding door's shut you could hardly here the construction going on and even if you had them open it wasn't very loud. We also had a partial ocean view. Anyway we weren't in the room that much, there's so many fun things to do. The pools are very kid friendly and nice for adults also. There's a bar, two hot tubs and a couple of very nice BBQ's. There are 4 or 5 BBQ's on the side of the building we were in. I read some reviews before we went and some said the beach wasn't that great in front of the Marriott but I found it to be just fine. The location is the best with the hole Ka'anapali beach and all the activities you could want and the town of Lahaina only five minutes away by car. There's a Hawaiian guy just to the right under the umbrella that will teach you how to surf ( for a fee) and there's plenty of places to eat and shop, and if you go down all the way to the Black Rock and snorkle you might see the 4 huge turtles that were there. Also the Luau at the Royal Lahaina Resort was great ! although the food was plenty I didn't think it tasted that good. We had a great time and I can't wait to go back,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: mentorohio
Reviews.Content: We stayed May 9-14 in the Lahaina Tower. We booked a 4 night rewards stay, and added another pre-night all oceanfront. I was under the impression we would be in the same room for the 5 nights, but on arrival, they told us we would have to move the next day. The desk agent looked for quite a while to try and accommodate us, but was unable to do so. There was no reason to get all upset-they can't create rooms. We were givin room 7208 for one night. It was gorgeous, with a perfect oceanview. Room: looked brand new, with full kitchen with stainless steel and granite counters. Dining table for 6, bedroom with king bed. Full sofabed in living room and we were ablt to gell a rollaway. The Bathroom has a shower, sink, toilet, and the bedroom has a separate sink and jetted tub. Changed to 4210 for the next 4 nights. It looked a bit more worn, and did not have floor to ceiling windows, but still had a nice view. Our things were stored and delivered to the room when it was ready--we did not have to wait around. Parking: Spaces were tight, but I never had a problem parking my minivan. The Lahaina tower is right next to the parking garage, and the Adult pool is just outside the entrance. Food: Beachwalker just OK. Bring your own, or go to Whaler's Village(a 10 minute walk). They had 6 grills ouside our building, and they were always busy, but the people I talked to never had a problem getting a grill. Safeway is 2 miles away. Round Table Pizza is very close by and had good pizza. Location: Convenient to Lahaina and Whaler's Village. Driving to Hana was long. We left at 8:15AM and got home at 7. We didn't do any hikes as we had our 80 year old parents, but did stop for pictures and walked along the Black Sand Beach. Had lunch in Hana at the little stand on the bay. I think it took 3 1/2 hours to get back, but I could be delirious. Time share: We had absolutely no pressure. We picked up a packat with discounts on arrival, and in it was info on the time share, but that was it. No other mention. We'd recommend it. It worked very well for our parents and the 2 of us. Go an enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved MauiI!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachLovers07
Reviews.Content: Whether you are reading good or bad reviews, my husband and I travel A LOT and this was a nice place to vacation! Of all the places we've traveled, Maui is really the only place I'd want to come back to. #1 the weather is PERFECT. You are never hot or cold, which makes for a great vacation and there are just no bugs at the resort. We find that wherever we go (Caribbean, Mexico, Florida) you are ALWAYS sweating because of the horrible heat or humidity. We could actually shower here and feel clean all day long. Nice!! #2 the scenery was amazing. From the beautiful ocean water to the humpback whales jumping while you watch from your deck to the gorgeous sunsets...AHH! #3 the GREAT food. What I loved about this resort is you are within walking distance of some fun shops and wonderful restaurants right along the beach. Be prepared to spend a lot on food though if you go out. If you are like us and like a drink with lobster, you will easily spend over $100 at night #4 the awesome snorkeling at Molokini Crater and Turtle Town. The staff at the Lahaina Princess Boat was great. I would recommend going with them on your whale watch or snorkeling tour. They take you out early in the morning, serve you muffins, coffee, etc. and you snorkel for a while and then they serve you lunch on the grill. Just a lot of fun and you will see whales on the way. Avoid the half hour drive to the bay for those tours. They are all the same and this boat holds less people which gives you more of a private snorkel tour. #5 the town of Lahaina was so convenient and really cool. It was minutes from the resort and had tons of shopping and restaurants. Starbucks is everywhere too, including at the resort, which made it nice for a morning latte on the deck. #6 the staff was friendly, the resort was clean, the pool and grounds were super nice and I loved the privacy of where the resort was located. I love that the concierge will help you with anything. The timeshare representatives were quick and to the point too with no pressure to buy...very nice. #7: I would recommend the trip up to Mt. Haleakala...talk about being on top of the world. It is an amazing drive that puts you above the clouds once you reach the top. I loved it!! Pack a sweatshirt or coat...very cold up there. 49 degrees when we went Negatives: The road to Hana was VERY beautiful but took FOREVER to do from the west side. I felt very unsafe once we reached the narrow part of the road. The locals drove like 50mph on this road which is insane. The curves and one lane bridges certainly is a bit fearful especially when you know people are going that fast. Once we got there, I just wasn't really impressed with what I saw. There wasn't really a huge amount of things to do and we just basically said "This is it?" and turned around and went home. Again though, an AMAZING scenic drive. Just be prepared to be tired from it. I would recommend staying in Hana and making a two day trip out of it. I was also disappointed with the beach. It is a law that you can't have lounge chairs out on the beach and the water is full of coral so you can't use it. That was a major letdown so consequently, we never laid out the entire week. I was also disappointed with the rooms somewhat. They were super clean and nice but they were staged rather boring and the decks featured two chairs and a mini table. The chairs were so short you couldn't see past or above the deck bar which blocked your view of everything and the table was so small that you couldn't really eat out there comfortably. As loaded as Marriott is, I'd just invest in some type of an actual table that you can sit at. I was also unimpressed with the restaurants on-site. They featured a small menu and high prices. I LOVED the Beachwalk though. Very handy for coffee, breakfast, a pizza, or any type of snack or drink you can think of. (You can purchase a mug onsite and fill up on all you can drink coffee or pop...I would recommend this!!) Other than that, GREAT place to vacation. I would HIGHLY recommend the Marriott to someone and plan to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Families11
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Maui Ocean Club and had a great time. We were a family a 13 and this hotel is a great place for families. The pool is great for all ages, and the beach is also wonderful. We have never been to Maui and we loved it. The hotel is in a great area with a lot of dining options near by. The staff were great they remembered who we were and were always helpful. We had four rooms and one of the four had a view of the new tower they are building and we hardley new it was going on other than it was right out the window. This hotel is great and I would recomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: njwill37167
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the construction going on, the hotel is certainly a 4 star. When that is completed it might just move right on up to a 5! After I was there 1 day, I came down with pneumonia! Just great! However, I was able to enjoy the hotel for the most part. Our room, 7014, was wonderful. It was on the construction side, however, we also had a wonderful ocean view. It was clean and very nice. Enjoyed the mini kitchen very much. The grounds were so beautiful and kept very nice. The pool was awesome. The staff was so very friendly and helpful. Only one person was rude - the pool towel guy. Make sure you have a towel card! Besides the construction, I don't have any CONS for this property, only PROS. As a travel agent, I look properties over as thoroughly as possible. I was quite impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: midnite688
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here with another family of 4 in a 3 room condo. This is there timeshare and we were staying with them. We were not on the side of the construction so we never had issues. However we were not in the new tower so we did not have a full kitchen. A full kitchen and washer/dryers in the rooms would be the only things I missed. They do have laundry facilities on site. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, and we have a temperpedic at home. The pool is unbelievable. Our 8 year old daughter didnâ€™t want to leave it. The slide was open from 9 am until 5 pm everyday. There is an over the pool cave that is perfect for endless games of Marco-Polo. Our 15 year old son was able to boogie board right by the hotel on the beach. We enjoyed the beach walk that runs all along Ka'anapali beach. We were asked once about a time share talk and declined since we have a timeshare of our own. We were never approached again. We would love to return to this resort again!!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: frozentravler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property from April 13-18. The first thing that stood out was the friendly staff, especially those by the pool. One in particular remembered our names from the first day we were there and interacted with our ohana when he saw us. We felt the property was one of the best we have stayed at, especially the pool area. We have been going to the islands for 15 years. We did not eat in the restaurant's on premise, as we ate in Lahaina. What we did see of the menu's did seem high to us. I will definitely book this resort for our next stay on Maui. It also has wonderful views of the ocean to sit and watch for whales. On one day the whales put on show for about half an hour. Had we not had this place to sit and enjoy the pool and ocean we may have missed this chance to see the whales at play. It was like you could reach out and touch them.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for families”
Reviews.Author: SoccermomMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Booked this resort thru Redweek (and offered less than what owner asked). We have three kids (ages 4-12) and went with the in-laws, also. We stayed in a 2 bedroom/3 bath unit in the main building and had an 'island view'. If possible, book the newer Lahaina building, which has full kitchens and built-in laundry in each unit. The original building used to be a Marriott hotel, and they knocked out walls here and there to condo it. The original building units have a small, utility kitchen (no stove) and no laundry. However, there is a laundry room on site, so not really an inconvenience. Beautiful grounds, fantastic pool for all ages. My kids lived in the pool or on the beach the whole week. Buy the insulated cup in the Beach restaurant for 'free' refills all week. There is a kids program, which worked pretty well for the youngest, but didn't interest our older two. Lots of traffic in Lahaina, and this property is about 30 minutes from the airport. There is a Walmart close to the airport, so we bought cases of bottled water and breakfast cereal there. There is a Safeway in Lahaina for milk (even organic!) and snacks. We grilled twice at the Ocean Club--several grills surround the pools and we never had to wait to use one. Eat at the Lahaina Grill, drive to Twin Falls to walk and swim in a waterfall (and BUY THEIR BANANA BREAD), take a morning whale-sighting tour. Great sidewalk along the beach--you can walk every morning while the kids run in the sand. The only downside we saw to this property was the beach--sand area was great, but water area was very rocky. We didn't trust our kids taking surfing lessons--we were afraid they would whack their head on a rock when they fell. Bring your water shoes!

Reviews.Title: “C+ Resort, Needs work”
Reviews.Author: foodnfinance
Reviews.Content: I wanted to combine the high end hotel experience with the convenience of a condo, so I booked the marriott vacation club maui, the Lahaina tower. The room was newer and nice, however the internet was weak and almost unusable. The BBQ, instead of being out on the lawn near the beach, is in back next to the parking garage ( unappetizing ). There isn't a real bar lounge, and only one small bad restaurant. The common facilities are run down. It seemed like what used to be hotel facilities have been overtaken by the swarm of pushy timeshare salesmen. If this was a hotel it would be out of business. It's too bad because the property has potential if marriott spent as much effort improving it as it does trying to sell it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Property in transition”
Reviews.Author: MarinaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Maui is a great island. As a Hotel Manager who travels frequently, I write reviews and try and capture relevant information so that consumers can make informed choices. Lahaina is 40 minutes from the airport and as driving in Hawaii goes...not a difficult drive..compared to the north shore drive we took yesterday that is a harrowing experience only for the most seasoned of mountain cliff edge drivers...! The Maui Ocean Club is a timeshare resort...The Lanai and Molokai towers are in need of renovation as they are getting dated...Lahaina Tower is new and much more in keeping with modern day trends and with full kitchens....unlike our unit which had a small fridge, microiwave and coffee maker...we also had a garden view..but that was more like parking lot view...lots of people setting their car alarms off..! Had I of known at the time of booking that we were getting this view I would have waited...but I was new to this as this was my first time share trade...next time I will be more careful...beds are comfortable..towels are okay..standard marriott linens etc...room was not so clean..probably due to back to back occupancy... Service is minimal with a focus on timeshare sales..limited food and beverage..but the best food comes next door from the hyatt...if you like sushi..they have great sushi and at the sonz in the hyatt the beef tenderloin or the spaghetti and filet mignon meatballs was a culinary experience to die for...now being in the industry, I can tell you that this dish is unlike anything, and I mean anything that I have had...I cant get it off my mind...and as soon as I get home I am going to pull out my meat grinder and try and make it...WOW!!!! Self parking lot is hard to find and difficult to navigate..small spots... Guest services set up a great diving day trip with Lahaina divers....excellent...and going to the timeshare sales presentation gave us $100.00 to apply against the $153.00 per person cost. Common areas throughout the older complex need attention...and staff are non discript with no service edge... We got a newspaper for two days of our stay and then nothing... There is a safeway to shop at..and many food choices..and there are bbq's on site you can use...!!! as nice touch..pools are great..many choices and areas for kids..so if you dont have kids you can relax...a great laundry facility with ample washers and dryers and you can trade out your novels for others free... Overall a plesant trip....nothing fancy..and this is not a highend hotel...so dont expect the ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Second Rate”
Reviews.Author: doublecreme
Reviews.Content: Didn't live up to the reviews on this site or their advertising pitches. Our room was dark and stuffy. There's no lobby with comfortable chairs, no place to get away from the room. It didn't feel Hawaiian, felt more like a Comfort Inn in Bakersfield. And instead of nice grounds they're building more and more and more so if you don't get oceanview, you'll feel cheated.

Reviews.Title: “Typical higher end resort”
Reviews.Author: capndrake
Reviews.Content: This is a typical resort hotel in the Lahaina/Ka'anapali area of West Maui. It has a lovely beach, okay but pricy restaurants, water slide in a wonderful pool, good fitness center with a sauna and steam room, but is just typical of the several resort hotels in the area. The lower end room that we stayed in had a separate master bedroom with bath and a living room with a pull out couch that was comfortable enough and had its own bath. It also had a microwave, sink, small fridge, and dishwasher that Marriott calls its Gourmet Center, but was really only useful for making breakfast or maybe appetizers before dinner. Security was terrible. Our friends checked in earlier and we just gave a room number to the porter and he opened the door and dropped us and our bags in the room, just like in the old James Bond movies where the maid lets Bond into the room. Good thing we were honest (and had the right room number.)

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Maui Ocean Club Overrated and Overcrowded”
Reviews.Author: WellWornPassport
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club for two weeks over the '07-'08 holidays, and found it suitable for our purposes. [We traded our two weeks at the Marriot Kauai Beach Club for the Maui property.] The convenient location made it possible to explore nearby towns and restaurants by public transportation, the Maui Bus. However, there are very few non-resort restaurants to choose from in Kaanapali itself. The beach in front of the resort has eroded away, preventing beachgoers from parking directly on the beach, but one is able to walk down the path to the area of the beach with more sand (and more people!). The pool area is overcrowded, with most pool-loungers staking their lounge chairs by 8am; and the hotel consistently ran out of towels by 9am. The resort shops are lacking in quality, especially compared to their next-door neighbor, the Hyatt. The spa is decent, although it pales in comparison to the luxurious spa at the Grand Wailea. Our room was spacious, and the comfortable bed was dressed in great sheet; but the towels are in need of updating. While the kitchen facilities, namely the mini-fridge, were convenient, there isn't a stove for any real cooking; however, there are wonderful grills available all over the property; and they're cleaned daily. The property is great for families, but not for those who have difficulty putting up with the throngs of screaming children. All in all, the Marriott is nice, but a tad overrated and overcrowded.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: sceneisle
Reviews.Content: We are multiple-week owners at the Maui Ocean Club; just returned from our yearly stay. The M.O.C. is a time-share resort, located near the south end of Kaanapali Beach and a short drive from the historic town of Lahaina. The resort has all the services/amenities expected of a luxury resort: 24-hour front desk, concierge, valet parking(optional), fitness center, gift & other shops, children's playground, restaurant, pool-side market and bar. We own/stay in a 1-BR/2-BA oceanview villa. These units can accommodate a family of four or two couples, with relative privacy. The 1-BR villas have a limited kitchen (the 2-BR units have full kitchens); furnished with microwave oven, small refrigerator, dishwasher, basic small appliances (toaster, blender, coffee-maker, etc.) and kitchen ware. The bedroom is spacious; with a sitting area, private bathroom and lanai. All villas have been recently remodeled. The main swimming pool, IMO, is one of the best on the island; multi-tiered with waterfalls and a large water slide. There are several Jacuzzis and a children's section, complete with sandy beach and a pirate ship to play on. The resort supposedly has a "no lounge chair-saving policy (towels to be removed from un-occupied lounges after 30 minutes)" but it did not appear this was being enforced (lounge chairs around the pool are at a premium). A recently built, smaller and less crowded swimming pool is located between the Lanai Tower and the recently opened Lahaina Villas building. Since our visit last year, the two on-site restaurants (Nalu Sushi and Va Bene) have been closed and replaced by Longboards. We did not eat at Longboards but heard it was receiving good reviews. The pool-side Marketplace serves breakfast, lunch and dinner, along with snack and dessert items. For a nominal fee, the resort sells a coffee/drink mug which includes unlimited refills of soda and Starbuck's coffee for the duration of your stay. Construction continues at the resort. The Lahaina Villas building, located next to the Lanai Tower, is now open. We did not tour the new two and three bedroom villas in the Lahaina Tower but the photos we saw were very impressive. Construction of the Napili Villas, located next to the Molokai Tower, is due to be completed early in 2009. We stayed in the Molokai tower and construction noise was not an issue; however our room was on the opposite side of where the construction was taking place (if you stay in the Molokai Tower before construction is complete, I'd recommend requesting a room with balcony overlooking the swimming pool). The beach in front of the Maui Ocean Club is not the best for swimming, due to sharp rocks in shallow water. Decent swimming conditions can be found a short walk to the west, in front of the neighboring Kaanapali Alii. Good snorkeling can be found at Black Rock, at the west end of Kaanapali Beach (15 to 20 minute walk). Whaler's Village is about a 10 minute walk from the resort. The Maui Ocean Club is well-maintained and the service is typical Marriott (very good). As a guest at this resort, you will be invited to tour the new villas but there is no pressure to do so. Should you take the tour, the sales presentations are also no pressure. We have been coming to this resort since we purchased in 2002 and have enjoyed our stays each and every year. If you have any questions about the resort, feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Wished We Had Chosen Another!”
Reviews.Content: Our lifetime dream to Maui was disappointing. Poor maintenance during the recent storm in December 2007 and poor resort design are the reasons. The outside of the property is lovely but the poor attitude of the staff during the storm was detrimental. Our room had pre-existing water damage stains on the ceiling and when the rains hit, the room flooded terribly. Our baggage, computer, and shopping items were sitting in water that was so deep it covered our shoes. The flooding ranged from the lanai door all the way across the room to the entrance door. The management failed to communicate effectively. Return calls were not received and they denied poor maintenance. We had to constantly present ourselves at the front desk to get the problem addressed. They ignored our observations of the pre-existing water damage and seemed to not listen. There was no way we could stay in this room. If you climbed on the bed, it was like a ship in water! It was not healthy. They finally found us a slightly smaller room. They had little in the way of resort activities during this whole week due to the storm. The welcome cocktail reception was cancelled and not re-scheduled. The outside aquatic classes were not available (extra charges for these). There is no spa on premises. The 2 restaurants are open to air and wind and blowing rain. It was chilly and not comfortable to eat this way. Open air lobby left us walking in water constantly. Our original room had an incredible view but this room flooded and we had to leave. The new room was slightly smaller and not really an upgrade to us. There rooms are really nothing too special. There have just got to be better places in Maui to stay and we certainly wish we had chosen another. We did follow up with Marriott and got the distinct impression that customer service and satisfaction were not of the utmost importance due to the excuses we received. Either they did not believe us or just didn't care. After paying thousands of dollars to get there including timeshare ownership, exchange fees,yearly maintenance fees, airfare, etc. this Marriott Maui resort was a disappointment. One might as well have stayed in a nice inexpensive unit somewhere else and received a warmer experience.

Reviews.Title: “The new Lahaina Tower is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoW_traveler
Reviews.Content: While the original property is a little "tired", the new Lahaina Tower is really first-rate. We stayed in both a 3BR Oceanfront and a 2BR Oceanview. Both categories have are very spacious and have excellent views. And, as many have mentioned, the location is really the best on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tim2458
Reviews.Content: Perhaps if you are trading one Marriott Vacation Club for another, you get a better room. On a recent stay, a friend and I were provided with what must be their smallest room in the complex. While it was in a nice location -- the newly-built Lahaina Tower -- the room was big enough for a bed and not much more. There was a nice view from the lanai, looking out over the pool and to the ocean beyond. From what we saw and heard from other guests, our room was half the size with fewer amenities, yet, we paid about $400 a night. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was a good size, with the same toiletries you get any any Marriott around the world. One positive at this Marriott -- there was no extra charge for Internet access in the room. Why most other Marriotts charge for this service I will never understand. OK, I do understand. It's another way to squeeze $12.95 a day from their guests. There is not much of a beach -- a very narrow strip of sand. The pools were great. There was a smaller pool with waterfall near our tower, and a very large pool with water slide a short walk away. I did not like the hawking done by the attendant handing out towels. He kept trying to get me to buy sunglasses, sunscreen, and other sundries. He told me he didn't like my sunglasses, which I found very offensive, especially since they were not cheap, and were a gift from my partner, and thus, meant something special to me. We only ate one full meal on site, the breakfast buffet, which was standard Marriott fare. Food offered in the bar area was very limited. There is also a deli near the bar with wrapped food -- sandwiches, salads, fruit. Fortunately, there are many places nearby to dine, from a strip mall deli with a great breakfast right up the road from this property, to Sansei for great sushi, to Roy's Kahana Grill -- a near perfect dining experience -- or Plantation House in Kapalua for a delicious breakfast with a view. I had a decent massage, although it could not compare to the treatment at the spa at the Hana Hotel Maui. There was a nice fitness facility. The staff at check-in/check out were very nice and efficient. There are many hotels on Maui from which to choose, and while Marriott is one of my preferred chain choices, I would probably think twice about returning to this property, especially at the price we paid for the room we got.

Reviews.Title: “If Exchanging to stay, Beware!”
Reviews.Author: chief92a
Reviews.Content: Marriott's Maui Ocean Club Dec 2, 2007 We traded our two bedroom Marriott Orlando timeshare week for a week at the Maui Marriott using Interval International. They put us in a one bedroom island-view handicapped room with very poorly designed bathrooms. There have been gassy smelling fumes off and on throughout every day from what the front desk said was a generator maintenance was using. This could be a great resort, but with the attitude of much of the staff, it isn't. Too many of them have the opinion that Maui is the only place to vacation and the Marriott is the only place on Maui to stay. This is our fifth visit to Maui and the hospitality was sorely lacking. We have no desire to want to return here to the Maui Marriott or recommend it to anyone visiting Maui. We love Maui and will definitely try to go back but will look for other places to stay. One of the things that has always brought us back here is the aloha spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good resort”
Reviews.Author: vaznayak
Reviews.Content: We exchanged to this resort from our Marriott Ft. Lauderdale property - sadly, we decided to leave early as the rest of the week was going to be terribly stormy week. We had reserved a 1 Br unit - and were assigned a large, 1 Br unit in the Molokai tower - overlooking the pool area and ocean. The unit was large, and had new furniture. However, it had only a partial kitchen - which was a bit of pain as we had a 3 year old with us - and would like to have cooked on occassion. (I made a mistake while accepting the exchange by not insisting on a unit with a full kitchen). Also, unlike in the new tower they have built recently, the TVs were old style - but not a big deal. The beds (including the sofabed - surprise) was comfortable. The bathrooms, however, were a bit substandard. The amenities provided in the bathroom were poor, the towels very substandard, and the lack of a jacuzzi in a resort of this standing was a bit of a surprise. The entrance to the resort was a bit sparse - the reception area wasn't up to Marriott standards, or for that matter a high quality tropical resort standards - a bit let down I thought. However, the rest of the resort was very good, and well maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful. in some ways, the set of up the resort and the facilities available felt a bit like a cruise ship. However, I think they could/would actually do a lot better by picking up some pointers in terms of how to 'entertain' guests from cruise ship management styles. We didn't visit any of the restaurants on the property as they weren't rated particularly highly. In terms of water activities - the pool areas are good - well maintained with nice, lush greenery. The beach right in front of the hotel not so much. One has to walk a bit towards the Westin to get access to a decent part of the beach. With bad weather in Maui, the resort didn't have much to offer/suggest in terms of other things to do either at the resort or other parts of the island. Most of the other guests had come from cold places, and preferred to stay in Maui - even with the stormy conditions. In our case, it being about 75 degrees in Houston, we decided to return early and enjoy the good weather we have for much of the year. :) Overall, would recommend this resort - but would suggest focusing on the newer tower. We didn't encounter the 'crowds' other posters have mentioned - but that's most probably because we went the week after Thanksgiving. Given the number of chairs we saw there, I'm sure it gets VERY crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Turning 50 at the Maui Ocean Club!”
Reviews.Author: TRULYBLESSEDAT50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Maui (for the 3rd time) to celebrate his 50th birthday!! He went parasailing within walking distance on his birthday which was videotaped for posterity!! We got a special package with a rental car provided free for under $800!!! Such a deal that even a die hard Motel 6 - park your own car man could not pass up! We arrived and from check-in we were in awe of the beauty of the Maui Ocean Club resort! My husband kept exclaiming (and I agreed) how beautiful it was and how we never had to leave the site but we did to shop and visit a few sites and shop. We enjoyed the room which was very spacious; it had one main room with a sink, dishwasher, mini fridge, dishes, etc, a dining area, couch and TV. The other room was the bedroom. It had two bathrooms too! It was Molokai 1015 and the contruction site that was outside the bedroom did not interfere wiht the comfort of our stay. We ate at Beachwalk a few times and the food was good though a little on the expensive side...next time we will get more groceries :)...and enjoyed the 5 koi ponds and the swimming pools and waterfalls!! . Oh...let's not forget the $50 in gift certificates and other discounts from our Maui Ocean Club card!! at the shops we visited. Even the gift shop at the resort was more reasonable than we thought and even had a 75% off sale!! Checkout was just as fast and pleasurable!! Hated to leave ...we could get used to living like that!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best I've ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: Kahunacpa
Reviews.Content: My wife, my father-in-law and I stayed in the Lahaina Villas at the Ocean Club, which is a timeshare property. We purchased someone else's timeshare (who couldn't use it this year), and it was INCREDIBLE! The oceanfront room we were given was immaculate, and the views are out of this world. We have been to Maui four times, and this was by far the best we've ever seen, and we've stayed at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. The villas are new, and I don't even know if anyone stayed in our room before. We booked a 2 bedroom, and the setup was perfect for people who want to vacation without being on top of each other. My father in law had his own room, with bathroom, coffeemaker, mini-fridge, and separate lanai! He could spent time alone, or open the adjoining door and join us. The service was wonderful, the views spectacular, and even the grills were great to use. Lahaina is a quick drive down the road, and the Whaler's Village is a short walk. Overall, this place is amazing. We had the time of our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family week”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneTW
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new Lahaina Tower on the 9th floor , corner unit 2 bedroom 2 bath unit (actually 2 units together with a door, one with the living room and each with it's own balcony). It was wonderfully decorated and had enough chairs, dishes and cookware for us to make brunch for 9 people! Our views were of the Lahaina Mountains to the left and ocean to the right, Lahaina town in the center. My mother-in-law's unit is in the main bldg which is two hotel rooms made into one unit with living room on one side and bedroom on the other, each with it's own patio. The rooms were newly painted and decorated and looked very nice. Kitchenette has fridge and microwave and dishes, glassware. Main pool area was a big hit with our 4 year old who enjoyed the Pirate shipwreck play area every day. Pools were lovely, we had a lot of wind while we there but the bldgs blocked most of it. We never used the new pools in front of the Lahaina Towers but there was always lounge chairs there available. Construction noise couldn't be heard at the pool areas with all the waterfalls but could hear it up in the lobby and I'm sure in the rooms during the day on that side of the hotel. Beach in front was non-existent except at low tide for walking only, we had to walk up in front of Westin for sandy swimming beach. The waterfront walk to Whaler's village was a great way to go to dinner and do some shopping without having to get in the car. We didn't bring a stroller and luckily housekeeping had one as it was a little too far for our son to walk both ways, especially on the way home from dinner at 9pm. Breakfast at Swan Court Hyatt next door was great but expensive at $30, but we ate enough for breakfast and dinner so it was worth it for one special morning and to see their grounds and birds. Be sure to get there before 9am as the line can be very long. Cascades at the Hyatt we had a romantic ocean view dinner for two, sushi was yummy and so was the corn soup, it was pricey but worth it. Didn't like the breakfast at the Marriott Longboards it was $20 and everything I had was cold. Hula Grill was great at Whaler's Village. Would skip Bubba Gump's and Kimo's in Lahaina next trip. Really enjoyed the Aquarium, you only need about 2 hours there. All & all a great trip we'll be back again in '09 as both parents own time shares here and kindly invite us to join them!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place, Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: atlantagal422
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a room through some friends of ours that owned a timeshare there. We stayed there for 8 days. Wonderful room, and I slept on a rollaway bed which was pretty comfortable. My parents said that their bed was super comfortable, and my sister slept on the pull-out sofa bed which she said was okay but could be improved. Pool area was decent, but would've liked more handrails to get into the pool as I just had knee surgery. Also be careful because the stones around there get very wet and slippery. Only drawbacks were that the construction is still going on in the new Villas and you can feel the vibration no matter where you are on the property of the pounding...we were in the farthest building by the pool. Also, if you are expecting nice restaurants and a spa for this "resort" you might want to consider walking to the Westin because this hotel has none. Well, they have the Beachwalk Cafe but I didn't consider it real food, more like snacks and things. For one cheeseburger it costs $10! I did love the staff in the hotel. They were fantastic. Wayne in the Guest Services area was very helpful in making my decision for a snorkeling trip that my dad and I took out to Lanai where we saw 300 dolphins...awesome. We were greeted with Lei's when we checked in which was nice as well. Also, if you have a timeshare in this hotel, they only have room service once a week. If I ever go back to Maui, I probably won't stay there, would much rather stay at Westin, or another hotel in the area, but it was nice for a free room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation Club But Missing Somethings”
Reviews.Author: GHB2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a trade from our Kauai property. We used a lock off room as a trade. The room was larger than I thought it would be. And we had a great view of the pool and ocean. The hotel is kept up really well. The place was beautiful. Close to shopping and dining. Not far from Lahaina which was nice. The only downside for us was the only bar the hotel has which was the pool bar closed at 8pm. We actually spent more time in the evenings elsewhere for that reason. Marriott should consider staying open a few more hours. And there is no beach in front of the hotel to even lay down a towel without the threat of getting wet. The pool was really great but more so for kids than adults. We did not hear any construction where we were located but I can see how it could be annoying if you happen to get a room on the wrong side of the hotel. And the construction will be going on for some time now until the final wing is built. The Molokai tower towards the pool is a great location. Overall we had a great stay and everyone was helpful and friendly. We would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Once again we had a great time!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Teach1977
Reviews.Content: This was our send time staying in this Time share in our favorite location. It was just the two of us in the 1 bedroom unit so we each had a bathroom. I was surprised to see that the units in the Moloki wing had been re done and looked tropical, this had been a complaint of mine last year. The unit looked great. The self parking garage was finished and was easy to use. The location of the Marriott is central, the pool is beautiful, and you can hear the ocean and the waves...... Yes, there is building, and our unit did face the building.... we did hear some noise but it did not bother us at all, we did look down ,just across. Maybe later when it really starts you may hear more noise. Marriott does need to get more umbrellas for those of us who need shade by the pool. Every am, I was down by the pool by 4:40am to secure an umbrella for my 3 hrs by the pool and by that time umbrellas where taken. This is a timeshare problem.

Reviews.Title: “Getting too crowded”
Reviews.Author: uconn1990
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very courteous staff. 1 & 2 BR units offer lots of space for families. Great main pool. In the heart of Kaanapali. Beds are very comfortable. Rooms are well decorated and maintained. Cons: With the addition of the Lahaina Tower, the Maui Ocean Club, like Kaanapali, has become overcrowded. By 8:30 a.m., 90%+ of the pool lounge chairs were taken. Staff goes around all morning checking for inactivity. If belongings are left unattended on a chair for more than 45 minutes, they're removed. There is a new, 2nd pool, but lacks the waterfalls & slides of the main pool, so few people use it. Construction noise was a minor issue. We could hear it from our room, but we were rarely there during the afternoon. The only on-site option for breakfast is the Marketplace. Again, with the addition of the Lahaina Tower, it is too small for the increase in guests. The on-site restaurant, open only for dinner, was not very good. Bottom line: This is a great place for people with young families that want a fun-filled vacation with a great pool. However, I don't think you get the real Hawaii experience. This was our 3rd trip to Hawaii and the 2nd time at the Maui Ocean Club. I'm not sure I would go back there a 3rd time. It was significantly more crowded than our last stay. An additional expansion is due in 2009. I cannot imagine what it will be like then.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around!”
Reviews.Author: Suzette85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in late July 2007; family of 4 with 2 boys ages 7 & 10 and loved it! We were originally booked at the Marriott Wailea and a few days before our trip I noticed that a 1 Br. at this property was available (using Marriott points) in the new Lahaina wing so we booked right away. The folks at Marriott Rewards were extremenly helpful in changing our reservation. This is the new building of the hotel and the room was beautiful. There is a full kitchen with a washer & dryer. We stopped at Costco upon arrival at the airport then went to Safeway in town. The pools are great, especially for the kids. Kannapali Beach is beautiful. The informal restaurants in the Whailers Village were very good (downstairs at Lelanis) and the Bar Barefoot downstairs from Hula Grill. Most mornings I jogged along the 1.5 mile path between the Hyatt & Sheraton. The gym has new equipment as well. There are plenty of 'ad hoc' childrens activities you can pick & choose by the day. One of the most memorable things we did was go snorkeling 10 minutes down the road at Honolua Bay. You can rent gear pretty cheap at Boss Frogs. We saw so many beautiful fish! The surf was just right for younger children. This was better than a snorkel cruise we did later in the week. Another unexpected delight was watching the wind surfers on Hookipa Beach then lunch in Paia. Paia is an older town with lovely shops, but not as touristy as Lahina. There are 2 excellent 'local' restaurants there - Milagros Mexican food (with plenty of Kona beer on tap) and the Paia Fish Market. Maui is very tourist-y, so expect high prices and crowds. But the scenery is magnificent and it is an overall laid back place. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Maui Ocean Club is Awesome”
Reviews.Author: hdmdrx
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare in for the Maui Ocean Club and had an excellent stay. We had a 1 bedroom-huge master bedroom with reasonably large living room/kitchenette. The rooms were comfortable for 2 adults and two teenagers. The staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. I was really hesitant about this property because of the negative reviews regarding construction noise. All construction has been completed and the property was in great shape. They will be starting construction on a new unit next year. Would definately come back to this property again. Things you should not miss: snorkeling with Trilogy to Molokini; drive up Haleakala rather than bike-very scary; eat at Mama's Fish House (very expernsive but worth the view). Discover the waterfalls on the road to Hana; visit Paia to eat at Charley's for the best pancakes. Awesome place and vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's Maui Ocean Club --Ahh! Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: 4babs
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 just returned from a week at Marriott's Maui Ocean Club. We stayed in a one bedroom "villa" in the Molakai tower. From the moment we arrived, we were impressed. We pulled up to the valet and were greeted with traditional Hawaiian leis and given our room key before entering the lobby! All I had to do was check in with the front desk within 24-hours to provide my credit card. The open-air lobby was clean and welcoming. The view from our room was fantastic. The room, pool area and restraunts were very well maintained and might I say again, very clean. Cleanliness can make or break my stay! Last year we stayed at the Grand Wailea and in our opinion this was only one step beneath that high-end and very expensive property. My 4-year-old and 9-year-old loved the pool area. My 4-year-old was in the pool so much she actually learned to swim before week's end. I was a bit leary about this property given some of the negative reviews which is why I felt compelled to write this review. I went with low expectations and was blown away the moment we arrived. Longboards was good, Lelanis was excellent as was the Hula Grill. David Paul's in Lahaina was our favorite place. A bit pricey, but well worth it. Don't waste your time at Pacific O's in Lahaina. Although it was highly recommended by the hotel staff, we found it to be lacking in flavor. Spend the extra money and go to David Pauls...you won't be disappointed. The Trelani boat trip for snorkling was wonderful! A great way to escape the hussle and bustle of the pool! If you have an upcoming stay at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club, you won't be disappointed. We can't wait to go back! Alhoa!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property!”
Reviews.Author: just_moe
Reviews.Content: I chose the Marriott Maui Ocean Club for our first 7 nights on Maui. We wanted location near Whalerâ€™s Village, the amenities of a resort, and the space of a condo. We accomplished all 3 objectives with this property. It was awesome! We are really picky about lodging and this property was amazing. Excellent service from ALL staff, gorgeous grounds and pools â€“ my daughter could do the pool, waterslides and have fun, and my son, who is younger, enjoyed the pirate ship pool area. Plus, the beach was 2 steps away. We watched surfing lessons every day from our lanais (yes 2 lanais!). Luckily we received an oceanfront, 1 bedroom suite, kitchen area, with 2 baths on the 8th floor of the Molokai Tower. Fully remodeled with marble, granite, nice furnishingsâ€¦ Wow! The day we arrived, they had just finished the parking lot construction near the new Villas, so it did not look like that was an issue for anyone on that side of the resort. The new pool area was also opened up and that helped with getting a chair. The Beachwalk Restaurant was good and it was nice to have a place for coffee each morning. We purchased the unlimited drink mug(non-alcoholic) for the week ($25), which was really convenient. Also ate at Longboards, which had good service and overall good food. Will definitely stay at the Marriott again! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation spot, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: The_Whiz
Reviews.Content: We are Maui Ocean Club timeshare owners, but hadn't been to this property in three years. It was as good or better than remembered. Ka'anapali is a great family spot. We don't worry about our teens making the walk to Whaler's Village and back, or hanging out at the beach. The staff was friendly and helpful, the Beachwalk Cafe is great for morning snacks or lunch. The main restaurant is now Long Boards, we had a better meal there than I ever remember getting at the mediocre predecessor, Va Bene. Watersports are nearby which was a big plus for us coming from a week at Wailea where there really aren't any facilities. Our teens took surfing lessons several days with Robert, it was the highlight of their trip. The pool area is great for the young ones, too. For dining we like the Hula Grill and Leilani's in Whaler's Village, Longhis and Cheeseburger in Paradise in Lahaina Town, and you should visit the Plantation in Kapalua. Overall a great stay. There was no construction going on when we arrived, the new tower was just opening, but they will start the new building soon on the Molokai Tower side of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “A+++ all the way”
Reviews.Author: kval315
Reviews.Content: oh my gosh!!! the best location, island, and hotel! my husband and i stayed there last year for one week as a honeymoon gift. it was the best! yes, there was construction, but you would have never known, until you see those tall construction machines up in the sky. everything was quiet and serene. we'll be returning soon later this month of july. if you are looking to buy a time share in maui, this is the place...and you should look into the new buildings as well, i hear they have even more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ocean Club”
Reviews.Author: hulagirl77
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Maui Ocean Club was a wonderful experience! My family and I had a wonderful week. The pool is amazing, my 7 year old daughter loved it!!! As for the construction, we were not bothered by it at all. The new portion of the hotel is due to open in July so the construction is coming to an end. We will definately be going back to the Ocean Club.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: marycheryl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in Maui. Though it has been a few years back (1997 to be exact), I would like to still give credit to Marriott Hotel in Maui for such a wonderful, stress-free honeymoon. In a nutshell, our room was always clean, extra set of towels, and public/common areas were always clean and safe. We enjoyed the fact that we had an ocean-view room where we enjoyed watching the sun rise and set. We also liked the fact that it was/is a beachfront property so all we had to do was walk a few steps and we were there. No need to worry about driving and fighting for a parking space. Great restaurant within the hotel -- scrumptious foods served by real friendly staff. Close to all hot spots within the island of Maui. If we do go back to Maui, this would definitely be a hotel we'll consider again (of course, only reason why we'll consider other hotels is to try out new things).

Reviews.Title: “Most good....”
Reviews.Author: bedone
Reviews.Content: Overall our trip to MMOC was fabulous. Construction? What construction? Our room was in the Molokai Tower facing north and honestly we would have never known there was anything going on. Now, that's not to say that very shortly (but summer's end) that will all change and the North Side of the Molokai should be avoided at all cost. You'd think that a conglomerate like Marriott would have the decency to not book those rooms...whatever. More more bad thing and then on to the good. They need to seriously get in touch with what is going on at their pool with all of the inconsiderate people coming down literally at the crack of dawn to scope out the best chairs. Supposedly the staff was to be watching and any unoccupied chair after 45 minutes would be cleared. Didn't happen. I was almost accosted by a gentleman whom I watched, timed and knew he and his family were gone much longer than 45 minutes. When they returned after, what they said was, lunch they were very rude and just plopped all of their stuff down on top of ours. It was very upsetting. Nuf sed. Okay. Everything else great! Bed/pillows: unbelievable. View: superb. Weather: fantastic -- 82 with no humidity and constant tradewinds with 8 straight days of sunshine. Food: Longboard's/great, Beachwalk/typical beach food. Staff: so, so friendly - couldn't do enough for you. Oh, but the pool..... Some suggestions: The Ulalena Show must not be missed. It is in Lahaina at the Maui Theater. Book the show and make dinner reservations at Longhi's (about three doors down) for 8:15pm. You won't be sorry. Oh yes, and you must almost get to Longhi's one morning for breakfast for their awesome macadamia nut pancakes. The Feast at LeLe. This is a show for those poor souls who did not have the foresight to book the Old Lahaina Luau way in advance. This was developed by the same folks. Much nicer than a tradional luau! It's as if you are at a gourmet restaurant having the Chef's tasting menu with some very tasteful Polynesian entertainment in between courses. Mama's Fish House/Road to Hana. Mama's is about 10 minutes from the airport in Kahului. We did this on our first day in Maui after having just arrived at 8:00pm the night before from the East Coast. Naturally we were wide awake by 6am and thought since we could not check in at the Marriott until 3, why not take the Road to Hana? Perfect. Although we didn't stop much -- we were just enjoying the drive so much. We turned around and got back to Mama's just in fine for a late lunch, which then put us at the MMOC just in time for Happy Hour. Vino, tapas/wine bar in Kapalua. (Can you tell we're foodies?) Really nice atmosphere, excellent service and great food. What's nice here is that you can order 2oz. pours of most all their wines. I got a flight of whites, my husband the reds and we shared some really nice wine for about $25. Tapas' yummy. Try the chopped salad. Sansei/Kapalua -- nice but nothing out of the ordinary. Nice sushi place though. Last but certainly not least: Chez Paul. You will find this "in the middle of nowhere" as they put it, right on Hwy 30 about 15 minutes south of Lahaina. Probably the best meal we had. We did this on our way to the airport on our last night. Perfect timing to have a 5:30 reservation and get to your flight in time. Service was impeccable (Sasha), lovely champagne, very nice meal and creme brulee to die for served in half of a pineapple. We even got to meet the owner/chef. All in all, we had a really great time. The pool scene was very aggrevating though. It's much nicer to be on the beach anyway...I can sit at my own pool at home in Florida ;) I really wish Marriott would do something about it. Mind you, it's off season. What happens this summer? I guess once all of the construction is complete and there are three pools, things will get better. From the looks of things though, that won't happen until at least 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely for Families”
Reviews.Author: poproczs
Reviews.Content: I hear all these reviews about the construction noise and we stayed in the molakai tower and heard absolutely nothing, had an ocean view and room and accomodations were very quiet and comortable. This property is excellent for families. My only problem was the pool. The pool itself was lovely but getting up at 6:30 every morning to just 'save' a lounge chair at the pool is ridiculous. Coming down for coffee the first morning we were there, about 8am, and discovering all of the chairs being reserved already was a bit upsetting. Never the less, I got sucked in and set the alarm for the next morning and ran down at 6:30 the next am and finally got a spot around the pool. So irritated...I hung out at the beach the rest of the trip. Meanwhile, I walked over to neighboring hotels about lunch time and all had spots by the pool. Then I almost felt like I was on a busy cruiseship with guests walking around with their matching sipper cups they must have purchased for one set price to get the constant refills on their beverages. Our room was very nice, the property and staff were awesome, food was excellent but don't think I'll be back. If you are looking for a nice romantic couple place, try the Westin or Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Kids”
Reviews.Author: druryclan
Reviews.Content: We just spent one week at the Maui Marriott and it was wonderful. The grounds and pool are fabulous for kids. Our kids are 3 & 4, so we spent more time at the pool rather than the beach. We had a 2BR mountain view which was very spacious. It did overlook the construction, but it was not a problem. In one month the construction will be done on the Lahina tower anyway. My only complaint is that the beach in front of the hotel is not very swimable, but you can easily walk down to swimable areas. Walk to Whaler's Village for dinner. The sunsets are amazing. The Hula Grill is excellent. If you want to see a show, go see "Warren and Annabells", but book your tickets early. This is a magic show that was much more impressive than David Copperfield. Overall, the Mariott was great. Kanapali is an ideal location. .

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time at the Maui Marriott Ocean Club”
Reviews.Author: Mauka
Reviews.Content: We took a family of seven (my wife and I, four kids ages 15, 13, 9, 6, plus grandma) to the Maui Marriott Ocean Club the first week of May 2007. Grandma has a Marriott timeshare from another state but hosted us in Maui via Interval trade. This was our first ever stay at the Maui Marriott OC . Check-in was a breeze, we requested ahead of time and got an ocean front room on the 7th floor of the Lanai tower. The 2 bedroom villa was fine, although not as nice as other Vacation Club villas that are new, I would imagine the new Lahaina tower villas will be like the others we've experienced. Biggest difference was no stove, no full sized refrigerator, and no washer/dryer. Only microwaves, coffee makers, toasters, and mini-fridges. We never heard any construction noise in our room and the views of Lanai and Molokai and sunsets from our room were spectacular. We stocked up on breakfast cereals and milk and stuff for our own in room continental breakfasts, Safeway in Lahaina is only about 5 minutes away by car. There were plenty of lounge chairs around the pool and grounds for sunbathing, but we did notice that many of the "regulars" had a system of taking pool towels up with them to their rooms, and then sending someone down very early in the morning to stake out the best lounging locations closest to the pool, under the umbrella's, etc., by putting the towels out before the towel station was open. While annoying, we had no problems getting lounge chairs. Our kids loved the water slide and the basketball hoop in the pool, my 6 yr old and 9 year old enjoyed the Pirate ship pool area too. Contrary to several reviews, there were two restaurants open during our stay on property, the Beachwalk near the pool serving breakfast, lunch, dinner, and also sells other sundry food items, and Longboards/LaBene which was open for dinner. We ate at Beachwalk several times and it was pretty good but expensive for pizza, hot dogs, burgers and fries, ribs, fish, etc. It was worth it for the convenience though. We ate dinner at Longboards twice, it was good, the filet was the best entree. The beachwalk was nice for taking walks down to the Whalers Village shops and restaurants. We ate at Leilani's twice, loved the wedge salad and hula pie. We also loved Bubba Gumps in Lahaina, great location, spectacular views, try the bucket of garlic butter shrimp. Best sightseeing was the Iao Needle, Maui Ocean Center, Honolua Bay Beach, Ho'okipa Beach. Best show was Ulalena in Lahaina at the Maui Theater. Don't waste your time or money with the Drums of the Pacific luau at the Hyatt, the host of the show was very lounge lizardy, and the whole experience can't even compare with the luau at the Polynesian Cultural Center on Oahu. We've heard the Old Lahaina Luau was good, but for the money, the Hyatt luau was not worth it. We enjoyed our stay at the MMOC and would stay there again. Staff was friendly, Mike the bellman, all of the valet attendants, pool guys, waiters/waitresses, housekeepers, were all very nice and did a good job.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Annoying!!”
Reviews.Author: luv_travel_13
