Reviews.Content: Well, I would agree with many posters to avoid this hotel in the construction is complete. The whole timeshare thing has ruined this hotel. I stayed 6 years ago and it was a much more lively hotel. All the nice stores in the hotel have been shut down; I heard that Marriott is considering making them into rooms to sell as timeshares. The construction was loud - we were staying on a high floor but facing the construction. It went on Mon-Sat...only Sunday there was no construction. We brought our 2 year old boy and he would take naps in the afternoon, fortunately he slept though the noise but I certainly could not...it was pretty bad. Even with the tv on, and the doors closed, you could hear it. If you are going to stay outdoors the whole day then maybe it won't bother you. Oh, the AC is on our room kept on having problems so that was bothersome All the restuarants at the hotel closed due to the timeshare thing; only a beachwalk fast food place remains open. I guess they are opening back another one this summer. The best thing about the hotel is the pool (very nice) and location...it's in kaanapali; a pretty lively beach in Maui....it's part of a whole strip of hotels. Personally, this hotel is not the best choice; it's basically all a time-share; which I'm not a fan of.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here until 2009”
Reviews.Author: Screenname10
Reviews.Content: Positives: Easy access to the beach, clean rooms, nice pool. Maureen, the oceanfront pool attendant, was wonderful. The beach towel attendant gave wonderful restaurant recommendations. Cleanliness is a priority. Negatives: I took special care during booking to ensure my rooms were away from the construction. I even called the hotel directly. Nevertheless, my assigned rooms directly overlooked the construction site. Noise from the work interfered substantially with enjoyment of the room as early as 7:10 a.m. Noise was even heard at the beachfront where we rented cabanas. It's hard to recover from a 10 hour flight with the beeping on construction vehicles going on all day. An afternoon nap was not possible either in the room or at the beach. All guests must now valet park at a charge of $10 per day since the construction project stole the self-park lot. The amount billed to my credit card was greater than what was indicated on the receipt given at check out. Don't stay here until the construction is done in 2009 when the stay will justify the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual!”
Reviews.Author: cahill05
Reviews.Content: We come to this time share every other year and always have a wonderful time. The only bad thing this year was that there was construction on our side of the hotel. Since we are from the Mid West and were still adjusting to the 6 hour time difference, we were usually up by the time construction started. The restaurant at the hotel was very good and the Beach Walk is great for lunch with salads, sandwiches, and hot food to order. The older time shares only have a microwave and fridge but we were able to eat most breakfasts and lunches in the room to save some money. One recommendation would be to get to the pool early. Many people go down and just put their towels on the chairs and don't come back for a couple hours. The staff seemed to be better this year about taking towels off chairs that had not been occupied for 45 minutes. The hotel is within walking distance (5-10 minutes) of Whalers Village where there are numerous restaurants and shops. There is also a bus you can catch there that will take you into Lahaina for $1. We booked the Hyatt Luau which is next door to the hotel bc the Old Lahaina Luau was sold out. (Book in advance if you want to go to this!) We were very impressed by the Hyatt Luau; the show and food were both excellent. If you go during the winter months make sure you go on a whale watching tour. We went through the Pacific Whale Foundation (pacificwhale.org) and had the best morning of whale watching. We also did the Road to Hana which is a must for first timers. Rent a jeep or convertible if you can and make the day long excursion; its well worth it to see all the waterfalls and beautiful scenery. Definitely eat at the Lahaina Store Grill and Oyster Bar. They have a rooftop patio that looks over the ocean and the food is excellent. It was our best dinner on the island. Lelaniâ€™s, Cheeseburger in Paradise and David Paulâ€™s are a couple other favorites. Overall the trip was amazing and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The Timeshare Continues to Satisfy”
Reviews.Author: Mgbeaty
Reviews.Content: This was our third time at the Marriott. Each time, we've very much enjoyed ourselves. The pool is nice and so are the rooms. We've always gotten the one bedroom and it's been fine for three or four people. It's true that the kitchens are small, but more than adequate if you are planning on eating out for dinner. Construction has been going on very at least the last couple years, but we didn't hear anything from our room this year. Absolutely nothing. I recommend the Marriott to anyone, especially families because the pool area is particularily fun.

Reviews.Title: “just okay, fair value, great location”
Reviews.Author: panwestern
Reviews.Content: As someone said, this is a former 600 room property turned into a 300 room timeshare. A 2 bedroom ( which we rented ) is converted 3 rooms of the old. Lack of stove was dissapointing but fridge and micro, toaster combo was okay. Best part of the property was the pool, as this pool was great for our 6 year old, the water slide was fun and the pirate boat kept our friends young one entertained for hours. Lack of restraunt choices but the kitchen and whalers village nearby did not cause this to be to bad. The pizza hut at hotel was a frequent fave of the daughter, but you can order delivery from nearby pizza and chinese food. must try cajun fish tacos at lalanees ( entrance to whalers village ) We shopped for another property as we extended our stay and although the sheraton looked good, the value of the Marriott became apparant as the sheraton was priced much higher for less room. Overall we like the marriott as it is uassually a consistent product ( stay away from marriott cancun )..... The maui ocean club was no diffrent. I would suggest if you have kids this is the place, if your adults the kanpalli alii is way nicer and worth the extra 50 bucks. since 50 bucks is nothing in hawaii when it comes to hotel rooms. We DONT do timeshare pitches but would return to this property if we could get into the 2 bedroom unit in the new tower under construction. They looked great in the show home, which we managed to sneak through without the pitch. During our extended stay we got a 1 bedroom unit much the same except smaller as the hotel was full. we paid 499 per night from marriott web site while we paid 550 per night for a 2 bedroom from a timeshare space reseller. go figure. staff was great, hotel was clean, rooms on the 2nd 3 and 4th floors seem to have bigger decks. ocean front and ocean view are diffrent ( watch out ) molokai tower had newer furniture and did not have construction concerns, whereas the lanai tower garden or mountain view would be affected by construction. most important stay away from rooms next to elevator unless you are a very sound sleeper. Noise stops around midnight and starts at 4 AM and sounds like an air surge everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of lockoffs/studio units”
Reviews.Author: fpgirl
Reviews.Content: Just a warning for anyone renting a studio or lock-off at this resort, it is a converted hotel & these units are just that--a hotel room. There is a kitchen 'nook' with a microwave, coffeemaker, toaster & a dorm-size fridge...no sink so you get to wash dishes & get water for the coffeemaker from the bathroom sink - YUCK! The ads say sleep 4 but unless you are a family of 2 adults & 2 small kids or 4 VERY close friends, you'll be very cramped sharing this unit with anybody. There's only 1 closet & 1 bathroom. The furnishings were nice & the unit was clean, however there were only enough dishes/glasses/eating utensils for 2. We didn't request more so don't know if they would have been supplied had we asked.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time”
Reviews.Author: CASavvyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was told there was construction going on at the property but a week beforehand was told that they were installing windows and it was quiet and would not disturb anyone. Each morning at 8am I was awakened to back hoes, jack hammers and the site of porta potties being lifted to the roof of the new parking garage (this is the view from the entire side of one of two towers). When I called to complain, I was told they were fully booked and because I had a discounted rate "you get what you pay for". There wasn't anything I asked of the hotel staff, except housekeeping, were they didn't tell me to call someone else. The beach is beautiful but I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: Arewethereyet?SF
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Maui Marriott several times within the last 16 years but this time our experience proved to be very disappointing. Since the hotel has turned to all timeshares (we are Marriott owners in Kauai) many of the services have gone too. Staff, with the exception of the front desk, are helpful and very pleasant but also seem stretched pretty thin. The construction is miserable and if you're not an owner at that property you'll get whatever room is left - usually facing the ugly concrete structure, cranes and the endless parade of cement mixers. We thought being Marriott owners might have some influence in getting a better location (even offered to pay for a better spot) but the manager insisted nothing else was available. This will continue for several years until both new towers are built. The pool area has gotten even more crowded and the lawn chairs are so close together that it's almost impossible to navigate. The cabanas are the only way to go. Service there, thanks to Johnny and Maureen, is excellent. Maui itself has become more congested as all of the hotels are becoming timeshares and are rapidly expanding. This was really evident during dinner when the lines to the local places in Kaanapali where overcrowded and the wait for tables was very long. While the beach was great and whale watching as spectacular as ever, it will be awhile before we return to Maui and especially to the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Marriott is our favorite!”
Reviews.Author: LisaMauied
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Marriott on Dec. 10 -17th it was the second leg of our 3 week trip to Maui. We had stayed here before. We had a 2 bedroom oceanfront on the 4th floor. It had plenty of room for us, a family of 5. Staff is very friendly. The Beachwalk is great for lunch and drinks and snacks and very reasonable if you compare it to the Grand Wailea. You don't have to leave the pool or beach for a snack. Great for the kids who love the pizza. Staff was very friendly. We met Michelle on a parasailing trip and it turns out she worked at the Beachwalk. Also, Gordon and the staff around the pool were great. Free snow cones for the kids. It seems the people that stay at the Marriott are the friendliest. We made many friends playing volleyball and basketball in the pool. I feel it's very safe for the kids to wander around on their own. We walked up to Whalers village in the evening for dinner and shopping. My teenage daughter had her own hammock on the beach where she relaxed and called friends at home. A little disappointed that their restaurant wasn't open very often. All in all we just like the Marriott, we are very comfortable there and will definately be back! There was construction right next door as they are building a new tower but we were not bothered by much noise, once in a while you might hear a beep. It was actually very quiet this week but towards the end of the week it was getting busier as people were coming for the holiday. It's mainly a time share now but you can buy someone's week.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Mama/Seattle
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, great pool. Our stay here was wonderful, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club”
Reviews.Author: Hula lula
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Marriott Maui Ocean Club and we couldn't have been happier. Our vacation was truly a wonderful memory that will last a life time. Our room was very very clean, and beautifully set up. With two televisions, and two bathrooms, my daughter thought she was in Heaven. We were on the first floor and had a perfect view of the pool. Room 102. Because we were completely away from any construction, we never knew it even existed. The pool was amazing. The big slide was fun for all. (Adults and kids). The jacuzzi was nice, but we never had time to actually use it. There was a basket ball hoop in the pool for all to play, and you can purchase blow up rings for the children. On the website for the Marriott, it looks like the Pirate Ship play area was bigger than it is. That play area is for toddlers...not for any children over the age of 6. (That what my daughter thought anyways) The grounds were gorgeous, and there were plenty of empty lounge chairs. We really enjoyed this time of year....we could sit on the cabana lounge chairs on the beach and actually see whales playing in the ocean. Amazing. The staff was wonderful....and very courteous. The parking was valet only, but we didn't have to wait longer than 5 minutes for our car. We truly loved the Marriott, and would recommend this vacation spot for everyone. We can't wait to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lala38
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel which seemed for the most part to be full. They are changing over to total time share units. We were a bit disappointed that they had taken out the luau and did away with the restaurant that served the breakfast buffet. There are several other restaurants on site though they are a bit expensive. Staff was very nice and helpfull. Maid service was superior at the beginning of the week but kind of fell off after that. Rooms were very clean! View on the left side of hotel is of the construction site next door. Be aware they start at 9am sharp during the week. Overall expereince was great and we would return at any time. To bad its going all time share!

Reviews.Title: “Waves and Ocean Breezes make for a nice trip”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaBeachlover
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 which included a teen and a young adult enjoyed our stay at the Maui Beach Club. We had an ocean front condo in the Lahaina Tower so we were exposed to construction views and noise during the day. Normally this would bother me but it was a minor inconvience. The construction did not start until 8 am which we were generally up and walking the beach and ended around 5:30 pm each week day. The condo we had two bedrooms with a living area in between which included a refrig. and microwave and 3 baths. (a nice plus) Perfect for our needs. The condo was clean with comfortable beds and the view, despite the construction, was great. The pool is spacious and not too crowded and even though there were plenty of people there we were able to find chairs. They do have a 45 min rule for chairs which means that those that came down early and put towels on chairs and then failed to show for sometime lost their chairs. This seems fair to me. We generally found chairs closer to the ocean. Take advantage of cabana rental, a most relaxing way to spend the day. The little market was very convienent for coffee, and a lunch if desired and we had a good meal at the pool bar. We generally prepared breakfast and lunch in the condo with supplies from Safeway and Foodland. It was great to be able to walk to Whaler's village for dinner and Lahaina is a short drive. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise - excellent room, grounds, and staff”
Reviews.Author: MeleKalikimaka2006
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about construction view rooms and parking prices etc..; we were ready to be content with any accomodations since we traded into the MOC. We don't go on vacation to hang in the room anyway. We were greeted by a pleasant valet who took all our bags & Costco food/beverages up to the room. We were then given a lei greeting and an Aloha hug! Immediately we were directed to our room in the Molokai tower. Dead center of the resort overlooking the pool and ocean. The room and grounds were always very clean and tidy. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The pool had several children, but nothing an Ipod couldn't overcome. Plus you can't really hear people when you are sitting oceanfront because of the waves. If you are looking for a complaint - it would have to be the waterfall kept me awake the first couple of nights when the door was open all night. I will definitely trade back to the MOC and take my chances again. Also worth listening to low pressure sales pitch from Lee Johnson. Do it in middle of a day you plan on hanging out cuz you will need a break from the sun around 1:30pm and you get $100 of funny money.

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort”
Reviews.Author: cvmar
Reviews.Content: We rented a l bedroom 2 bathroom ocean view unit directly from the Marriott. We needed only one night because we had a reservation at the Westin Villas starting 11-4-06 but our week at the Embassy ended on 11-3-06, however I booked 2 nights so we would have a place to stay between Marriottâ€™s check out time of 10:00 AM and Westinâ€™s check in time at 4:00 PM. We enjoyed our stay so much we ended up staying both nights and into the late afternoon on the 5th! (Got the â€œkeysâ€� from the Westin around 1:00PM on the 4th but never stayed there that first night) At first I was disappointed when we were given a unit on the 2nd floor until I opened the door. Our unit was in the Molokini tower one unit away from being ocean front with a beautiful view of the pool and ocean. I could have thrown a rock and hit a wave! The unit was just refurbished and we were the first people to use it. Mike the bellman went out of his way to get us checked in early and we had a lot of stuff (food, drink etc.) because we had just come from a week at the Embassy. Everything was new. The colors were bold and tropical on the walls and the furniture had a tropical theme as well. The lanai was deeper than some due to our location on the 2nd floor and we really enjoyed listening to the crashing waves when we were out there. They installed radius shower rods so you have a little more room in the tub/shower combo in the bathrooms and they now have a very large round shower head as well. To only real negative in the bathroom is no fan. The bathrooms are compact but the slab granite vanity top is wall to wall so there is a lot of counter space. We had a new â€œReviveâ€� (sp) bed but it was too hard for both my husband and me. In 2004 the bed was perfect. The kitchenette has a sink, dishwasher, microwave and small refrigerator. I really thought the Westin did a much better job with their kitchenettes (on the studio side) than the Marriott but it was a non issue for us. We never had any trouble getting chairs and the pool was fantastic and we had LOTS of fun in the pool. My husband played water volleyball and had a great time and met some really nice people. Everyone we met there was very nice, from the staff to the guests. One of the women working at the Beach walk cafÃ© even remembered my M-I-L from our last visit in 2004. We ate at all the restaurants, Beach walk for breakfast, Va Bene for dinner and appetizerâ€™s and cocktails at Naluâ€™s. The prime rib buffet on Friday night was very good. My husband and our son had the buffet and my M-I-L and I both ordered the small plate of linguini with basil and tomatoes and a salad and it was very good and not small at all, except the price of $6.00 for the pasta dish and $6.00 for the salad. My son could not believe the chocolate fountain at the dessert station. You have never seen a kid eat dinner so fast! The breakfast at the Beach walk cafÃ© though not fancy was just fine. Except for my husband we all ordered kids breakfasts and ate at the tables there next to the beach. My husband and I had appetizers and cocktails at the sushi bar Nuluâ€™s and it was very good. They had an entertainer there playing music and the sunset that night was amazing! You could see the construction from Nuluâ€™s but everyone was done for the day and it was very quiet. I never heard any construction noise so it was not an issue for us. I imagine it would be an issue if your unit was overlooking the construction. We walked along the beach path each evening, laid in the hammocks listened to the ocean and just drank everything in. We hated to leave and wished we could have spent the rest of our vacation there. The feel and location of this resort suits our family and any future vacations to Maui will be at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here Unless You are an Owner”
Reviews.Author: kimlovestraveling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MOC on a Marketing Preview Package from November 23-28. They put us in the Island View rooms which is right above the front desk and faces the parking lot. When we checked in, we were given room 2027 which has a view of propane tanks so needless to say, the view is horrible. It's near the loading dock so every morning around 5am, you will hear the beeps of the trucks backing in. This noise woke me up for the first two mornings around 5 and 6 am. Then I found a roach in the bathroom drawer and a bee in the bathroom. So I went downstairs to the front desk and requested to be moved to another room. They told me that the assistant office manager, Cassie Cockett will not be in until 7am. I went to the beach and came back after 7am to talk to her. She listened to my complaint and said that there are only two other rooms available in the whole hotel and they are both only a few doors down from 2027. I requested if we could move to a room anywhere besides the ones overlooking the parking lot and she said that this is where the rooms on the Marketing Preview Packages are and since this is no longer a hotel room but a Vacation Club, the owners have first priority and they are given the rooms that they purchased so guest who stay here have no flexibility to change rooms. She did give me a $50 credit for our inconvenience. We were given options to move to 2023 which is right above the check-in lobby or 2032 which faces the construction. I opted for 2023 since I thought it was further away from the construction. Boy was that a bad idea!!!!! The room was very noisy because it sits directly above the front desk and you could hear the doors closing all day and night. I was awaken at 4am that morning. I came down and requested that we be moved and since it's a Sunday, Cassie had the day off. They referred me to the office manager who was not very accomodating. She said that since I am on a marketing package, there is no where she could move me and also that the hotel is 100 percent full that day. She did not offer much else and was not very helpful. So we sucked it up for the night since we only have two more nights remaining. I used ear plugs that night to help with the noise from down stairs and it helped a little bit. As for our marketing package preview, we went on the timeshare presentation and Hugh our rep was very nice and non pressured. He showed us a 1 bedroom ocean view and a 2 bedroom ocean front that we loved. The were in the newly renovated Molakai tower. The cost of bedroom ocean view every other year is $19,380 and the two bedroom ocean front every other year is $35,100. I think that if you are an owner in the ocean view and ocean front rooms that you will probably get great accomodations. However, based on the service level that we received as a guest on the marketing preview package, were were hesitant in buying. So if you want to rent here, make sure you rent an ocean view or ocean front room. Of course, you will be paying $350-450/night. The rooms in the Molakai tower are newly renovated and are very nice. I would recommend requesting this tower. The ocean front rooms are amazing especially the ones on the higher floors. The facility is very nice and the pools are beautiful. My daughter loves the kids pool and I loved the slides. The beach is very nice but not great for snorkeling. I was told that Black Rock by the Sheraton is great. We went to Kapalua Bay it was very nice but parking is limited. The best snorkeling is in Ulua Beach by the Wailea Marriott. i highly recommend the Terralini Sunset or Dinner Cruise. It boards directly on the beach in front of the Whaler. The crew on the Terralani 2 are so nice especially Jessica who is new and just moved to Maui from St. John. It's a beautiful boat and is clean. The food on the dinner cruise is good and although we didn't see any whales, we did see dolphins and there were only 14 people on our cruise which made it very private. I highly recommend this cruise. Much more nice and intimate than the Princess dinner cruise which is over crowded. Thanks to the Marriott Wailea for recommending this cruise to us. Kimo's is the best view for dinner in Lanai. The fish is so fresh. We go there every time we come back to Maui. The Old Lahaina Laua was very nice and the roast pig was excellent and so were the desserts. I highly recommend the luau. As for the Marriott Vacation Club, it's a nice facility but the staff is not as nice as the Marriott Wailea although the Marriott Wailea facilities and rooms are not as nice. The one nice thing about the Marriott Ocean Club is free internet and local phone calls. The villa rooms are nice and big and the bed is very comfortable. Overall, I would stay here is I was an owner or if I booked an ocean front or ocean view room and requested the Molakai or Lanai tower. Beware of the island view rooms over the parking lot. Some of the tower rooms will have construction views since they are building two additional towers. TIPS: Go on Ebay and purchase the MOC mug that you can get free refills for drinks. They sell for $24.95 at the market store by the pool. I didn't know this until I was reading some reviews. Valet parking is $10/night but be prepared to pay at least $5-6 in tips per day. Go get drinks and breakfast at Safeway and put it in the refrigerator. Go to the timeshare presentation and get $150 in free certificates for restaurants. Ask for Hugh Durham. He is very nice and non pressured. You may end up buying but make sure you analyze to see if it's right for you. Maui is great and definitely do the Terralani Cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Our Island Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: lmg66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Maui Ocean Club from September 1-8 this year before spending an additional two nights at the Marriott Wailea (review to come). Although our first day turned into a nightmare, the rest of the trip was wonderful. Upon landing at Kahalui in the early afternoon, we learned of the major brushfire that eventually destroyed nearly 5,000 acres on the island over the course of the week. Since early that Friday morning the main road from Kahalui to Lahaina had been closed and arriving visitors had already been waiting at the airport for hours before we landed. We originally had made a reservation on the SpeediShuttle (the only one at the airport, which I do NOT recommend using) to get us to the property, but with the backup they couldn't guarantee we'd get to Lahaina that night. We asked for a refund as we'd pre-paid online and were told "no problem" by the airport representative and that my credit card would be credited the next morning. As it turned out, I had to make several calls over many days and argue with a very rude woman to receive the promised credit â€“ which is why I wonâ€™t recommend the service. We decided to rent a car instead and take our chances, going with Alamo (another one I'd avoid in the future) because we already had a reservation with them for two days later. The person at the desk near the baggage area told me my future reso would be honored and I could pick up a car at that time for the same rate. After waiting in the rental line for nearly two hours with all the other stranded passengers, I was told that they would not honor my original reservation and that I had to pay the "walk-up" rate, which was nearly double what I'd reserved. I spoke to the manager and they finally compromised with a discounted rate close to what I'd reserved but gave me the lowest category car they had, which was not the cleanest, either. Considering our predicament and the fact that it had already been six hours since landing that we'd been at the airport - for our first day of vacation - we were happy to have wheels and to hear that the road had just opened. Upon hitting the road at 8pm, we were almost immediately stuck in traffic with hundreds of other cars trying to get to Lahaina. In the end, we didn't arrive at the Marriott Maui until well after midnight, a full 8+ hours after landing and more than 24 hours since departing Chicago. That being said, the hotel staff was wonderful, anticipating that their guests had gone through a trying time to say the least. Four staffers were waiting at the valet area to immediately take our car, hand us our key and escort us directly to our room, saying we could stop by the next morning to officially check-in and get our full welcome packet. They had ice cold water, fruit and leis to greet us, all of which were very much appreciated, especially considering the wee hours. The only disappointment, being owners staying on the property for the first time since buying in 2005, is that no one is immune from being put in a building with a construction view. Even though I had reserved 7-8 months in advance and requested the Molokai wing, we were put in the Lanai tower overlooking the construction site. I had even followed their advice of calling 2 weeks prior to arrival (when rooms are assigned) to verify my request and then again a few days before check-in. It was at that time I was told that owners who have booked (the maximum time) in advance, 12-13 months depending on ownership level, are given their first choice of room location and then itâ€™s booked from there first-come, first-serve. Despite the disappointment, I was very happy with the room itself and the property as a whole. Though the view caused me to steer clear of sitting on the lanai (which we would normally do quite a bit), we didnâ€™t experience any problem with construction noise, as we are generally up and out fairly early and not back until after 5pm anyway. The only other negative was that our air conditioning broke on about the third day and the motor had to be completely replaced. However, it was promptly fixed with one phone call to the front desk and it caused no inconvenience (we were at the pool!). All in all, based on the vast amount of research Iâ€™d done and reviews Iâ€™d read, my expectations were not only exceeded, but I felt weâ€™d made a great decision in buying at this property and really like what the MVC has to offer. We thought about trading away our Maui week in â€™07 to try something different â€“ this was our second trip to Maui â€“ but are so anxious to go back and see the new addition (including the new adults-only pool being added) and updated rooms that we went ahead and booked a full 12 months in advance for the same week next year. Maybe weâ€™ll even get our preferred tower this time! As for area doâ€™s and donâ€™ts, I highly recommend Blue Hawaiian helicopter tours. We did the West Mountain/Molokai tour and it was spectacular. Also rented from Aloha Toy Store (a 2006 Corvette Convertible) for three days, which was fabulous and was used to drive to the top of Haleakala and to Tadeschi Winery, both of which were lots of fun. Spent my birthday at Ruthâ€™s Chris for dinner (fabulous) and then went to Warren & Annabelleâ€™s for the second time, which is always great. Also recommend Zui Hao, the new upscale Chinese place, from the executive chef of P.F. Changâ€™s (next to Warren & Annabelleâ€™s on Front Street), David Paulâ€™s Lahaina Grill, and both Hula Grill and Leilaniâ€™s at Whalerâ€™s Village. All are excellent. Weâ€™d eaten at Cheeseburger in Paradise in Lahaina last year and it was fun with good burgers, too. Finally, Maui Ocean Center was fun, with a nice lunch overlooking the ocean and harbor. If you have an opportunity to visit Maui, donâ€™t hesitate! We really do feel like itâ€™s our island home away from home. Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “beutiful grounds, plain room”
Reviews.Author: chicagoborn40
Reviews.Content: We were in the midst of fleeing the Papakea Hotel down the street, literally in the middle of the night due to a big roach issue. It was 11pm and we had no other place to go. We contacted the Marriott Ocean Club. They gave us an ocean view room at a discounted price and a fantastic view of the grounds/pool area. The staff was extremely wonderful! Adam and Joel at the valet/bell desk, made us feel welcomed and Joel upon our arrival made us feel safe after a terrible experience leaving our other hotel/condo. We didn't have any of the timeshare sales issues that some others have mentioned. We were never even approached. However, one word of caution regarding the group, Hotels.com. When we told them that we had issues with roaches at the Papakea, they wouldn't search fmor another hotel for us to go to and wnated us and our 11month old son, to stay bin the infested hole until morning. They asked us to find our own hotel and they would "try" to contact the hotel in the morning for a refund. Needless to say, we did all the work. We had to spend two hours the night we left the roach condo and 2 hours the next morning forcing the condo to give us a refund and teaching Hotels.com to get some [--], and stand up to this place. I finally made them pay the difference in cost of the two hotels, plu give us a $200.00 refund for oour trouble. we usually use expedia. My advise, stay with Expedia. Also, on Maui, go with Hertz or Avis, avoid Alamo. The cars are completely filthy. We tried five different cars and they were all in the same condition. Mystery liquid that resembled blood on the ceiling of the car, filthy seats annd floors. I guess they've never heard of a shampooer or vacuum cleaner. When I complained about the dirty seat in the car that we finally took, I wass handed a wel bunch of paper towels and the attendant walked away. When my husband initially told them that the first car we had was unacceptable and we needed another, the outside attendants thought this was funny. i fail to see why this is humorous. If you'd seen the condition of these vehicles, you'd get sick, not laugh! Next time, we'll stick with Hertz.

Reviews.Title: “Tired property, beautiful location, amidst non stop noisy construction”
Reviews.Author: ZinGasm
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my parents for a week who had traded their time from the Marriott Desert Princess Resort. Unfortunately, and as other reviewers have noted, non-owners at this property are given "construction view" rooms which face a monsterous effort that spews noise from 8a to 6p, except sunday. Despite repeated requests to the desk for a possibility to move, we were told the property is fully booked. We, too, thought that was a crock since the facilities do not seem to suggest a full house. Another thing the property is doing is requiring valet parking at $20/day. We have no intention of paying this since it was not advertised, and there used to be free parking before the construction began. We'll dispute it on our credit card if we don't get it corrected before we leave in a few days. Our guess is as soon as the second new tower (not even started yet) is completed in late 2009, they'll knock this existing hotel conversion property down and build something similar to what is going on next door now. this would likely mean that this facility will be in various phases of heavy, noisy construction will into 2012. Bottom line: unless you can be assured of a molokai tower, ocean facing room when you book, AVOID visiting this place for a long time (unless you like hearing loud noise and watching construction workers and the time-lapse, day by day progress).

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for children”
Reviews.Author: katrina13
Reviews.Content: An ideal place to take children. The resort is beautiful and the rooms spacious and comfortable. The resort is ideally located to visit all Maui has to offer. We were able to enjoy a beautiful sunset everynight in the room or out by the pool, swim in the ocean, snorkle nearby, boogie board, stroll along the beautiful beach pathway to the Whalers Village. We (my husband, myself, two adult sons, daughter-in-law and two toddler grandsons) spent the first week in September at this beautiful resort and plan to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: Kamehameha
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The accomodations were very nice and the people and staff were very friendly and helpful. We were not constantly "attacked" to buy or do anything that we did not want to do..the pool area is very nice and the bartenders there are very good at customer service...the rooms have kitchens, but I don't know of anyone who would go to Maui and stay in their suite cooking when there is so many beautiful places to see and dine at. The laundry facility is close to the pool area which is OK, but again...I am not going to Maui to do my laundry and wash dishes... I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to "enjoy" a great visit to Maui. We are already planning our next visit...

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Long Island, a sister island to the Hawaiian chain
Reviews.Title: “Save yourselves and stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: Maika'i
Reviews.Content: If you're familiar with the Marriott hotel brand and expect to experience that level of accomodations and service, forget it. This is an old 1970's hotel which was converted to timeshare. Marriott took two rooms and joined them into suites. That fact is obvious the moment you enter the place. You can tell the interior designer's hands were tied behind their backs because it wasn't built to be a timeshare. The slow elevators and prison-esque inside balcony/walkways are the first clue this is a less-then-hoped-for experience. They are void of any interest. They need some color... maybe hibiscus murals or something. You can easily imagine the doors as prison cell doors and convicts throwing down toilet paper from the walkways. At best, it's reminescent of 1970's motels. If you're old enough, it will bring back memories of driving down to Florida as a kid. OK, interior design and room layout may be subjective. We personally hated it, but one thing we all can agree on is the lack of a washer/dryer in the room is unforgiveable in a big name hotel timeshare these days. Luckily, we only use the kitchen for storing cold milk, breakfast cereal and making popcorn at night. If you expect anything more, you're going to be dissapointed. In the pool area, there are simply not enough lounge chairs for the guests and no room to add more. They desparately need a system to stop people from laying claim to a chair in the early hours of the morning and never releasing it. More than half the chairs were empty for extended periods of time. The only way to get a chair is to remove someone's property and hope you're picking one of the offender's chairs and not someone that just went to the bathroom. The pool police are constantly asking people if they belong there. G-d forbid you go down into the pool without proper ID. This was mildly irritating because they should have been more discrete. Nothing blows the mood than overhearing people talk in official tones to other people. It became aggravating after we befriended a family from another resort and invited them to come by for some drinks and let the kids play together. Their kids were unwelcome in the pool and our new friends were unwelcome in the lounge chair area. Never mind that my family were guests and they were our friends. Never mind that more than half the chairs are empty (well... let's call them unoccupied). Management didn't care... our friends HAD TO GO. The awful part was the tone they used with us and our guests. Marriott was not gracious at all. A polite explaination would have sufficed. Instead, we were made to feel like criminals. For Pete's sake, the kids weren't stealing the pool, they were simply trying to enjoy it. We all packed up and followed them back to their resort on the other end of Ka'anapali where we were made to feel like welcomed guests. What a difference some class makes! The Marriott Vacation Club people bug the heck out of you to take their timeshare tour. They catch you inside as well as out on the boardwalk. I suggest you walk fast and look the other way when approaching these kiosks. We finally gave in for 15000 points. During the presenation they repeatedly announced the current building was not "purpose built" for timeshare and leaves a lot of guests wanting. The new buildings sound much better, but rather than focus on what the new buildings would offer, they spent all their time ripping down all the other timeshare properties on the island. Bad form and incredibly unprofessional. Sorry for being so blunt, but I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone I liked. I wouldn't even call this a Marriott. I know Marriotts. I've stayed at Marriotts. I'm silver with Marriott (used to be platinum before I became semi-retired). In any case, this is no Marriott. We won't be vacationing here again. Maybe after the new buildings go up, but never again in the existing buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Marriott Magic”
Reviews.Author: lynk11
Reviews.Content: Marriott always seems to deliver and no exception here. This resort provides a perfect stay for a week you can fill with luau's, biking down a volcano, sailing, and lots of other activities too numerous to mention. Has a tendency to be pricey but sure is a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our familyof 4 went to the Maui Ocean Club June 10th for 3 nights. Check in was quick and easy. We were taken to our 1 bedroom suite in the Molokai building. We booked a partial ocean view room through Marriott.. We were so excited when we went out on our lanai and saw that we received an ocean view room (almost ocean front). The room was very open and family freindly. The furnishings were comfortable and we enjoyed having the refrigerator and dishwasher. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. There are flowers everywhere and several koi ponds and waterfalls. The pool was equally as fabulous. The kids loved the pirate ship area and the slides. My only complaint about this hotel is the lack of room service/dining options. The Beachwalk Pantry has a very friendly staff but below average food. We didn't hear any construction at all. This is a wonderful resort and we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Filled Week in Maui”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family (wife plus 4 kids ages 8,7,4,3 and a babysitter) just returned from a week in paradise - Ka'anapali Beach, Maui. This was our 2nd trip to the Marriott Ocean Club (1st one was w/o kids). We had a 2bed/3bath Oceanview villa in the Lanai Tower. Each of the 1bedroom and studio sections have a small refrigerator and microwave. It was enough to have most breakfasts and lunches from food purchased at Safeway in Lahaina (join the Safeway Club - which is free, to get reduced prices on groceries). There is no oven, so we had to stick to microwave items and cold cuts. Although the $25 Marriott mug (good for drinks from the Beach House by the pool) seems reasonable, it's much cheaper to buy cases of soda and water and store them in the room. Check-in/out was smooth. Car valets and bellmen were gracious and helpful. Upon check-in, they had everything ready for us, giving us our flower leis and a packet of material and ushered us straight from the car to the room. However, they never swiped a credit card which complicated things the first time I tried to charge a purchase to the room (a minor inconvenience). The rooms were comfortable and we had an outstanding view of the pool and beach. Each of the rooms (3 former hotel rooms converted into a 2bed villa) has it's own private balcony which made for a great location for breakfast each morning. We heard no construction noise the week we were there. The resort is beautiful, with several koi ponds, marine life statues, open air lobby, and of course, the pool. The pool is wonderful. It was never crowded, there were plenty of lounge chairs, and the staff is very hospitable. The waterfalls, the slides, and the kids area make the pool the highlight of the resort. The pool, and the resort overall, is very much kid-friendly, but it still can be enjoyed as a couple. As an aside, if you're looking for a quiet, adults only vacation in Hawaii, you're on the wrong island - in broad strokes, Kauai is for couples as Maui is for families. Besides the pool, there are other great activities as well. My wife enjoyed the new spa, the babysitter loved the workout facilities, and the kids had fun taking a break from the sun to do some of the special children's activities like flower lei making. The beach was great in that there actually was one in June as opposed to December when we had to walk a ways to see much of a sandy area to enjoy. On the ocean side of the resort, there is a walking path that extends the length of the beach from the Hyatt (one resort to the south) to the Sheraton (5 resorts to the north) where Black Rock is located for great snorkeling. Black Rock was about a 20-25 minute walk with 4 kids. Just 10 minutes (2 resorts) to the north is Whaler's Village. All 3 restaurants (Hula Grill, Rusty Harpoon, & Leilani's) are similar and have very good food and great views, especially of the sunset. Kid's would do fine at any of the restaurants, but it can get expensive with a large family. Whaler's Village is a good place to pick up t-shirts and there's an ABC store for various sundry items. We drove from the resort only a couple of times - to Roy's in Kahana (10 minutes) for dinner (excellent service and food, but there's no view of the ocean) and to Front Street in Lahiana. The Marriott activities desk was very helpful in making restaurant & excursion reservations. We did a Trilogy catamaran sail from the beach (about a 15-20 minute walk to the departure point) as well as Aqua Adventures (30 minute drive to Ma'alea Harbor). Aqua Adventures is power boat ride to Molokini crater for phenomenal snorkeling and SNUBA diving (great for those who have never done SCUBA diving, it's diving down about 20 feet with an air line attached to a tank floating on the surface). The crew was fantastic - they helped my 8 year old with the SNUBA and he loved it! I went SCUBA diving for the first time, then proceded to do it 3 more times later in the week - it's incredible what's underneath the water! The turtles, fish, and coral are breathtaking - something not to be missed! Island Scuba staffs the towel hut at the pool where you can sign up to do various activities, including taking intro SCUBA lessons and do a dive right off the beach in front of the resort. Both Vic & Rachel were my instructors and they would be great for any beginners or novices. My family loves the Marriott Maui Ocean Club and we look forward to returning many more times! Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Maui Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BobB711
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Maui Marriott in Lahaina, staying in a 1 BR suite, which was quite large and comfortable with 2 baths. Had a double balcony with a beautiful ocean view and also overlooking the pool area on the 6th floor. The pools were not crowded and enjoyed the waterfalls, waterslide and the whirlpools. If you have children in the 2-4 year old range, the pirate ship in the pool section will keep them entertained all day long. The personnel service (car valet, registration area, pool staff, etc.) were excellent and friendly; no negative memories. For drinks, suggest getting the hot/cold drink cup which is good for the week at the Marriott Beach House and can be refilled often as you like during your stay. Fast food at the Beach House is quite good and reasonable in comparison to the rest of the island. Marriott's restaurant Va Bene was moderatey expensive and food was OK. A must is the buffet breakfast and the Hyatt Regency which is next door; it was terrific and offered every day. For fine dining, tried IO, in Lahaina; was pricey, but well worth the cost. Right on the beach at sunset, a mild breeze and wonderful music from the luau next door plus excellent food and wonderful presentation made it a dining experience. If you have a car, suggest that you utilize it for some of the tourist attractions, instead of automatically signing up for a tour. If your going to the big crater (Hula???), be prepared for driving very slow due to hair pin turns and steep grades. Looking back, this was a very special vacation that exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Love the resort - hated to leave!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui and we absolutely loved the Marriott Ocean Club. We stayed in the Molokai tower and only noticed the construction when we walked by it on the way to the Hyatt luau. We took our one year old son and we found the resort very child friendly. I do wish they provided actual cribs instead of pack and plays. I would recommend renting a crib from somewhere instead of using the ones that the Mariott offered. The bed was pretty comfortable, although the pillows were quite flat. We liked the food at the Beachwalk and I definitely recommend buying the $25 mugs to refill with soda and coffee. We definitely got our money's worth. The pool is awesome. We loved it and our son really enjoyed floating around. It was never really crowded and we were always able to get in the hot tun when we wanted - no waiting. The owner's reception was very nice with plenty of free drinks and food for the family. We ate at least one meal in the room each day and then ate out around Lahaina or in Whaler's Village. It is quite expensive to eat every meal out. We did enjoy the breakfasts at the Beachwalk. Eating right on the ocean was a plus. We can't wait to return to this resort. Don't be afraid of the construction. We really didn't notice it at all and they were supposedly doing some heavy duty stuff with large cranes and everything. Enjoy Maui!

Reviews.Title: “MVC Owners Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from what was once one of our favorite resorts, the Marriott Maui Ocean Club. Unfortunately this past trip we had the horrible experience of staying in a room directly facing the construction of their new south wing. What I came to learn after my desperate pleas for a new room, was that unless you actually own at the Maui Ocean Club, you are limited to the lowest garden-view room category. This even goes for Marriott Vacation Club owners from others resorts - even high demand resorts! Therefore you have better than a 50/50 chance of being stuck facing a huge construction site for a week. When I pleaded with the front desk for a new room, I was politely told that they were 100% booked which was a total crock based on the number of people around the resort and the fact that we never once bumped into somebody on our side of our entire floor the whole week! How Marriott can even allow people in these rooms is beyond reason. Construction starts no later than 8 am Monday through Saturday and doesn't let up until 5:30. And we're not talking just some hammer and nails. We're talking huge machinery driving enormous steel pilings into the earth. You could feel the impact from the pilings all through the resort. The noise level was utterly ridiculous. Granted it got us out of the room each day at an early hour, but it wasn't always by choice. Also, they're working on the elevators which regularly took more than 5 minutes to arrive on any given floor but were almost always empty (go figure). Unless you are an owner at the MOC, I would stay far away from this place until the construction is completed - in 2009!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for kids”
Reviews.Author: fromMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Just returned, spent 10 days in an Ocean Front studio. 2 kids (14,11) and 2 adults. Room was newly decorated and very spacious. Really small fridge and a microwave included. Ate out all meals, but was nice to have cold place for leftovers and cold drinks. Buy the mug for $25 at the BeachWalk for free refills on coffee and soda. Pool and beach are beautiful. Always found chairs and the property was completely sold out. Rent a cabana from the towel hut for $40/day as soon as you get there. They were sold out the last few days of our stay. All the restaurants were excellent. Lots of cooked kid-friendly options at Nalu Sushi restaurant, so don't miss it. Hotel was very clean, gounds were kept up nicely. Hotel staff very friendly. Pool bar closes down by 7pm, not much night life. Construction is from 8-5 every day except Sunday. They will put notices under the door of the extra loud days. Go to Hana or offsite on those days, because you can hear the noise 3 hotels away at the Whaler. You can hear the construction noise at the pool and beach, so if it bothers you, bring your ipod. It's not too bad, just plan accordingly and don't spend time in your room during the day. Everything is as expensive as you read, so hit the ABC store in Whalers Village or Safeway in Lahaina to stock up. BeachWalk is a small market type restaurant, expensive but very good food and nice for a quick snack. You can rent snorkel gear/boards either from the towel hut or Trigoly sports center on the beach. Very convenient. Our only complaint was the construction noise, but we knew about it before the trip. It would have been nice to see some complimentary items for the inconvenience of the construction. Request the Molokai tower.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: rf18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently got back from two weeks in Paradise. The Maui Marriott was an excellent place to stay and I think anyone who gives the overall hotel a bad rating just has too high of expectations or just had bad luck. We are of upper middle class means and have stayed at lush resorts and average hotels. That being said I read some reviews on this resort before going to maui and was a little nervous from some of the posting but once I got there and checked in I realized what some think is nice others think is a dump so read all of these with a grain of salt. I saw I guy at the pool during our stay chewing out one of the pool attendants because they have a 45 minute rule on the pool chairs (you can leave your stuff on the chair but after 45 minutes they can remove it and someone else can take the chair)which he thought should have been 10 minutes at the most and after the argument was over he kept telling his wife that they will never again come back to this place and blah blah blah. So remember some people don't know any better than to complain about everything. This resort is great, not brand new but very clean and the staff was excellent. The pool is unbelievable, very clean grounds good drinks and great views. We had a mountain view room that had a great view. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in, the bathrooms were very clean as was the rest of the room. We ate at both the italian and sushi restaurant, great food, both terribly expensive but everthing is in Hawaii. We also went snorkeling at the Molokini crater which was awesome. If you decide to go book with Aqua Adventures they are a bit cheaper than Trilogy (who is supposed to be #1) and the staff was so friendly it just made for a fun day. So overall I loved this resort don't be afraid of it at all and yes there were lots of kids there so if that bothers you go else where.

Reviews.Title: “only good for timeshare”
Reviews.Author: Netlizard
Reviews.Content: The regular hotel rooms here are filthy & disgusting. The elevators are the crappy metal kind from the 1970's. The hallways are dirty & the front desk is lackluster. Shabby bedspreads & dingy towels. Yuck! I've heard that if you stay on the timeshare side, the suites are renovated. Our ordinary hotel room was the pits. We moved over to the westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the Kids”
Reviews.Author: SouzaKH
Reviews.Content: My family always stays in a 2b/2b condo in South Keihi, but this year we decided to cut our condo reservation short by two days and end our trip at the Marriott's Maui Ocean Club so our 5 1/2 year old could play in their 3 acre pool. This place has been undergoing rennovation for some time and most of it has been in the pool area. However our 1 bd suite was very well appointed, clean and spacious. Our son had a great time at the pool and we did not have to hoover over him every minute like we do at the ocean. They have a pirate ship water attraction where the water is only about 6 inches deep at the deepest area. He made lots of friends and we were able relax and watch him from the sidelines. Note that this place is primarily a time share but they put very little pressure on us to hear their gig. They have a new Sushi Bar in this resort and it is a full 4-stars! Check it out. The head chef, Vince Duong, is experieinced and serves very high quality fish. Sit at the bar and listen to what he recommends. The price is high, but it is everwhere on this island.

Reviews.Title: “Great for familes”
Reviews.Author: Gman1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled all over the world this may not be the best hotel we have ever stayed at but it is an excellent facility. It is mainly a timeshare resort though we werent owners and werent treated differently. The food is a bit expensive like all of Maui, stop off at a grocery store and get some staples and store in your fridge. The pool is awesome, there were some fun kids activities. The beach is very minimal and steep directly in front of the hotel but if you walk 100 yards down it gets better. We had a great time some people are so incredibly picky they can ruin your stay before you even go. There is no way an honest person can rate this as terrible. It may be just above average but no lower.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Was A Dump!! I Cant Believe People Liked It!!!”
Reviews.Author: GUJUsweetpea
Reviews.Content: something is very wrong here, i CANT BELIEVE people liked this place- i just cant believe it!! positive: none really negative: old resort, rooms are just old and nappy (eg-dead flies on the window sills) no good shops/restaurants pool is filled with little kids we checked in, hated the lobby/room/pool. walked to the westin (next door) within 15 mins and couldnt believe our eyes! the place was beautiful...and only $10 more per night. so, we walked back, checked out and went to the westin. id feel really bad if anyone stayed here. odnt get me wrong, the marriott kaui was GEORGEOUS, so its not like i hate marriott or work for westin or anything. its just that this place really ----!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off I was a little nervous after reading some of the bad reviews, but all my worries were laid to rest when I walked into the hotel! It is fabulous! Everyone was so friendly and helpful! The grounds are beautiful and well kept. Our room was in the Lanai tower and we were on the 8th floor. We had an ocean front view and it was amazing. I just couldn't get enough of that view. The room itself was very nice. I think it was recently upgraded because everything seemed very modern. They were doing construction on the lower floors, but unless you were out in the common area you could not hear it at all. They did a great job of keeping the noise and dust to a minimum. Marriot's pool has got to be the best one in Kaanapali! We were a few minutes walk from the Whalers Village, which was nice when we didn't want to get in the car and drive to go out to dinner. It was also walking distance to the jet ski rentals and Parasailing. It was by far the best resort I have ever stayed in. We didn't eat at the resturants on site, but we did get some sandwiches from the Beach Walk cafe. It was a little pricey but it was good food. The prices were not out of line though, in comparsion to other eateries. It was truly a wonderful experience and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely FIRST Class!!”
Reviews.Author: TallPalm
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind that EVERYPLACE in the Kaanapali region is way out of sight for pricing...the Marriott Ocean Club was still a great value! Why you ask?: 1) Best oceanfront location...WOW, simply unbelievable!! 2) World-class tennis facility at 3rd world pricing 3) Covered parking (yes, there is a charge...but all USA hotels in big cities charge TWICE as much) and how great it is to get into your car when it's not oven-like 4) Walking distance to McDonalds, booze and sport-friendly Rusty Harpoon and the super-cheap ABC Store #54 to get all your supplies at a fraction of the cost to the hotel offerings. (All at the Whaler's Village, just minutes walking distance north) 5) EXCELLENT sushi restaurant on site (expensive as all sushi spots are...but you can't get any fresher!!) 6) Free ice and a great fridge/micro/toaster offering in your room to keep most of the breakfast and snack costs to a bare minimum. 7) BEST of all (for me at least) was the totally free high speed DSL internet service....and what makes this so great is that it offers both wireless OR connected service at NO cost to you! If you play their "timeshare game", you can get up to $150 in cash credits, but be advised you must sit in an "ownership overview", and I don't wish that on anyone!! Best of all: 100% sunshine, palm trees galore, limitless bikini babes, perfect surfing conditions, excellent seafood...and last: The number 3 rated nude beach in the world at Makena's "Little Beach". Only 30+ minutes away from your Marriott Ocean Club's sun-protected car! Sure hope you enjoy as much as we did!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for anyone”
Reviews.Author: thegarageguy
Reviews.Content: I'll write more about the hotel in my review but I can't believe anyone would complain about this Marriott. There was construction going on but not on our side of the hotel. We never heard it except for walking back and forth to our room. Kids loved the pool more than Hyatt's, Westin's, and Sheraton's. All they wanted to do was play in the pool. Perfect location. Have to walk up the beach about 50 yrds but it's a great walk. Right in the center of the best part of Maui's beaches. We've been to 15 countries, lots of hotels and this place was excellent. Only downside is cost of food/quality. Food was good but you could get just as good at Hula Grill for less cost. If you go to the Luau, you're paying for the booze. My kids got bored and the food was good but not worth $75/adult (even if kids are free). We're not drinkers so it wasn't worth it for us. Overall, I'd go back anytime. Not sure I'd pay the extra $75/night for the Hyatt or Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel-Whats all the complaining about?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off i decieded to write this because of all the negative reviews. My husband and I went here for our honeymoon. We got it cheap by agreeing to a timeshare presentation. I was a little worried that they might be pushy but at least the guy we had was not at all. We told him staright up we were just looking and could not buy into a timeshare right now but wanted to know the information. With the timeshare presentaion we got a free car rental ( which we could not use since we were not 25 ) and a 50.00 voucher to use anywhere in the hotel. After we booked our hotel we put in a request for a room upgrade since it was our honeymoon. They said they could not guarentee it but we could request it. Upon arriving to the hotel the guy at the desk and was friendly and congratualed us and gave us a room upgrade. We had a hotel room and not a timeshare room. Our room was just normal size, why would you need a big room when your not in all day anyways? Our view was awsome. It was right in the middle and faced the pool and ocean. There was obstucted views because of all the palm trees but we have amazing pictures from our balcony. After we arrived we went to check out the grounds and when reuturning to our room there a bucket of ice with champaign and beautiful hawaiian flowers in it. We were kinda shocked since we didnt ask for anything like that! Our room service was just fine and no one tried bug us or kick us out when the room was ready to be cleaned. The grounds are absolutly beautiful and although we did not eat at the restuarant we did eat at the little snack shack thing they had which had pizza hut and all other snacks like sandwhiches, coffee, etc.. Someone in the reviews compained about the price, what do you expect, your in hawaii. They tell you to plan 100.00 a day just for food if you do not have in room cooking abilities. Another complanint was that someone judged then and asked them for their hotel room because they thought they didnt stay there, they ask EVERYONE! They do this because there pool is so huge and awsome(waterfalls, slides,etc..) they do not want other hotel guest using it. They asked us for our room # and gave us a red rist band. Also someone said they could not get room service because it is converting to a timeshare. If you want or expect room service do not stay at a timeshare hotel. It would be different if you did not know the hotel was a timeshare. The last complaint i read what about the construction. When we were there, there was no construction going on but travelers should know that you should ALWAYS call a hotel and ask if there is construction and if there is, is there a possibility you may be put in a room that is near it. If they say yes, and you still want to stay, pay extra for a room that is not near construction! Our stay was awsome. You can not beat the location, there is bus that leave like every 30 mintues that takes you to Lahina Town for a very small fee. You would need a car if you did not want to go sight seeing. Lahina town has everything from shopping to all kinda of restuarants. My only slight concern one would have is the crowdedness of the pool. By noon almost all the chairs were taken up. We would just find one chair, throw our stuff on it and go swimming. If you want to lay out ALL day you would need to go early to make sure you could find a spot. We also went prime time so it may be less crowded at other times. One of the most awsome parts of this hotel is that you can get a massage under a cabana infront of the hotel, overlooking the water-priceless! Another positive is that you can walk to alot of activites such as jet skiing. If you do stay at this hotel, there is a great restuarant about 5-10 minutes walking distance called Leilanis on the Beach. Go straight out infront of the hotel towards the water and go right, walk straight down and you will see it.It is all outside overlooking the water, great food, next to shops.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Room, Great Pool for Kids - Overall: Don't Go!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the room quality and the boring lobby. Certainly not at the level of other Marriotts. If you're going to journey across the Pacific ocean for a great vacation, don't stay here. The Marriott in Walea is much nicer. The upside is the location with stunning views and a great pool for little kids. But you can get this elsewhere in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I have been on many many vacations before our honeymoon, and we've always had luck - not this time. We arrived to the Marriott at 9pm only to be told there were no beach view rooms available. We were escorted to a room that smelled like mold, had damp sheets and floors and looked out over a (huge) propane tank. We called the front desk and they told us that we should expect that smell because we were in a tropical climate. I've been in tropical climates before and have never experienced the stench of our room. The told us we could be moved to a room two doors down, which just had been "purified". We moved there, but it wasn't much better. It didn't smell as bad, but the furniture and bed were just as damp. After traveling for 6 hours or so, we were starving. They were just closing down room service, but we managed to get Pizza Hut from room service. It came to us cold and uncooked. Needless to say, we slept only a couple hours and changed hotels. Don't even waste your time with this place!

Reviews.Title: “No major complaints”
Reviews.Author: NY_Michigander
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Maui Ocean Club on our honeymoon May 9-15, 2005. Overall the property is nice, very clean, great beach and wonderful pool area, but we did have some issues. We received this stay as a gift from my father. We exchanged a week of his timeshare's lockout in FL for a lockout here. His FL property is oceanfront, we were given partial ocean view and told that they cannot guarantee views on exchanges. OK, fine. Then, as we looked out at the view, we looked down to see not only the parking structure, but also all the materials for the construction going on in our wing. Now, we knew there was construction, but they put us on the floor directly above it! It started with the trucks below our window beeping and being filled at 7:30am. Then, there was constant pounding and drilling directly below us for the whole day - aside from the lunch break 12-1. I don't believe the place was all that booked, as the entire week we saw one other couple get off on our floor - which had to have a good 50 rooms on it, so why they put guests there I don't know. Unfortunately, we got all unpacked and settled before I thought about asking to be changed, so for that I can only blame myself. We just thought they had the attitude that since we were an "exchange" (read person who already owns a property elsewhere so isn't going to spend any money buying here) they didn't need to take care of us. Unfortunately for them, that gave us the impression that they do not really care about their property owners, so we will not pursue timeshare options with Mariott. The positives - great pool, great location. Italian restaurant on site very good.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Time Share Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: I stay at Marriottâ€™s worldwide and I was shocked by this property, when I called to book my reservation I was told by a front desk agent that they do not except reservations as this was a time share hotel. Well needless to say I went online to marriott and booked a room for 2 nights. I called to check the reservation and was told again they only do timeshares, so I just hung up. Upon arriving at the hotel I was told there is no complimentary self parking, well I lived in Maui and was familiar with all the free parking in Kanapali Beach so I found some and walked to the hotel, about 2 minutes. When I checked into the hotel I was told I did not have a reservation. This was at 2:30pm, I pulled out my reservation and was told ohh well your room will not be available until 4pm, FYI check out time is 10am PROMT. SO I received a call around 5:00pm saying I could now check in. The hotel was under staffed with bellmen and valet attendants. I finally got to my room, the view was great but the room was very simple and there were 3 other guest roomsâ€™ doors within feet. I felt like I was at a dorm room. I called down for some food at 10:00pm and was told they do not serve food after 10pm and there was NO ROOM SERVICE due to the hotel switching to Time Shares. So I was hungry and had to wait until the next day to eat. Upon going to the pool to walk around we were approached by security. Could it have been the fact we had tattoos? Who knows, the security asked my room # and I told him He had no reason to ask why it matters, he thought we were not guest. Well folks, donâ€™t judge a book by its cover.. I was shocked that we were judged and will never visit this property again. I could go on and on but I will close by saying Just Say NO TO TIME SHARE HOTELS P.S. Check out time is 10am and had a Housekeeper wake me up even with the Do not Disturb sign on the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: dune205
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels and resorts across the US, and I can confidently say that you can't go wrong with the Marriott Maui Ocean Club for your vacation. Things that stand out: Service is great, very friendly. Food is great. Awesome pool. Reasonably priced. Clean rooms. Location, location, location. CLose to Lahaina and being able to walk to the other hotels and Whalers Village gives you many more opportunities for activities. The beach is very nice. We stayed in one of the last hotel rooms, so not sure about the whole villa thing. The room was a touch outdated, but better than I expected. Overall I will say that they exceeded my expectations. I would certainly stay here again hands down. And I am a hotel snob.

Reviews.Title: “A Home in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from the island of Maui, I can highly recommend the Marriott's Maui Ocean Club. The Marriott does an awesome job of blending the amenities of a 5 star resort with the friendly familiar feeling of home. We've stayed on Maui several times now and enjoyed the Hyatt Regency (awesome for couples/honeymoon) and visited the Grand Wailea with its incredible pools, but for us this resort, the location, the pool, the room, and the staff all add up to our favorite place to stay. Although the staffing is a little down as this transitions to an ownership resort, you are still met by a smiling friendly valet, bellman and given a lei greeting. The staff in all areas are extremely friendly and helpful, most having been there now for years. The resort itself consists of 2 main towers, Moloki and Lanai. We prefer the Molokai tower as even a garden room potentially gives you a peek-a boo view of the Ocean. We had a pool view/ocean view and it was awesome. The rooms come in 3 flavors: 2bd/3bth villa (sleeps 8), 1bd/2bth villa (easily accommodates 6) and the 1Bdr/1Bth lock-off or efficiency which sleeps 4, although we requested a rollaway and easily had room for all 5 of us. The small unit has a microwave, bar refrigerator, toaster, coffeemaker and dishes, but no dishwasher. The room was clean and the bed was comfy with a plethora of great pillows â€“ a big plus for us. As an ownership resort, they offer a free â€˜tidyâ€™ service once a week, and daily garbage removal. You can pay a small amount and have daily maid service as well. The crown jewel of the resort is the fantastic rock/grotto and waterfall pool complex consisting of a 2 level pool, with waterfalls into the lower level, and a small slide or stairs as a connector. The upper pool boasts a large Grotto cave with swim through waterfalls at either end. There is a pretty good â€˜largeâ€™ waterslide that all three of my kids can enjoy, 11, 9 & 6. There is a in water basketball hoop and 2 Jacuzziâ€™s next to the pool bar. The lower pool has a large area with shallow baja type steps that are about 6â€� to 2â€™ deep and very big (10x 30) for the little ones to play in. In addition there is a kids â€˜Pirate Shipâ€™ that rests in about a foot of water with water cannons, slides, turtles, dolphins and lots of sand for the younger kids â€“ my kids still love it and spent Â¾ of their time there still. The beach right in front of the resort is beautiful but not great for boogey boarding or body surfing as even though it is a sandy beach, it has some rocks in it out in the water. Venture up the beach a bit towards black rock and it is nice and sandy and less of a shore break. The beach is pretty safe, with waves pretty mellow and a pretty gentle current, but there are no lifeguards so watch the kids (and yourself) if you arenâ€™t familiar with the ocean. If you want to snorkel or dive, many people head straight out in front of the resort, or head down to black rock â€“ an easy walk up the concrete lighted beach path. There are showers along the beachwalk after you get out of the ocean, usually in front of the different resorts. There are 3 onsite restaurants; adjacent to the lower pool is the Beach Walk pool grill â€“ great for breakfast, lunch, snacks, drinks and even dinner. A note of adviceâ€¦ buy the bottomless Marriott cups for $15 the first day and you can refill for the duration of your stay (sodaâ€™s, tea.. basically cold drinks, or $25 if you want to have the â€˜hotâ€™ mug for Starbucks coffee, etc.) Va Benne is the â€˜niceâ€™ restaurant, which serves up a fantastic, though expensive, breakfast buffet; made to order omelets, eggs, waffles plus breakfast meats, local fruit, cereals, the works. Be aware the 5 of us, (3 kids) were $70. Note the last time I was here my room included â€˜freeâ€™ breakfast for 2 and they were running a promo that kids ate free with an adult. Look for that when booking your room as it is a very nice thing to have. They also serve a nice dinner. Finally there is Nalu, a sushi bar/restaurant, that Iâ€™ve never been to so I canâ€™t comment on. You can also order food from the poolside bar. The other great thing about the Marriott is its location. Nestled right on Kaanapali beach, it is a short walk from Whalers Village and its shops and restaurants. The entire stretch of the beach from the Hyatt on the south end, up to the Sheraton at Black Rock has a lighted, concrete walking path. Be sure to go to Barefoot Bar at Hula Grill at sunset; tables in the sand, palappas overhead, the beautiful Maui sunset, steps from the Ocean, the Black Rock torch ceremony and cliff dive and great, reasonably priced food. Itâ€™s casual and a total joy, especially on Sun & Wed evening when some locals entertain with great music â€“jazz and local blendâ€¦ electric Ukulele. The resort is also an easy 5-10 minute drive into Lahaina were front street is full of shops, restaurants and galleries of all kinds. Hit Kimoâ€™s for their famous Hula Pie and Bubba Gumps for GREAT fish & chips, coconut shrimp, and clam chowder. Drive into Lahaina 1 morning, take a left at Pizza Hut and there is a great local bakery back in the industrial area â€“ hard to find, but some great bread, cinnamon rolls,etc. Weâ€™ve been in August several times â€“ first weekend is the Maui Onion Festival and Whalers Village has some great festivities â€“ incredible onion rings. We went in April this time and had low-mid 80â€™s weather, a breeze a couple days, and 1 day with some drizzle. The restaurants and shops werenâ€™t crowded, there were still even a few straggler whales to be seen, the resort was not crowded and the weather was really perfect.
