Although this is an ownership resort now, you can still log on to Marriottâ€™s Vacation Club website and rent villaâ€™s. Keep an eye out as there are sometimes pretty great specials â€“ Iâ€™m looking at an ad for a 1 Bdr villa right now for $186/night. This is such an awesome resort that everyone should give it a try. If you are heading to Hawaii, Iâ€™d recommend Maui, and if in Maui, the Marriott Ocean Club is great. Iâ€™ve already booked my room for next year, so if you are there in April, weâ€™ll be the family that looks like were home, because that is what we consider the Maui Ocean Club â€“ our home in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor luau presentation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The luau presentation was very deceptive, courtesy of their Master of Ceremonies. Everyone is told that a pig was roasted especially for your gathering that day. In reality, the pig that you eat was cooked the day before, sliced, placed in refrigerators, heated up and served the next day. They talk about some exotic pineapple cake. In reality, all it is, is Pineapple Upside down Cake. The food in general tasted like it was reheated many times. After complaining to management about the pig, I was given a full refund for the luau and suggested that the presentation of the pig to be more truthful in the future. They tell you about the emu where the pig was cooked yet we couldn't find any evidence of one on the property. When we asked someone from the hotel where the emu was, that person walked away without answering. We will never stay in this hotel again. Management could really use a serious attitude agjustment.

Reviews.Title: “Time-shares Are Taking Over Traditional Hotel Plans”
Reviews.Author: Glenn-P-Tokyo
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Hyatt next door two times before, we knew of the Marriott Maui Hotel, before it became the Ocean Club. Since we were offered a very nice 5 days, 6 nights package from Marriott that included a rental car and some benefits, we decided to take them up on it since we love Maui. We were not disappointed in most areas. We asked for and got a higher floor room, of course, with a mountain view and with the parking lot below. However, the mountains are very beautiful and it was just fine with the view. We were very happy with the friendly staff and the service. The pool area is very nice although crowded. Here are some things that need to be aware of: - We were told that by the end of April, the entire hotel will become time share with new interiors. There will be no normal hotel bookings in the future. - The current hotel rooms are nice, but the bathrooms are old, but clean with not bathroom smells. Again, we were told that the new time share rooms will be taking 2 - 3 of these rooms and completely redo the interiors. - The hotel and the new time share is really geared for families with kids and so if your are a couple, honeymoon or mature and do not want to be bothered with kids yelling, running and jumping in the jaccuzi with you, then this is not the place for you. If you have kids, this is a great place for the kids. - Food is pricey at the hotel, but with Safeways, K-Mart and Costco on the island, there is not reason not to take advantage of the in-room refigerators. - Parking is at a premium and they charge you $9.00 per day, but just use the valet parking and gave them a $2.00 tip when picking up your car and there is not a problem. Just a point on time-shares on Maui. Many of the major hotels in Kanapali and other points in Maui are moving away from normal hotel services to time-shares. These plans can be very profitable to these facilities since they are offering only 1 - 2 weeks a year of use for 10s - 30s thousands of Dollars, and they add a maintenance fee to this. I am sorry to see many of our favorite places leaving the hotel business for these plans. No many how many times I try to calculate the costs of these plans over booking a traditional hotel room, I just can not see the benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the family.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I know this is a little late but our family stayed at this hotel last March and we absolutely loved it. Nice, wide beach for lots of activities. Nice pool bar and great staff. Also had a deli/concession stand by the beach. Very nice rooms with a great breakfast buffet in the morning by the beach. Could see whales right from our table jumping in the water. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go here on your honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: vols39
Reviews.Content: I stay at Marriott properties all the time, and I was very disappointed in this property. Like most business travelers, I get a lot of points for staying at Marriott hotels, and it is a great frequent traveler program. We booked a room here for our homeymoon and when we arrived at the property we were a little weary of the facility. It has a nice open air lobby and the staff is very friendly.. The rooms are set up like a college dormatory and the beds are probably the originals from when the hotel opened. There are two towers on this property. One tower is the Ocean Club and has rental rooms. The other tower is the "full service" Marriott. I later found out that they are probably going to turn the hotel side into rental rooms down the road. We tried to stick it out and make the best of it, but there were people EVERYWHERE. They were packed on the lawn by the pool and you couldnt see any bare grass. You have to rent chairs on the beach days in advance, and it is difficult to relax. This would be a good place if you have kids and are on a budget. They have a neat pirate ship in the pool and it looks fun. But if you and your wife would like a nice hotel and some privacy, head over to the town of Wailea. We left the Marriott on Lahaina and checked into the Renaissance there. It was just what we were looking for. There we children around, but they werent running around the pool area going crazy!! Back in the day, Lahiana was the place to be. It is not anymore! Go to Wailea and relax and enjoy Maui. It is only 35-40 minutes from Lahaina, and it is worth the drive....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 5 nights of our Maui vacation at the hotel portion of the Marriott Kaanapali Beach. The location was perfect. What I liked best was not having to get up early to find a lounge chair in the sun. There was plenty of room. (Of course this may not be the case during vacation weeks.) The pool was quite large and it was nice having a store/restaurant right near the beach walk. We were upgraded from a regular room to an ocean front room with a very large balcony. The only down side to that was we were right over the restaurant and it got noisy early in the morning. That didn't matter to us though - we're east coasters - and were waking up by 5 am for the first 5 days. The bathroom was average (nothing special) but clean. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were nice and comfortable. We did not eat dinner at the resort, but had lunch by the pool a few times and it was very good. There are tons of eating options within walking distance. You could even walk to the golf course. We looked at the timeshare there, but I found it odd that there was no stove in the kitchen .. just a microwave. You can't even make a grilled cheese or a cup of tea! But, I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Marriott immensely”
Reviews.Author: Meesha01
Reviews.Content: Life is about choices....just returned from a vacation at both the Westin and the Marriott. We wanted to compare them prior to buying a timeshare. Although the Westin was more luxurious we bought a 1-bdrm timeshare from Marriott for several reasons: It was $10K less than the Westin, it had two full baths, and there was more activity at the Marriott. We have no children but did not find them to be annoying even though we made the mistake of staying at the Marriott during Presidents Week when there were tons of kids there. When I used the pool I always found room to swim. We had my 82-yr. old mother with us and she preferred the Marriott to the Westin. She could take walks by herself on the long boardwalk and never get lost. She was bored at the Westin as there was no where for her to walk and less people to watch. We stayed in a hotel room using Marriott points and did find it terribly outdated. However, we found the timeshare rooms to be just what we wanted. Although the Westin had both a full kitchen and a washer and dryer we chose the Marriott to have two full bathrooms instead. We also have other Marriott timeshares that are much more luxurious. They do not have the same wonderful, beachfront location that the Maui Marriott does. We are happy with our choice and will be returning every other year.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, good food, but a musty room”
Reviews.Author: dive-in
Reviews.Content: After spending a few nights at a B&B in the Maui upcountry, we headed to the Maui Marriott and Ocean Club for some beach time, Feb. 15-19. I was using Marriott Rewards points for the room. In a nutshell, the time share portion of the resort seems very nice, but based on our experience, the few remaining hotel rooms show their age. The grounds and restaurants were very nice. We arrived a little before the documented 3:00 check-in and as expected, based on reading reviews here, we had a wait. They gave us a pager, we drove around a little while, and bought some ice cream for the kids (5 and 9 year olds). We never got a page and I figured the pager only worked at the resort. When we arrived back at the hotel, the room they were planning to put us in still wasn't ready but they did find us a room. BTW, they said the pagers work any where on the island. The first thing that hit me when I walked in the room was the musty, moldy smell to the room. This doesn't bother me too much but my wife and daughter have mold allergies. I figured we wouldn't get anything better since we were on an island and it's humid everywhere. (Based on our experience at the Kauai Marriot and Beach club later, I was wrong. The rooms there were fresh and clean.) We just popped the antihistimines and stuck it out the 4 nights we were there. I do commend the Marriott for replacing the bed spreads and curtains when I asked them the next day. It helped a little but what the room needed was to have the carpet, couch, beds, and wall paper replaced as well. They did their best to resolve the issue and I didn't push the issue any further. Other than the smell, the room was larger than I expected. Also as expected the hotel room overlooked the golf course, hotel maintenance areas, and garbage bins. We got the smell and heat from the dryers in the laundry area every afternoon so we really couldn't use the lanai very much. Now the good stuff. The pool is amazing. My son and I spent a lot of time playing basketball. The nice slide was not as big a draw to the kids as I expected but I did enjoy it. My daughter loved the pirate ship and the kids area at the pool. The wind was about the only problem making a warm day feel cold when you got out of the pool. We didn't use them but there didn't seem to be very many hot tubs. I'm not sure how much of a problem they have with non-hotel guests using the pool but the security and the wrist bands at the pool seemed a little extreme. The food at Va Bene was very good. We went to the Friday night prime rib buffett. Kids 5 and under are free and 6 to 12 (?) are 1/2 price. I found all the buffet items very good and fresh. The deserts were especially good. :) The Beachwalk Cafe while not 5 star did provide good quality food at decent "Maui" prices. We ate most breakfasts and one dinner there. All in all it was a good stay. The highlight was the pool. The lowlight was the room.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: dombart
Reviews.Content: What a great expierence. My best vacation ever! This hotel was superb! Great location, great service and great pool. Wonderfull place to stay,with ot without kids.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family vacation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum member with Marriott and so I had the blessing of using points to pay for a 10 night stay at this resort. I travel quite a bit and so am a bit of a hotel connoisseur. The focus of this property is not luxury (although is has it) but rather FAMILY FUN!!!! If you are looking for a Ritz Carlton type of experience then donâ€™t stay here. I was very impressed with the friendly and accommodating staff at the hotel. We got in pretty late the 1st night and the bellmen were very helpful in getting our stuff up to the room - imagine 2 adults and 4 children worth of stuff!!! We were on the top floor with a corner deluxe ocean view but could also see the pool. When we pulled back the curtains to look outside my children nearly fainted when they saw the MASSIVE pool. They couldn't wait to get up in the morning to try it out. First time I have ever had my kids WANT to go to bed!!!! This was starting out to be a great vacationâ€¦ a little snuggle time on the balcony with the wife! Our first impression of the room was impressive - impeccably clean! We had a 1-bedroom suite w/ 2 bath. For all of us, it was amazingly plenty of room. The kitchen area had all you need to cheap it out and cook some of your own meals - no stove but everything else to include dish washer. There is a Safeway a few miles down the road so no need to worry about stocking up on food. The food prices at the hotel were reasonable but for 6 of us Safeway was the better option. I did take my son (the seafood die-hard) to the all-you-can-eat buffet at the Marriott one night and he dreamed of crab legs for the next few weeks â€“ it was awesome! The first day walking around the property was awesome! My kids (11, 9, 4 and 20 months) were in heaven! The pirate ship for the little ones, the water slides, the in-pool basketball, 2 hot tubs, the beach close by, etc. We walked around 4-5 other hotel properties while we were in Maui and this was by far the most family friendly of all of them. I would recommend stopping at Wal-Mart on your first day (near the airport) and buy stuff like floaties, boogie boards, sunscreen, etc. The prices for rental are ridiculous!!! You'll save yourself a ton of cash with this advice. We spend maybe $100 at Wal-Mart for all the fun amenities and the kids were good to go. You can rent all of your snorkeling gear near Safeway at the Maui Dive Shop. This is one instance where rental saves money over purchase. You can walk about 30 minutes north towards the Sheraton property and go snorkeling at Black Rock â€“ WOW!!! Or head down south a mile or so and snorkel at some of the public parks. We even had church one Sunday at the Calvary Chapel Maui â€“ right on the beach!!! How cool is that!? It was a bit difficult to pay attention to the sermon when there were sea turtles playing in the background. You have to go to Lahaina one night â€“ Front Street. What a great place â€“ only a few miles from the hotel. There are a million little shops and great restaurants. Beware of the dent it might put in your wallet â€“ not expensive but many purchasing options! However, we found that Wal-Mart has the absolute best prices for your take home souvenirs such as the chocolate-covered Macadamia nuts, Kona coffee, etc. We waited till the day of departure, brought huge duffle bag, and stuffed it with goodies! My wife and I also attended a timeshare presentation at the Marriott to earn 15,000 Marriott points and were impressed by how "non-salesie" the pitch was - I recommend it! All-in-all, this was the best family vacation we have ever had. I may be a little biased because the entire 10 days were free but this is one of the best resorts our family has ever stayed at. I am not sure if I would pick this hotel for a romantic getaway with the wife but it can't be beat for the response you'll get from your kids!

Reviews.Title: “Still as good as always”
Reviews.Author: divot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the week of New Years and it was great. The construction that was starting 5 years ago around the pool area really paid off , it's one of the best pools around. Love the Bar in the center of it all great place to people watch.went through a time share deal just for the 100.00 for some free drinks. the breakfast buffet was excellent as always , only ate at the resturant once is was good not great but good. FYI i have stayed at this Marriott at least 7 times in the last 15 years so I know the joint pretty well.....anyway...service was excellent the Guys up front are always Happy to see you again.....and are excellent in providing you with any info you need ...Just ask for Jay Ramos...he can take great care of you . and he loves to golf. when we got there the room was deluxe ocean view with view of palm trees( 2nd floor) called down for a room change and next day they sent Jay to switch our rooms and it was done by lunch , we just had to go shopping while they moved us to the 5th floor....great view. I would stay here everytime I came but with the time share deal it really is dissapointing that their doing that but you can always stay at the Hyatt next door since marriott owns it to and it's not going time share.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so”
Reviews.Author: summer1964
Reviews.Content: This was the second island we visited. After staying at the HHV on Oahu we were sooooo disappointed. We got there before 3 pm. This is a definite no no. You can't get into a room before then. And they leave your luggage right out in the open, anyone could come by and take a small bag. The girl at the desk before 3 pm was not a happy camper and very strick about the rules. When we got to our room it had stains on the rug, it smelled dirty and the toilet didn't flush properly. I didn't even want to touch anything. Also, our view was of the parking lot. We were thinking of trying to switch hotels, but after a long walk on the beach, we went to the desk (new girl behind the counter) and explained the problem about our room and she moved us to a cleaner room with a better view. Same interior, just cleaner. We understood that we were there on a time share special, but I would think if they were trying to get us to buy something we would be in a room that would make us want to stay. The exterior of the hotel (motel type room entrance) was very nice. The beach was not easily accessible from the Marriott, but if you walked a bit you could get on the beach. Once on the beach it was nice in front of the other hotels. Dispite the disappointment in our room we had a great time away from our hotel, which was most of the time. My husband rented clubs and played golf. He was unimpressed with the care they gave the clubs. They had not been cleaned. We went to Whalers Village which is easy to walk to for shopping and restaurants. They also have an ABC store to pick up water and goodies. And it felt safe at night walking. Also, we went into Lahiana and ate at Bubba Gump's and Longhi's. We liked both, especially Bubba's. We went to the Warren and Annabell show in Lahiana which was great. Lahiana is about a 20 minute ride. This was our favorite island. Stay in this area, very nice. Next time we will try the Westin, which looked nice from the outside. But I will read the reviews first. The timeshare was not aggressive at all, which was good. Before we went to the talk we were thinking of buying, but it was high priced and our room was so unimpressive that it was a no. They didn't even take us to a sample unit, so we can't tell you if the timeshare units are nice. He did say that they were doing the hotel over, the rooms need it!

Reviews.Title: “I”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved it and I'm a kid. The water slides were great and the view was just spectacular. It's a kid's dream to come here. From the fabulous rooms to the breath-taking buffet breakfast I definately enjoyed it. My parents had a splendid time and our whole family would certainly come to this hotel again no doubt. I LOVED IT!!

Reviews.Title: “stayed January 2-9”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the maui marriott this past week and had a great time. We are current time share owners at Desert Springs and traded into the Maui Marriott. We traded a one bedroom for a one bedroom so we were unsure what to think the Maui room would be like but I would have to say out of all of the Marriotts we have stayed in this was by far the worst room we have had. From a location stand point it is Number One but for the room it was below average compared to other vacation club timeshares we have stayed in. Basically the two rooms are two hotel rooms with a door connecting them. The breakfast bar is a small fridge, a microwave, and a dishwasher. Every Marriott timeshare we have stayed in has had a full kitchen so not having one was different. We knew going in that this was the case so for Marriott owners who trade in understand that you will not be able to cook in the room. With all that being said we did have a great view of the pool and did have a ocean view from the third floor. For the pool it is by far the most impressive pool I have ever seen. With the water slides and the waterfalls it is a childs paradise and I do mean childs because there is more kids at this place than I have ever seen. If you are traveling on a honeymoon or looking for a relaxing spot away from children this is not the place. Granted we were here during vacation week but there were alot of families and all of the kids were having a great time in the pool. I know that everyone has said that everything is expensive here and they are right for a family of four to go eat just about anywhere on the island is 75-80.00. Kids meals are 6.00 for just about all entrees with fries but does not include a drink so plan on spending 16-18.00 on feeding two kids off of the kids menu. Every resturant we went to pretty much had the same prices. We ate alot of our meals at the Whalers Village at Leilanis and the Hula Grill. Both spots are great and very casual. Try to get there before 7 or you will have an hour wait. We did not do the Marriott Maui because we thought it was too expensive. Our quote for two adults and two kids was 220.00. It seemed way to high for what you received. For excursions we did Trilogy snorkeling with a trip to Molokini for 350.00 which was two adults and two children. You go out on a catamaran and it's alot of fun. We saw whales on the way to Molokini and once there we snorkeled for about 45 minutes and then went to Turtle town and swam with sea turtles. While there the crew made us a great lunch and then we headed back to the harbor. If you do one thing on your trip go onto a trilogy excursion. It was by far the best thing we did. Our 5 and 6 year old children loved the boat and the crew. Overall a great vacation and yes we would go back to the Marriott because it is a great spot to vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “all around pretty good”
Reviews.Author: planningzone
Reviews.Content: I am sitting on my balcony at the Marriott writing this review. I agree with many of the reviews regarding this hotel. It is right on the water, the beach is VERY narrow (15-20 feet MAX), and the rooms are well appointed. I did not find it very expensive, however. At least not as Hawaii resorts go. The American breakfast at the walk-up beachwalk (20 feet from the sand max.) was $8.95 and the breakfast buffet at the sit-down Italian restaurant was $19.95 kids free. Lunch is similar. There are specials as well, happy hour, Weds night sushi. The great thing about this resort is that it is part timeshare part hotel (we are staying in the hotel this week and the timeshare next week) which means you can bring your own provisions to the pool. I recommend you stock-up at the walmart, big-K, or Costco near the airport. This will save you TONS OF MONEY! I bought a smoothie (non-alcoholic) by the pool and it was $7 with tip. The pool is terrific for kids and even adults can avoid the children in certain sections of the behemoth structure. overall, it is pretty nice, especially for families. It is NOT a quiet spot for lovers (honeymooners). It is also located in a very touristy location. If you are looking to get away to a tropical escape, I really don't think this is it. My father in-law who has never been to the islands is coming to Hawaii in two weeks and we are staying in Kapalua to give him more of the Lush island experience. I would not bring him here.

Reviews.Title: “fun for kids!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: one thing is the pool was so big it has a waterslide!and a water fall in the pool!!they have shops in the hotel!but only one bad thing was the ocean!my family are beach bums.so every day we like to go to the beach but we can not!becuse ther is corol every were!and a big tide!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: popcorn18
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from a glorious week at the Marriott. As already written, rooms were great and the furniture in good condition. The pool area is beautiful-waterfalls, waterslides and water temperature is comfortable and pool towels are readily available and not counted. (We've been at places where not returning a towel by a certain hour could result in a charge to the room) What really impressed us was that we had no rental car but could use transporation into Lahaina by shuttle just outside the door of the hotel for $1.00 each and also the hotel provides a car to restaurants nearby. As well, the other hotels and the Whaler's Village were close enoughto walk to so that we didn't feel isolated at all andthe little ABC store had the things we needed for a quick breakfast in the room. I would stay here again if we returned to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “a follow up to residents perspective”
Reviews.Author: Jbuffett
Reviews.Content: EVERYTHING that this review says is 100% accurate. We bought a timeshare at this resort and have not regreted a second of it. There is nothing more I can add to this review. I did note that apparently someone said the beach is far away. If you consider 50 feet from the property a long way then yes it is. Only negative is that because the pool area is so incredible (especially for children) it is crowded (I found out because residents of nearby hotels sneak in) I was there in October 03 and they were starting to address this issue by issuing plastic wrist bands, but did not seem to help alot.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to buy a time share stay here!”
Reviews.Author: GRDiva
Reviews.Content: We were terribly disappointed in our stay here. #1 it was our honeymoon and they wanted us to stay in a double room! Ocean view was considered that even if you couldn't see the ocean - but it was overlooking the pool and hordes of screaming, spoiled brats! Our room was not ready for 3 hours after our arrival and then when finally got to a garden view room after taking a downgrade it overlooked the parking ramp next door. The bed was crappy and the air conditioning full of mold! Yes mold! On top of that they couldn't care less that it was our honeymoon and we had saved this stop intentionally for an ocean view. Finally after much yelling at the front desk we find out that they are turning the place into time shares and will no longer have hotel rooms after April of 2005. You are much better off staying anywhere else in that area - anywhere else! If our stay at the Marriott in Kauai wouldn't have been so wonderful I'd never stay at another Marriott again. It sucked!!! They should tell you when you book about the lack of king rooms with any sort of ocean view - don't plan on getting one unless you are a gold or platinum card holder - at least that's what the only helpful person at the front desk finally told me! Stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott Ocean club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this place so much that we bought a timeshare. Only downfalls were that there wasn't better perks for the timeshare owners while staying there and for purchasing, and service was a little slow poolside. It took 25 minutes to get a bottle of water! Prices are high....but so it is all over Maui! There is always a special going on someplace in Maui though. It is just too bad that the Marriott doesn't offer them so that you don't have to leave the resort in search of them! The breakfast buffet is great. Good food and good variety. Didn't get a chance to try the Marriott luau, but when I saw the seating I didn't want to. I don't like the luau's that cram you in like sardines. The best luau by far is the Feast at Lele. You have your own personal table and wait staff and the show is absolutely beautiful. Pricy....but well worth it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Marriott Ocean Club Luau not authentic??? oh no! no! no!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Luau was entertaining and fine. Nothing designed for hordes of tourists are ever "authentic". Authentic Hawaiians never drank Blue Hawaiis, Lava Flow or MaiTai cocktails nor danced in artificial grass skirts or served Teriyaki Chicken and chocolate cake either. Santa Clause, the tooth fairy, and the Easter Bunny are all make believe too, but I don't hear kids yelling for refunds. I learned in my travels that Chicago is NOT really a "Windy City", nor is Illinois really the "Land of Lincoln".....I want my money back too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Marriott's Maui Ocean Club”
Reviews.Author: mambo3121
Reviews.Content: We were here for our 5 year anniversary and had a wonderful time. The grounds are beautiful and well kept, the pool is wonderful for both adults and kids, though not too many kids when we were there Oct 27-Nov 4th. We were lucky as I had Marriott points so we stayed 4 nights for free and paid for 2. I was hoping as a Marriott rewards member that they would upgrade us since we were there for anniversary but did not happen. We splurged and spent some extra points for an ocean view room and it was well worth it. Beautiful view of the pool and ocean. Everyone there was very nice and helpful.The room was clean and functional, nothing extraordinary, but what you come to expect from a Marriott. The room had a small refrigerator as well which came in handy. When you arrive in Maui, make sure you stop at the KMart 1 mile from airport. You can stock up on snacks, beer, soda's , water for much cheaper than the ABC stores in Lahaina. We were on a tight budget so we also stopped in town at Safeway and got a safeway shopper card which helped as well. The refrigerator is big enough to hold several waters, soda, beer , lunch meat etc... Dining in Maui is expensive so we did our own breakfast and lunch in the room. At sunset, we would sit on the balcony and have beer/wine and snacks. Very beautiful and then we would splurge on dinner. Hula grill is nice. Note to football fans, Sunday Ticket is available at Rusty Harpoon in Whaler's Village beginning at 8am Maui time! Nice because you have all the games on and turn your head and the beautiful ocean is right in front of you. If you want to eat on the cheap, there are coupons in some of the local travel guides. We walked to Johnny's Burger Joint, just down the main road, Kanaapali Parkway. They had a coupon for burger, fries and a beer $7.99 Also, good pizza place above it. Across the street from them is the golf course and their restaurant is called Mango Grill. They have happy hour from 3-6 with some good beer specials and appetizers. There is a shuttle at the bottom of the hill of the Marriott property, $1 each way takes you into Lahaina and you don't have to worry about parking. We ate at both Cheeseburger in Paradise and Hard Rock Cafe just to say we did it. As far as activities, we had a surfing lesson at the Marriott which was alot of fun, the instructor was great and we were the only 2 students so nice, personalized attention. We drove the road north of Kanaapali, thru Kapalua and beyond and it was beautiful but curvey and somewhat nerve racking. A preview of the road to Hana I believe, we didnt make it there this time but definetly will next time. The walking path that goes along the beach is great for morning walk/jog and nice for an evening stroll as well, plus it takes you directly to Whalers Village for restaurants and shops. All in all a wonderful place to stay. Please email with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Love the place and am purchasing a timeshare!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Maui from August 25 to September 9, 2004 and attended several timeshare presentations. Although we were staying at the Embassy Suites, we liked the layout of the Marriott better. We found the developer's timeshare prices to be very high; however, there is a great secondary market for timeshares on Maui. It is possible to save a great deal of money by making your purchase directly from an individual who purchased their timeshare from the developer. Obviously the developer's representative will try to tell you that you are really loosing out if you don't make your purchase from them. It is true that you will not be able to use the Marriott points conversion if you don't purchase from Marriott, but you will still be able to enroll in Interval and have the same trading ability. We are not making our purchase for trading purposes because we intend to visit this property every year. If you look into making your timeshare purchase on the secondary market, you will discover that you can save 30 to 35 percent on the more upscale rooms. We are purchasing an ocean front room from the original purchaser. The Marriott Ocean Club appears to hold its value better than the Embassy Suites because you can save almost 50 percent if you purchase an Embassy timeshare, but I looked for a long time and could not duplicate that savings. I believe that the location of the Marriott is far superior to the Embassy. We have a friend that has actually purchased a total of eight weeks at the Marriott. He made his original purchases from Marriott, but he is now making his purchases in the secondary market. There are usually several Marriott listings on E-Bay, but I don't know how much protection you would have if you purchase from a seller at auction. I liked going through a broker so that I would obtain title insurance. This is a great property and you will need to use a timeshare once it is completely converted.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: totika
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 week stay in Hawaii... five nights of which were spent at the Marriott, Maui. September 5-10. The people and the place were terrific. We used our Marriott points to pay for the five nights and chose to pay $80 per night extra for a deluxe ocean view room. Check-in was quick and painless. They did not have a king bed so they gave us an ocean view with two doubles... reduced the nightly rate to $60 and paid for our valet parking. The room was big and comfortable with a beautiful view. The staff couldn't have been nicer. The location is terrific with an easy walk to Whalers Village. The pool is great. The restaurants are expensive... but they have the Beach Market Store right next to the pool, which offers good food at better prices. The only downside is that they are converting the entire resort to timeshares. That will change the way they run it. They have already converted half of the resort to time share and will begin doing the rest in April. Too Bad. As a resort its great. But timeshares don't interest me.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott's Maui Ocean Club
HotelInfo.Address: 100 Nohea Kai Dr, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
